proverbList.proverb: A little too late, is much too late.
proverbList.explanation: Biroz kech qolgan ancha kech qolgan bilan teng, kech qolishning oz yoki ko`pligiga qaramasdan, u baribir kech qolishdir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Kech boshlagan kechikar.
Qolgan ishga qor yog`ar.

proverbList.proverb: He is not poor that has little, but he that desires much.
proverbList.explanation: Kam narsasi bor kambag`al emas, ko`p narsa xohlaydigan kambag`aldir.
proverbList.equivalent:
O`zi to`ysa ham, ko`zi to`ymaydi.
Yeb yetti bo`lmagan, yalab yetmish bo`lmas.
Yeb to`ymagan, yalab to`ymas.

proverbList.proverb: He that desires but little has no need of much.
proverbList.explanation: Oz narsa xohlaydigan kishining ko`p narsaga ehtiyoji yo`q.
proverbList.equivalent:
Oz demak - soz demak, oz yemak - soz yemak.
Oz bo‘lsin, soz bo‘lsin.

proverbList.proverb: He that eats least eats most.
proverbList.explanation: Kam-kamdan yegan kishi eng ko`pini yeydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Oz-ozdan yegan uzoq yashaydi.
Oz-oz ye, doim ye.

proverbList.proverb: Less is more.
proverbList.explanation: Soddalik, oz miqdorlilik va aniqlik yaxshi ko`rinishdir, ya'ni soddalik va aniqlik ko`p narsani yaxshi ifodalay oladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Oz demak - soz demak, oz yemak - soz yemak.
Oz bo`lsin, soz bo`lsin.

proverbList.proverb: Politeness costs little, but yields much.
proverbList.explanation: Xushmuomalalikning narxi past, insonning xushmuomala bo`lishi uchun ko`p narsa kerak emas, lekin u juda ko`p hosil beradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yaxshi gap bilan ilon indan chiqar.
Sovuq-sovuq so`zlasang, qilich chiqar qinidan, Iliq-iliq so`zlasang, ilon chiqar inidan.

proverbList.proverb: Promise little, but do much.
proverbList.explanation: Vadani kamroq berish kerak, lekin vada berildimi, uni albatta amalga oshirish kerak, ya`ni amalda ko`proq ish qilish lozim.
proverbList.equivalent: Aytilgan gap - otilgan o`q.

proverbList.proverb:
Short reckonings make long friends.
Short accounts make long friends.
proverbList.explanation: O`z vaqtida amalga oshirilgan hisob-kitob do`stlikka zarar yetqazmaydi va do`stlikning umrini uzaytiradi.
proverbList.equivalent: Hisobli do`st ayrilmas.

proverbList.proverb: Short  debts make long firends.
proverbList.explanation: Do`stlar orasida uzilgan qarz ularning do`stligini uzaytiradi.
proverbList.equivalent: Hisobli do`st ayrilmas.

proverbList.proverb: Better a lean peace than a fat victory.
proverbList.explanation: Urushdan keladigan katta ga`labadan ko`ra kichik bo`lsa ham tinchlik yaxshi, ya'ni tinchlikka hech narsa yetmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Och qornim - tinch qulog`im.
Urush - ofat, tinchlik - farog`at.

proverbList.proverb: Better early than late.
proverbList.explanation: Kechdan ko‘ra erta yaxshi, ya’ni har ishni kechikib bajargandan ko‘ra ertaroq bajargan afzaldir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Erta turgan ish bitirar, Kech qolgan armon qilar.*
Erta turgan ish bitirar, Kech turgan ko‘p turtinar.
Ekinni erta yiqqan xirmon qilar, Kech qolgan armon qilar.
Erta ekkan butun olar, Kechga qolgan – o‘tin.
Kechning xazinasidan Ertaning nasibasi yaxshi.
Uch kun barvaqt turgan bir kun yutar.

proverbList.proverb: The early man never borrows from the late man.
proverbList.explanation: Erta ish boshlaydigan kishining hech qachon kech ish boshlaydigan kishiga muhtojligi bo‘lmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Erta turgan ish bitirar, Kech qolgan armoq qilar.
Erta turgan ish bitirar, Kech turgan ko‘p turtinar.
Ekinni erta yiqqan xirmon qilar, Kech qolgan armon qilar.
Erta ekkan butun olar, Kechga qolgan – o‘tin.
Uch kun barvaqt turgan bir kun yutar.

proverbList.proverb: Better to reign in hell, than serve in heaven.
proverbList.explanation: Jannatda xizmat qilgandan ko`ra do`zaxda hukmronlik qilgan afzal.

proverbList.proverb: Buy in the cheapest market and sell in the dearest.
proverbList.explanation: Arzon bozordan xarid qil va uni qimmat bozorda sot, tadbirkorlikning foydasi shundan olinadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Turkistonda qo`y bir so`m, kela-kel o`n bir so`m.
Otang-bozor, Onang-bozor.

proverbList.proverb: Cheapest is the dearest.
proverbList.explanation: Oson qo`lga kiritilgan narsalar han ba'zida eng kerakli va muhim ahamiyatga ega bo`ladi.

proverbList.proverb: Cheap is dear in the long run.
proverbList.explanation: Arzon narsa ham vaqt o`tishi bilan qimmatbaxo narsaga aylanishi mumkin yoki uzoq safarda kerakli buyum bo`ladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ot qadri safarda bilinar.

proverbList.proverb: Forethought is easy, repentance hard.
proverbList.explanation: Kelajak uchun reja tuzish oson, lekin so`ngida pushaymon bo`lish yomon.
proverbList.equivalent:
Keyingi pushaymon – o‘zingga dushman.
So`ngi pushaymon - o`zinga dushman.

proverbList.proverb: Fortune is easily found, but hard to be kept.
proverbList.explanation: Omad, baxt va davlat oson topiladi, lekin uni ushlab qolish qiyin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Omadini ushlab qolish har kishining o`z qo`lida.
Har kimning taqdiri o`z qo`lida.

proverbList.proverb: A good beginning makes a good ending.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshi boshlangan ishning nihoyasi ham yaxshi bo`ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Avvali yaxshi bo`lsa, oxiri shoyli bo`lur.
Bismillohdan boshlangan ishning yakuni yaxshi bo`lar.
Yaxshi niyat yarim mol.

proverbList.proverb: A bad beginning makes a bad ending.
proverbList.explanation: Yomon boshlangan ish yomon tugaydi.

proverbList.proverb: A man has choice to begin love, but not to end it.
proverbList.explanation: Kishining o`z qalbida sevgi tuyg`usini paydo qilishi o`z qo`lida, lekin unga yetishish, yoki sevgisini unitish uning qo`lida emas.
proverbList.equivalent: Hamma dardga bor davo, oshiqlik dardi bedavo.

proverbList.proverb: Anger begins with folly and ends with repentance.
proverbList.explanation: G`azab bilan qilingan ish ahmoqona boshlanadi va afsuslanish bilan tugaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Jahl kelganda, aql ketadi.
G`azab - oldinda, aql - keyinda.

proverbList.proverb: Better never begin than never make an end.
proverbList.explanation: Hech tugatilmaydigan ishni boshlamagan yaxshi.
proverbList.equivalent: Tugamaydigan ishni boshlamagan ma'qul.

proverbList.proverb: Good to begin well, better to end well
proverbList.explanation: Ishni yaxshi boshlash yaxshi, uni yaxshi tugatish undan ham yaxshi.
proverbList.equivalent: Avvalini berguncha, oxirini bersin.

proverbList.proverb: He begins to die that quits his desires.
proverbList.explanation: Orzu-umid qilishni to`xtatgan inson o`lishni boshlaydi, ya'ni orzu-umidsiz inson jonsiz tanadek bo`lib qoladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Joni borning umidi bor.
Umid o`rga tortar, umidsizlik go`rga.

proverbList.proverb: In every beginning think of the ending.
proverbList.explanation: Ishni boshlayotgan inson uning nihoyasi haqida albatta o`ylashi lozim.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ish avvalini bir o`ylasang, oxirini besh o`yla.
O`ylamay qilingan turmush to`ydan keyin buzilar.

proverbList.proverb: Well begun is half done.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshi boshlangan ishning yarmi qilingan hisoblanadi, ya'ni yaxshi boshlangan ish tez bitadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Avvali yaxshi bo`lsa, oxiri shoyli bo`lur.
Bismillohdan boshlangan ishning yakuni yaxshi bo`lar.
Yaxshi niyat yarim mol.

proverbList.proverb: A light purse is a heavy curse.
proverbList.explanation: Yengil yoki ichi bo`sh hamyon og`ir qarg`ishdir, ya'ni kambag`allik insonni jahlini chiqaradi va kayfiyatni tushiradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bepul bozorga borguncha, kafan olib bozorga bor.
Borga - bor dunyo, yo`qqa yo`q dunyo.

proverbList.proverb:
A light purse is a heavy heart.
A light purse makes a heavy heart.
proverbList.explanation: Yengil yoki ichi bo`sh hamyon o`gir yurakdir, ya'ni kambag`allik kayfiyatni tushiradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bepul bozorga borguncha, kafan olib bozorga bor.
Borga - bor dunyo, yo`qqa yo`q dunyo.

proverbList.proverb: Light burden is heavy if far borne.
proverbList.explanation: Yengil yuk ko`p ko`tarib yurilsa og`ir tuyiladi, yoki oddiy qiyinchilikka ko`p vaqt davomida sabr qilinsa, u ham katta qiyinchilikdek tuyiladi.

proverbList.proverb: The nearer the church, the farther from God.
proverbList.explanation: Cherkovga yaqinroq, Xudodan uzoqroq, ya'ni cherkovga yaqin yashagani yoki u yerda ishlagani bilan inson agar yomonliklar qilsa, u ham Xudoni oldida gunohkordir. Ba'zi ruhoniylar insonlarga yaxshilik qilishni uqtirsada, ularning o`zlari ham o`z aytganlariga rioya qilmay gunoh ishlar qilishadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki mulla - bir kishi, bir mulla - yorti kishi.
Hamma mulla - bir mulla, ming mulla - bir tilla.
Mullani aytganini qil, qilganini qilma.
Mulla, mullaning  ishi hiyla.

proverbList.proverb: A new broom sweeps clean, but the old brush knows all the corners.
proverbList.explanation: Yangi supurgi toza supiradi, lekin eski supurgi har bir burchakni biladi, ya'ni yoshi kattalar ko`p narsani biladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Olti yashardan so`rama. oltmish yashardan so`ra.
Qari bilganni pari bilmas.
O`zim hisoblasam, qulunli biya, otam bilan hisoblasam bo`tali biya.

proverbList.proverb: Only with a new ruler you do realise the value of the old.
proverbList.explanation: Yangi boshliq kelganda eskisini qadri bilinadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Yangining nodonligi bor, eskining - qadrdonligi.*

proverbList.proverb: You can't put new wine in old bottles.
proverbList.explanation: Yangi vinoni eski idishlarga qo`ya olmaysiz, yoki keksalarga yoshlarning odatlarini o`rgatish qiyin.

proverbList.proverb: Better an open enemy than a false friend.
proverbList.explanation: Yolg`on do`stdan ochiq dushman yaxshi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ablah do`st dushmandan yomon, Ne hiyla bilsa, ishlatar oson.*

proverbList.proverb: Comparisons make enemies of our friends.
proverbList.explanation: Boshqalarga qiyoslab biz o`z do`stlarimizni dushmanga aylantirib qo`yishimiz mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Aybsiz do`st izlagan do`stsiz qolar.

proverbList.proverb: The enemy of my enemy is my friend.
proverbList.explanation: Dushmanimga dushman bo`lgan kishi menga do`st hisoblanadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Dushmanimning do‘sti – mening dushmanim, Dushmanimning dushmani – mening do‘stim.

proverbList.proverb: Misfortune makes foes of friends.
proverbList.explanation: Baxtsizlikka uchrasang do`stlaring ham tark etib, do`st, dushmanga aylanib ketishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Moling borida - ana do`st, moling yo`g`ida - qani do`st.
Yengi yo`qning tengi yo`q.

proverbList.proverb: An empty vessel gives a greater sound than a full barrel.
proverbList.explanation: Bo`sh kosa ichi to`la tog`oradan ko`ra balandroq jaranglaydi, ya`ni miyasi bo`sh inson aqlli insonga nisbatan ko`proq gapiradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Aqlli ish sevar, aqlsiz - so`z.
Ahmoq aql o`rgatar.

proverbList.proverb: Children are poor men's riches.
proverbList.explanation: Kambag`al insonlar farzandlarini o`z boyliklari sanab, o`z kelajagini farzandlarining qo`lida rohatda o`tadi deb hisoblashadi.

proverbList.proverb: Poor men seek meat for their stomach, rich men stomach for their meat.
proverbList.explanation: Kambag`al qornini to`yg`azush uchun g`osht izlaydi, boy inson go`shti ko`pligidan unga joy topa olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Boy bo`lsang, kunda hayit, kunda to`y, yo`q bo`lsang, kunda hasrat, kunda o`y.
Boyga - shifokor, kambag`alga - duo.*
Borga yetti kun hayit, yo`qqa - bir kun.*
Kambag`al - topganda, boy - sog`inganda.*
Ulkan uydagi kulsa, kichkina uydagi yig`lar.*

proverbList.proverb: Poor men go to heaven as soon as rich.
proverbList.explanation: Kambag`al ham boy kabi jannatga kira oladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Kambag`allik ayb emas.
Shoh-u gado bir qabrda yotar.

proverbList.proverb: Weak things united become strong.
proverbList.explanation: Kuchsiz narsalar yig`ilib kuchli bo`ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Birlashgan - o`zar, birlashmagan - to`zar.
Birlashgan daryo bo`lar, Tarqalgan irmoq bo`lar.*

proverbList.proverb: Habits are at first cobwebs, at last cables.
proverbList.explanation: Odatlar avval o`rgimchak to`ridek bo`ladi, oxirida esa yo`gon arqonga aylanadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
O`rgangan ko`ngil o`rtansa qo`ymas.
Tarki odat - amri mahol.
Bir bo`lgan ikki bo`lmay qolmas, ikki bo`lgan uch bo`lmay qolmas, uch bo`lgan doim bo`lmay qolmas.*

proverbList.proverb: Just as the twig is bent, the tree is inclined.
proverbList.explanation: Daraxt novdaligida qanday qayrilgan bo`lsa, u daraxt bo`lganida ham shunday egiladi, ya'ni voyaga yetgan inson bolaligida qanday tarbiya olgan bo`lsa, shunday o`zini tutadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Qush uyasida ko`rganini qiladi.
Daraxtdan meva olaman desang, Niholligidan parvarish qil.*

proverbList.proverb: Knowledge has bitter roots but sweet fruits.
proverbList.explanation: Ilmning ildizi achchiq bo`lsa ham, mevasi shirin, ya'ni ilm egallash mashaqqatli jarayon, lekin uning natijasi yoqimlidir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ilm olish - igna bilan quduq qazish.
Ilmning avvali achchiq, so`ngi - totli.*

proverbList.proverb: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
proverbList.explanation: Sabr qilish qiyin, lekin uning mevasi, ya'ni natijasi oltin, shirin bo`ladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Sabr(ning) tagi - sariq oltin.

proverbList.proverb: Argues come on horseback, but go away on foot.
proverbList.explanation: Kelishmovchilik otning ustida kelar, lekin piyoda ketar, ya'ni nizolar yoki muammolar tez vujudga keladi, lekin juda sekin yo`q bo`ladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Dard botmonlab kelar, misqollab chiqar.

proverbList.proverb:
Easy come, easy go
Light come, light go.
proverbList.explanation: Oson qo`lga kiritilgan yoki kelgan narsa oson ketadi yoki sarflanadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Oson kelgan boylik oson ketadi.

proverbList.proverb: Quickly come, quickly go.
proverbList.explanation: Tez qo`lga kiritilgan yoki kelgan narsa tezda keatdi yoki sarflanadi
proverbList.equivalent:
Birinchi kelgan birinchi ketadi.*
Erta kelgan erta ketar.*
Tez kelgan tez ketar.*

proverbList.proverb: Ill - gotten, ill - spent.
proverbList.explanation: Qing`ir va yomon yo`l bilan topilgan mol-dunyo xuddi shu yo`l bilan sarf bo`lib ketadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Haromdan kelgan haromga ketar.*
Halol pishib chiqar, harom teshib chiqar.

proverbList.proverb: It is better to give than to receive.
proverbList.explanation: Qabul qilib olgndan ko`ra bergan yaxshi, chunki bergan odamni ko`proq yaxshi ko`rishadi va duo qilishadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Sen birovga birni bersang, Xudo senga mingni beradi.
Olgan mard emas, bergan - mard.
Bergan qo‘l – aziz.

proverbList.proverb: Give and take is fair play.
proverbList.explanation: Bermoq va olmoq adolatli o`yindir, ya'ni inson boshqa bir insonga biror narsa bergaindan so`ng undan biror narsa olishi lozim, shundagina adolatli bo`ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bor tovog`im, kel tovog`im, kelishingda quruq bo`lsang, o`rta yerda sin tovog`im.
Bor tovog`im, kel tovo`gim, bormasang kelmasang, o`rta yerda sin tovog`im.
Olmoqni bermog`i bor, yemoqni qusmog`i.

proverbList.proverb: Past experiences are best guide for future undertakings.
proverbList.explanation: O`tmish tajribalari kelajakdagi muhim ishlar uchun eng yaxshi yo`lni ko`rsatuvchi qo`llanma bo`ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Boshidan o`tgan - tabib.
Oldinga bir qarasang, orqanga o`n qara.
Tarix - kelajakning poydevori.

proverbList.proverb: A long tongue is a sign of a short hand.
proverbList.explanation: Uzun til qisqa qo`ldan darak beradi, ya'ni ko`p gapiradigan, ko`p vada beradigan inson aslida ko`p ishlarni amalga oshira olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Gap desang, qop-qop, ish desang Samarqanddan top.
Gap desang, qop-qop, ish desang - betob.
Gapga - chechan, ishga - mechan.
Dangasaga ish buyursang, otangdan ortiq nasihat qilar.

proverbList.proverb: Art is long and life is short.
proverbList.explanation: San'at darajasidagi ishni, yoki biror buyuk ishni amalga oshirish uchun odatda ko`p vaqt talab qilinadi, lekin hayot qisqadir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Besh kunim – xush kunim.
Inson umri – daryo suvi.
Umr – oqar daryo.
Gap ko‘p, umr oz.

proverbList.proverb: Long foretold, long last; short notice, soon past.
proverbList.explanation: Ob-havoning o`zgarishi haqida oldindan belgi beruvchi alomatlar ular ifodalayotgan o`zgarishlar o`rtasidagi vaqt qancha ko`p bo`lsa, bunday ob-havo uzoq davom etadi va aksincha holatda davomiyligi qisqa bo`ladi.

proverbList.proverb: Of the ten fingers, some are long and some are short.
proverbList.explanation: O'nta barmoqdan ba'zilari uzun, ba'zilari kalta, ya'ni odamlar va ularning hayot tarzi har xil bo`ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Besh qo‘l barobar emas.
Besh barmoq barobar emas.
Bir ikki bo`lmas, bit sirka bo`lmas.
Kishi bilan kishi teng bo`lmas.

proverbList.proverb: The longest way round is the shortest way home.
proverbList.explanation: Biror yumushni ehtiyotkorlik bilan o`z yo`l-yo`rig`i bo`yicha qilish qiyin va uzoq vaqt talab qiladigandek ko`rinadi, aslida bu holat ehtiyotsizlik bilan qilinadigan ishdan ancha kam vaqtni oladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ko`z qo`rqoq, qo`l botir.

proverbList.proverb: Advice when most needed is least heeded.
proverbList.explanation: Muammoli holatlarni yechishda maslahat kerak bo`lgan paytda, odamlar o`zlari bilmagan holda ularga berilgan maslahatga e'tibor berishmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Maslahatsiz ish - o`rinsiz tashvish.

proverbList.proverb: Good words are worth much and cost little
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshi so‘z ko‘p narsaga qodir, lekin narxi past; ya’ni yaxshi gapni aytishga ham yomon gapni aytish uchun ham bir xil kuch sarflanadi, lekin yaxshi gapning natijasi yomon gapnikidan yaxshidir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yaxshi gap bilan ilon inidan chiqar.
Shirin so‘z o‘likni ham tiriltirar.
Yaxshi gap ham, yomon gap ham bir og‘izdan chiqadi.
Sovuq-sovuq so‘zlasang, Qilich chiqar qinidan, Iliq-iliq so‘zlasang, Ilon chiqar inidan.

proverbList.proverb: He who considers too much will perform little.
proverbList.explanation: Juda ko`p o`ylaydigan, hadeb ikkilanaveradigan kishi o`z ishlarini kamdan-kam amalga oshiradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
O‘ychi o‘yini o‘ylaguncha, Tavakkalchi ishini bitiradi.
O‘ychi o‘yi bitguncha, Tavakkalchining to‘yi bitar.

proverbList.proverb: Many are called but few are chosen.
proverbList.explanation: Ko‘pchilik chaqiriladi, biroq kamchilik tanlab olinadi. Bu maqol xristianlik dini bilan bog‘liq bo‘lgan rivoyatdan olingan bo‘lib, unda Xudo jannatga ko‘pchilikni chaqiradi, lekin ulardan faqat bir nechtasigina (Xudoga va uning qudratiga ishonganlar) bu ovozni eshita oladi va ular jannatga kira oladi(15) deyiladi.

proverbList.proverb: More haste, less speed.
proverbList.explanation: Shoshqaloqlik bilan qilingan ish tez bitmaydi, aksincha ko`proq vaqtni oladi, yoki umuman muvaffaqiyatsizlikka uchraydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Chopib borgan yerga, Yurib borsa ham bo‘lar.
Oshiqmagan olisga yetar.
Shoshgan qiz erga yolchimas.
Shoshganning ishi o‘ngmas.
Shoshmasang tez yetasan, Shoshgandan o‘zib ketasan.

proverbList.proverb: Much cry and little wool.
proverbList.explanation: Ko`p baqirib chaqirgani bilan, aslida yung ko`p emas. O`rta asrlarda savdogarlar baqirib xaridorlarni chaqirishgan, lekin ularda har doim ham baqirganlariga yarasha serob mahsulot bo`lmagan.
proverbList.equivalent:
Vahimasi osmonda, qo`lida misi ham yo`q.
Baqiroq sigir sutsiz bo`lar.

proverbList.proverb: Much law but little justice.
proverbList.explanation: Qonun ko`p, lekin adolat kam. Davlat tomonidan chiqarilgan qonunlar ko`p bo`lishiga qaramay, jamiyatda adolat har doim ham qaror topavermaydi.

proverbList.proverb: The more a man dreams, the less he believes.
proverbList.explanation: Ko`proq hayol surgan kishi haqiqiy hayotda kamroq narsaga ishonadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Har kimning bir o`yi bor, hayolida ming qo`yi bor.

proverbList.proverb: The more haste, the less speed.
proverbList.explanation: Shoshqaloqlik bilan qilingan ish tez bitmaydi, aksincha ko`proq vaqtni oladi, yoki umuman muvaffaqiyatsizlikka uchraydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Chopib borgan yerga, yurib borsa ham bo`lar.
Shoshgan qiz erga yolchimas.
Shoshganning ishi o`ngmas.
Shoshmasang tez yetasan, shoshgandan o`zib ketasan.

proverbList.proverb: Who knows most, speaks least.
proverbList.explanation: Ko`p bilgan kam so`zlaydi, kaltabin insongina ko`p gapiradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Aqlli oz so`zlar, ahmoq ko`p so`zlar.
Ko`p bilgan kam gapirar.
Sayoz daryo shovqin oqar, chuqur daryo sokin oqar.
Ko`p bilgan oz so`zlar, oz bo`lsa ham soz so`zlar.

proverbList.proverb: The fat man knoweth not what the lean thinketh.
proverbList.explanation: Semiz kishi ozg`in kishi nima o`ylayotganini bilmaydi, ya'ni o`ziga to`q yoki muammosi yo`q inson qiynalgan, kambag`al yoki muammoda qolgan odamning muammosi bilan hech ishi bo`lmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Qorni to`qni qorni och bilan ishi yo`q.
Dard topmagan dard bilmas.
Kasal dardini sog` bilmas, och qadrini to`q bilmas.
Tanasi boshqa dard bilmas, uyi boshqa g`am bilmas.

proverbList.proverb: Faults are thick where love is thin.
proverbList.explanation: Muhabbat kuchsiz joyda ayb va xatolar kuchayadi, ya'ni mehr-muhabbat kam bo`lgan holatda, insonlar bir-biridan doim kamchilik qidiradi, aksincha bo`lsa, mavjud xato va ayblar ham ko`zga ko`rinmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Muhabbat ketsa, nafrat kelar.
Sevgi kamaysa, nafrat kuchayadi.
Muhabbatning ko`zi ko`r.
Sevgining ko`zi ayb ko`rmas.

proverbList.proverb: All things are difficult before they are easy.
proverbList.explanation: Har qanday ish dastavval qiyin ko`rinadi, bajarilganda esa osonligi bilinadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ko`z - qo`rqoq, qo`l - botir.

proverbList.proverb: A chain is no stronger than its weakest link.
proverbList.explanation: Zanjir undagi eng zaif halqasidan kuchli bo`la olmaydi, chunki shi halqa uzilsa, zanjir ham uziladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ip ingichka yeridan uzilar.
Daraxt - ildizi bilan, odam - do`stlari bilan.

proverbList.proverb: It is good to have some friends both in heaven and hell.
proverbList.explanation: Jannatda ham, do`zaxda ham do`stlaring bo`lgani yaxshi, ya'ni har joyda tanish va do`stlarni borligi foyda beradi.
proverbList.equivalent: Do`sting yoninga bo`lsa, ishing oson bitadi.

proverbList.proverb: A heavy purse makes a light heart.
proverbList.explanation: Og`ir hamyon yurakni yengillatadi, ya'ni hamyoni to`la inson xavotirda bo`lmaydi, ozini baxtsiz his qilmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Pul - belga quvvat, boshga - toj.
Pul tilni biyron, dastni daroz qilar.

proverbList.proverb: An old cart well used may outlast a new one abused.
proverbList.explanation: Avaylab ishlatilgan eski arava ehtiyotsizlik bilan ishlatilgan yangi aravadan ko`ra ko`proq xizmat qiladi.

proverbList.proverb: Forsake not old friends for new.
proverbList.explanation: Yangi do`stlarni deb eski do`stlardan voz kechilmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Kiyimning yangisi - yaxshi, do`stning - eskisi.
Qadim do`stlik zanglamas.

proverbList.proverb: Patience under old injures invites new ones.
proverbList.explanation: Eski yara va jarohatlarga qarshi ish ko`rmagan, ya'ni davolamagan odamda yangi yaralar vujudga keladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Bir illat ikkinchisini chaqiradi, bir yo`lgon keyingisini.

proverbList.proverb: You cannot teach an old dog new tricks.
proverbList.explanation: Qari itga yangi qiliq o`rgatib bo`lmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Yoshlikda bilgani - toshga yozgani, qarilikda bilgani - muzga yozgani.

proverbList.proverb:
False friends are worse than open enemies.
False friends are worse than bitter enemies.
proverbList.explanation: Soxta, yolg`onchi do`st ochiq dushmandan ham yomondir. Soxta do`st kuchli adovatli dushmandan ham yomondir.
proverbList.equivalent: Soxta do`stdan ochiq dushman yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: God defend me from my friends, from my enemies, I can defend myself.
proverbList.explanation: Xudo meni do`stlarimdan himoya qil, dushmanlarimdan o`zim himoyalana olaman. Ya'ni dushmanlar o`z dushmanliklarini ochiq-oydin ko`rsatadi, lekin soxta do`stning asl qiyofasini faqat Xudo bila oladi, shuning uchun ularning yomonliklaridan Xudoni o`zi asrasin.
proverbList.equivalent: Do`stlarimdan o`zing saqla, dushmanlarimni o`zim bilaman.

proverbList.proverb: A friend's frown is better than a foe's smile.
proverbList.explanation: G`amning kulgusidan do`stning xo`mrayishi yaxshidir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Do`st achitib gapirar, dushman - kuldirib.
Do‘st achitib gapirar, Dushman – kuldirib.
Do‘st yig‘latar, Dushman kuldirar.
Do‘st kuydirib aytar, Dushman – suydirib.
Dushmanning suyganidan, Do‘stning urgani yaxshi.
Dushmanning donidan, Do‘stning somoni yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: He that is full of himself is very empty.
proverbList.explanation: Faqat o`zini yaxshi ko`radigan odamning qalbi bo`sh bo`ladi, unda o`zgalarga nisbatan mehr-muhabbat bo`lmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: O`zim degan o`zgalarni bilmas.

proverbList.proverb:
Think of the end before you begin.
Think on the end before you begin.
proverbList.explanation: Bior ishni boshlashdan oldin uning nihoyasini qanday bo`lishi haqida o`ylash lozim.
proverbList.equivalent: Ish avvalini bir o`ylasang, oxirini besh o`yla.

proverbList.proverb: Anger makes a rich man hated, and a poor man scorned.
proverbList.explanation: Boy jahl qilsa, uni yomon ko`rishadi, kambag`al jahl qilsa, uni behurmat qilishadi, ya'ni boy jahl qilsa, unga bildirmasdan nafratlanishadi, kambag`alga esa oshkora hurmatsizlik ko`rsatishadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Bermasa ham boy yaxshi, yemasang ham boy yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: A rich miser is poorer than a poor man.
proverbList.explanation: Ziqna boy kambag`al odamdan ham kambag`alroqdir, chunki u ziqna bo`lgani uchun boyligini umuman oshkor etmaydi va baxilligi boyligi qancha bo`lishiga qaramay ozdek tuyilaveradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Baxilniki doim 'yo`q', saxiy yo`q bo`lsa ham to`q.
Baxil to`ymas, baxilligini qo`ymas.
Kambag`alning to`yi to`kin bo`lar, boyning to`yi yupun bo`lar.
Boyga mehmon bo`lsang, baqirasan, kambag`alga mehmon bo`lsang, kekirasan.
Boyga mehmon bo`lsang joning chiqar, kambag`alga mehmon bo`lsang qoming chiqar.*

proverbList.proverb: A good name is sooner lost than won.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshi nomga qiyinchilik bilan uzoq vaqt davomida erishiladi, lekin uni juda qisqa vaqt oralig`ida yo`qotish mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Obro` misqollab kelar, qadoqlab ketar.

proverbList.proverb: Better a glorious death than a shameful life.
proverbList.explanation: Uyatga qolib yashagandan sharafli o`lim topgan afzaldir
proverbList.equivalent:
Uyat – o`limdan qattiq.
Uyatli hayotdan sharafli o`lim yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: He who pleased everybody died before he was born.
proverbList.explanation: Hammani birdek xursand qiladigan odam tug`ilishidan avval o`lgan, ya’ni hech kim hammani birdek ko`nglini ko`tara olmaydi va hammaga birdek yoqavermaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Hammaga birdek yoqadigan odam onasidan hali tug`ilmagan.

proverbList.proverb: England is the paradise of women, the hell of horses, and the purgatory of servants.
proverbList.explanation: Angliya – ayollar uchun jannat, otlar uchun do`zax va xizmatkorlar uchun arosatdir. O`rta asrlarda Angliyada ayollarning ko`pchiligi yaxshi hayot kechishardi va ularni erkaklar odatda hurmat qilishardi, otlar esa transport vositasi sifatida doim xizmatda bo`lgan, xizmatkorlar ham odatda qiyin hayot kechirishgan, lekin ba’zida xizmatkorlar hayoti yengil ham bo`lgan.

proverbList.proverb: When the oak is before the ash, then you will only get a splash; when the ash is before the oak, then you may expect a soak.
proverbList.explanation: Eman shumtoldan avval barg chiqarsa, o‘`sha yili yog`ingarchilik ko`p bo`ladi, agar shumtol emandan avval ko`karsa, o`sha yili qurg`oqchilik bo`ladi.

proverbList.proverb: He who begins many things, finishes but few.
proverbList.explanation: Ko`p ishni birdaniga boshlab olgan inson ularning hammasini tugata olmaydi, faqat bir nechtasinigina tugatishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki quyonni quvlagan birini ham tutolmas.
Ko`pga yugurgan ozdan qolar.
Ko`p deb ozdan qolma.

proverbList.proverb: The rich man thinks of the future, the poor man thinks of today.
proverbList.explanation: Boy kelajagini, keying kunini o`ylaydi, kambag`al esa bugunini o`ylaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Borga yetti kun hayit, yo`qqa – bir kun.
Boyga – shifokor, kambag`alga – duo.
Kambag`al – piyoda, boy – tuyada.
Kambag`al osh topsa, qo`ygani idish topmas.
Ulkan uydagi kulsa, kichkina uydagi yig`lar.

proverbList.proverb: Fools live poor to die rich.
proverbList.explanation: Ahmoq odamgina boy bo`lish uchun umri davomida kambag`allarcha hayot kechiradi, ya’ni baxillik bilan hayotini boylik to`plashga sarflaydi, uning boyligini huzurini u vafot etganidan so`ng boshqalar ko`radi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Hech kim boyligini o‘zi bilan qabriga olib ketolmaydi.
Ahmoqda aql bo‘lmas, aqlli baxil bo‘lmas.
Yema, ichma, bo‘l baxil, boy bo‘lmasang, men kafil.

proverbList.proverb: Better die standing than live kneeling.
proverbList.explanation: Tiz cho‘kib, ya’ni bosh egib yashagandan ko‘ra tik turib mardonavor o‘lgan yaxshiroqdir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Tiz cho‘kib yashaguncha, tik turib o‘lgan yaxshi.
Go‘ngqarg‘a bo‘lib ming yil yashagandan,sher bo‘lib bir yil yashagan afzal.
Yuz yil qul bo‘lib yashagandan, bir kun hur bo‘lib yashagan yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: Absence diminishes little passions and increases great ones.
proverbList.explanation: Bir-birini ko‘rmaslik oshiqlarni sinaydi: agar muhabbat kuchsiz bo‘lsa, u yana ham kuchsizlanad, agar muhabbat kuchli bo‘lsa, uni yanada kuchaytiradi.
proverbList.equivalent: Chin muhabbat osonlikcha unutilmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: A little body often harbours a great soul.
proverbList.explanation: Kichkina tanada odatda ulkan qalb yashaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Kichkina demang bizni, ko‘tarib uramiz sizni.

proverbList.proverb: A small leak will sink a great ship.
proverbList.explanation: Kichik bir teshik katta kemani cho‘ktirib yuboradi, ya’ni kichik xatolik katta ko‘ngilsizlikka olib kelishi mumkin
proverbList.equivalent:
Kichik kalit katta uyni ochar.*
Tomib turgan suv toshniyam teshar

proverbList.proverb: A small pepper is hotter than a large one.
proverbList.explanation: Kichik qalampir kattasidan ko‘ra achchiqroq bo‘ladi, ya’ni kichkina deb nazarga olmaslik doim ham to‘g‘ri bo‘lavermaydi, kichiklarning ham qo‘llaridan katta ishlar kelishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Kichkina demang bizni, Ko‘tarib uramiz sizni.

proverbList.proverb: A little impatience will spoil great plans.
proverbList.explanation: Kichik bir sabrsizlik bilan qilingan harakat ulkan rejalarni buzishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Kichik xatoga katta jazo.

proverbList.proverb: Better a little fire to warm us, than a great one to burn us.
proverbList.explanation: Katta olov kuydirib qo‘yishi mumkin, shuning uchun kichik olov bo‘lgani yaxshi, kichik olov bizni isitadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Suv ko‘paysa, daryo toshar.
Har narsaning ozi shirin.
Shakarning ozi shirin.
Asalning ham ozi shirin.

proverbList.proverb: Little pigeons can carry great messages.
proverbList.explanation: Kichik kabutarlar katta xabarlarni o‘z egasiga yetkaza oladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Kichik kalit katta uyni ochar.

proverbList.proverb: Little pitchers have big (or large, long) ears.
proverbList.explanation: Kichik ko‘zalarning katta quloqlari bor. Ya’ni ba’zida kichkina bolalar kattalarni gapini eshitib qolishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Devorning ham qulog‘i bor.

proverbList.proverb: Little strokes fell great oaks.
proverbList.explanation: Kichik zarba katta emanni ham qulatishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Kichkina demang bizni, ko‘tarib uramiz sizni.*
Tomib turgan suv toshniyam teshar.

proverbList.proverb: Little thieves are hanged, but great ones escape.
proverbList.explanation: Kichik o‘g‘rilar dorga osiladi, lekin kattalari qochib qoladi, ya’ni odatda kichik o‘g‘rilar oson qo‘lga tushadi, kattalari esa osonlikcha qo‘lga tushmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ayron ichgan qutildi, chelak yalagan tutildi.

proverbList.proverb: Little fishes slip through nets, but great fishes are taken.
proverbList.explanation: Ov to‘ridan kichik baliqlar tushib qoladi, lekin kattalari ovchining o‘ljasiga aylanadi. 1. Qiyinchilik paytida pastdagi kichik odamlar qiyinchilikdan bildirmay qochib qolishadi, yuqoridagilari esa tutilishadi. 2. Inson xotirasidan kichik narsalar tez o‘chib ketadi, lekin muhim ahamiyatga ega katta voqealar qoladi.

proverbList.proverb: Little chips light great fires.
proverbList.explanation: Kichik cho‘g‘ katta olovni hosil qiladi. 1. Ahamiyatsizdek ko‘ringan narsalar katta ahamiyatga ega voqealarga sababchi bo‘lishi mumkin. 2. Kichik bir yomonlik yoki xatolik katta falokatga olib kelish mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Kichik kalit katta uyni ochar.

proverbList.proverb: Many a little makes a mickle.
proverbList.explanation: Ko‘plab kichiklar to‘planib, kattani hosil qiladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Birin-birin ming bo‘lar, toma-toma ko‘l bo‘lar.
Birlashgan daryo bo‘lar, tarqalgan irmoq bo‘lar.
Oz-ozdan o‘rganib, dono bo‘lur, qatra-qatra yig‘ilib, daryo bo‘lur.
Toma-toma ko‘l bolur.

proverbList.proverb: Petty law breed great crimes.
proverbList.explanation: Kichik bir qonun ham katta jinoyatga asos bo‘lishi mumkin, shuning uchun qonunlarni kattasigayam, kichigigayam bir xil ahamiyat berib yaratish lozim.

proverbList.proverb: Small rain lays great dust.
proverbList.explanation: Ozgina yoqqan yomg‘ir ham katta miqdordagi changni bosa oladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Kichik kalit katta uyni ochar.

proverbList.proverb: The little cannot be great unless he devours many.
proverbList.explanation: Kichkina odam ko‘p sinovlardan o‘tmagunicha katta bo‘lmaydi. Ya’ni tajribasiz odam mehnat-u mashaqqat bilan o‘z oldiga qo‘ygan maqsadiga erishadi, hurmat qozonadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Mashaqqatsiz baxt kelmas, mehnatsiz taxt kelmas.
Iqbolni mehnat ochar.

proverbList.proverb: The least boy always carries the greatest fiddle.
proverbList.explanation: Eng kichik bola doim eng og‘ir yukni ko‘tarib yuradi, ya’ni doimo eng qiyin yumush mazkur yumushni qila oladiganlarning eng kichigiga tashlab qo‘yiladi.
proverbList.equivalent: O‘zbekning kichigi bo‘lguncha, kuchugi bo‘l.

proverbList.proverb: Venture a small fish to catch a great one.
proverbList.explanation: Katta baliqni tutish uchun kichik baliqni qurbon qilish lozim, ya’ni biror narsaga erishish uchun, boshqa biridan voz kechiladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Jon kuydirmasang, jonona qayda, toqqa chiqmasang, do‘lona qayda.

proverbList.proverb: A fool may give a wise man counsel.
proverbList.explanation: Ahmoq ba’zan aqlliga ham maslahat beradi, ya’ni 1) ba’zida aqlsiz odamdan ham aqlli gaplar chiqishi mumkin, yoki 2) oddiy insonlar ham ba’zida juda aqlli deb hisoblanganlarga ham yaxshi maslahat berishi mumkin.

proverbList.proverb: A fool says what he knows, and a wise knows what he says.
proverbList.explanation: Ahmoq nimani bilsa gapiraveradi, aqlli esa nimani gapirishni biladi, ya’ni o‘ylamasdan gapirmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoqni urma, so‘kma – gapga sol.
Oldiga kelganni yemak – hayvonning ishi, og‘ziga kelganni demak – nodonning ishi.
Ahmoqning o‘z bilgani, Gapirmasa, o‘lgani.
Sahroyini urma-so‘kma, so‘zlat.
Dono o‘ylab aytar, Nodon – o‘ynab.

proverbList.proverb: A silent fool is counted wise. A fool is counted wise when he is silent.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlsiz gapirmasa aqlli sanaladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoqni urma, so‘kma – gapga sol.
Aqlli oz so‘zlar, Ahmoq ko‘p so‘zlar.
Sahroyini urma-so‘kma, so‘zlat.

proverbList.proverb: Fools ask questions that wise men cannot answer.
proverbList.explanation: Nodon odamlar ba’zan donolar ham javob topa olmaydigan savollar berishadi.

proverbList.proverb: Fools build houses and wise men live in them.
proverbList.explanation: Ahmoqlar uy qurishadi, aqllilar esa shu uyda yashaydi, ya’ni aqlli odam o‘zi ishlamasdan sodda ahmoqni ishga soladi va undan foydalanadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoqni urma-so‘kma, ishga sol.
Ahmoqni urma-so‘kma, aldab-suldab yo‘lga sol.

proverbList.proverb: Success makes a fool seem wise.
proverbList.explanation: Omadi kelsa nodonni ham dono deb atashadi. Ya’ni omadli yoki boy inson aqlli bo‘lmasa ham, hamma uni aqlli deb sanaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Og‘zi qiyshiq bo‘lsa ham, boyning o‘g‘li gapirsin.

proverbList.proverb: Cold hands, warm heart.
proverbList.explanation: Ba’zida insonlarning qo‘li sovuq bo‘lsa ham qalbi iliq bo‘ladi, ya’ni doim ham insonni tashqi ko‘rinishiga va xususiyatlariga qarab baho berish to‘g‘ri bo‘lavermaydi, ba’zi insonlar o‘z hissiyotlarini tashqariga chiqarishmaydi, lekin bu ularni toshyurak deb hisoblash uchun sabab bo‘la olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Tashqi ko‘rinish – aldamchi.

proverbList.proverb: Be slow to promise and quick to perform
proverbList.explanation: Va’da berishda shoshmaslik kerak, berilgan va’dani bajarishda esa shoshish lozimdir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Va’da – quruq, bajarilsa – ulug‘.
Va’da – vafosi bilan go‘zal.
Gap bilan va’da berma, Ish bilan va’da ber.
Gap bilan shoshma, ish bilan shosh.

proverbList.proverb: A bad compromise is better than a good lawsuit.
proverbList.explanation: Mavjud kelishuvni buzish uchun chiqarilgan yaxshi urinish yoki qarordan ko‘ra yomon bo‘lsa ham murosa yaxshidir. Har qanday nizodan ko‘ra kichik yoki foydasiz bo‘lsa ham totuvlik yaxshi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Och qornim – tinch qulog‘im.
Urush – ofat, Tinchlik – farog‘at.

proverbList.proverb: A bad shearer never had a good sickle
proverbList.explanation: Kasbi hayvonlarning yungini qirtishlash bo‘lgan odam yomon bo‘lsa, ya’ni ishini chin dildan yaxshilab bajara olmasa yoki erinsa, qaychisini yaxshi demaydi, aybni ish quroliga yuklaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Epsiz sozanda sozin ayblar.
O‘zolmagan otga uzangi bahona.
Ishyoqmas o‘roqchi o‘roq tanlar.
Ishyoqmasga arpa uni – bahona.
O‘tloqda bedana ko‘p, Dangasada – bahona.

proverbList.proverb: Bad luck often brings good luck.
proverbList.explanation: Yomonlik ortidan yaxshilik keladi, dunyo faqat yomonlik va baxtsiz kunlardan iborat emas.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir kun ming kun emas.
Bir yomonning qarshisida yuz yaxshi bor.
Oyning o‘n beshi qorong‘u bo‘lsa, o‘n beshi – yorug‘.

proverbList.proverb: Bear all with evil and expect good.
proverbList.explanation: Yomonlik va qiyinchiliklarga chida, sabr qil va yaxshilikdan umid qil, yaxshi kunlar albatta keladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir kun ming kun emas.
Bir yomonning qarshisida yuz yaxshi bor.
Oyning o‘n beshi qorong‘u bo‘lsa, O‘n beshi – yorug‘.
Sabr tagi – sari oltin,Sabr bilan chiqar oting.
Sabrli qul murodiga yetar.
O‘ttiz kun ro‘zaning bir kun hayiti bor.

proverbList.proverb: Evil communications corrupt good manners.
proverbList.explanation: Yomon aloqalar yaxshi xulq-atvorni ham buzadi, yomon odamlar o‘zlariga qo‘shib yaxshi odamlarni ham yo‘ldan ozdiradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yomonning oyog‘i – sakkiz, Biri tegmasa, biri tegar.
Yomonga yaqinlashsang, balosi yuqar, Qozonga yaqinlashsang – qorasi.
Qozonga yaqinlashsang,qarosi yuqar,Yomonga yaqinlashsang, balosi yuqar.

proverbList.proverb: He that is ill to himself will be good nobody.
proverbList.explanation: O‘zini hurmat qilmagan, o‘zini yaxshi ko‘rmagan inson boshqalarni ham hurmat qilishni va yaxshi ko‘rishni bilmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
O‘ziga baxillik qilgan, O‘zgaga saxiylik qilmas.
O‘z qadrini bilmagan o‘zga odamga kular.
O‘zini bilgan o‘zgani ham bilar.

proverbList.proverb: He that is afraid of bad luck will never know good
proverbList.explanation: Yomonlik va qora kunlardan qo‘rqqan, qiyinchilikda sabr qila olmagan odam yaxshi kunlarga yeta olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Azob ko‘rmay, rohat yo‘q.

proverbList.proverb: He that spares the bad injures the good.
proverbList.explanation: Yomonni saqlagan odam yaxshini jarohatlaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Yomonning davlati – yaxshining ofati.

proverbList.proverb: Ill luck is good for something.
proverbList.explanation: Ba’zan yomonlikda ham bir yaxshilik yotadi, tanganing ikki tomoni bo‘lganidek yomon deb o‘ylaganlarimizning qandaydir bir yaxshi tarafi yoki foydasi ham bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir yomonning yuz yaxshisi bor.
Har yomonning bir yaxshisi bor.
Har kechaning kunduzi, Har kunduzning kechasi bor.
Har oqshomning bir tongi bor.

proverbList.proverb: Never do evil that good may come of it.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshilikka yomon yo‘l orqali borilmaydi, hatto natijasi yaxshi bo‘lishini bilsak ham, yomonlik qilishimiz to‘g‘ri emas.

proverbList.proverb: Of evil manners, spring good laws.
proverbList.explanation: Yomon odatlarni ko‘rib insonlar ularni qilmaslikka intiladilar, shu sababli ular yaxshilikka undovchi qonun-qoidalarni yaratadilar va ularga amal qiladilar
proverbList.equivalent:
Yomondan yaxshilikni o‘rgan.
Yaxshini yomondan o‘rgan.

proverbList.proverb: Pardoning the bad is the injuring the good.
proverbList.explanation: Yomonni kechirgan odam bu ishi bilan yaxshini jarohatlaydi, ko‘nglini og‘ritadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Yomonning davlati – yaxshining ofati.

proverbList.proverb: The worse luck now, the better another time.
proverbList.explanation: Hozir yomonroq payt bo‘lsa, boshqa payt albbata yaxshiroq davr keladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir kun ming kun emas.
Bir yomonning qarshisida yuz yaxshi bor.
Oyning o‘n beshi qorong‘u bo‘lsa, O‘n beshi – yorug‘.
O‘ttiz kun ro‘zaning bir kun hayiti bor.

proverbList.proverb: There’s no great loss without some gain.
proverbList.explanation: Katta yo‘qotishlarda ham kichik muvaffaqiyatlar bo‘ladi, ya’ni biror nimani boy berdim deb xafa bo‘lishdan avval, shu boy berishda nimagadir erishilgani haqida ham o‘ylash kerak.
proverbList.equivalent: Har yomonning bir yaxshisi bor.

proverbList.proverb: No living man all things can.
proverbList.explanation: Hech bir inson hamma narsani birdek yaxshi bajara olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Beayb – parvardigor.
Har to‘kisda – bir ayb.

proverbList.proverb: No man is wise at all times.
proverbList.explanation: Hech bir inson har doim birdek aqlli bo‘la olmaydi, qachondir u ham xato qiladi, u ham nodonlarcha ish qilib qo‘yishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Beayb – parvardigor.
Har to‘kisda – bir ayb.

proverbList.proverb: No dish pleases all palates alike.
proverbList.explanation: Hech qaysi ovqat hammaga birdek manzur bo‘la olmaydi, ya’ni hech kim yoki hech narsa hammani birdek ko‘nglini ko‘tara olmaydi va hammaga birdek yoqavermaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Hammaga birdek yoqadigan odam onasidan hali tug‘ilmagan.

proverbList.proverb: You may know by a handful the whole sack.
proverbList.explanation: Butun bir qop ichidagi narsani uning bir qismini tekshirish bilan bilib olish mumkin, ya’ni insonning qanaqaligini uning bitta harakatidan bilib olish mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Kasalni yashirsang, Isitmasi oshkora qilar.

proverbList.proverb: Nothing is impossible to a willing heart.
proverbList.explanation: Xohish bor yurak egasi uchun ilojsiz narsaning o‘zi yo‘q.
proverbList.equivalent:
Qalovini topsang, qor yog‘ar.
Qalovini topsang, qor ham yog‘adi.

proverbList.proverb: No answer is also an answer.
proverbList.explanation: Javob bermaslik ham bir javob, ya’ni sukut ham ba’zida qandaydir ma’noni anglatadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Sukut – alomati rizo.

proverbList.proverb: There is no fool like an old fool.
proverbList.explanation: Qari ahmoqqa teng keladigan ahmoq topilmaydi, ya’ni yoshi katta aqlsiz odam eng katta aqlsizliklarni qiladi.

proverbList.proverb: There is no rose without a torn.
proverbList.explanation: Tikansiz atirgul bo‘lmaydi, ya’ni kishi bir yaxshi narsaga zahmat chekib, qiyinchiliklardan o‘tib keyin erishadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Gulning ham tikani bor.
Gul tikansiz bo‘lmas, Dur – sadafsiz.
Gulni sevgan tikaniga chidaydi.
Gulchi bir gulni o‘stirguncha, Yuz tikan zahrini tortadi.

proverbList.proverb: There is no rule without an exception
proverbList.explanation: Har bir qoidada bir mustasno holat bo‘ladi, chunki borliqdagi hamma narsa murakkab yaratilgan bo‘lib, ularni qoidalarga sig‘dirish imkonsizdir

proverbList.proverb: There is no tree but bears some fruit.
proverbList.explanation: Har daraxtning o‘ziga yarasha mevasi bo‘ladi, har insonning yoki har narsaning qayerdadir foydasi tegadi, befoyda narsaning o‘zi yo‘q.

proverbList.proverb: There is no better looking-glass than an old friend.
proverbList.explanation: Eski do‘stdan ko‘ra yaxshiroq ko‘zgu yo‘q, chunki haqiqiy do‘st aybingni yuzingga aytadi va to‘g‘ri yo‘ldan adashmasliging uchun yordam beradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Do‘st achitib gapirar, Dushman – kulib.
Do‘st achitib gapirar, Dushman – kuldirib.
Do‘st yig‘latar, Dushman kuldirar.
Do‘st kuydirib aytar, Dushman – suydirib.

proverbList.proverb: Never cast dirt into that fountain of which you have sometimes drunk.
proverbList.explanation: O‘zing ba’zan suv ichib turadigan favvoraning suvini hech qachon iflos qilma, ya’ni o‘zing qachondir bo‘lsa ham foydalanadigan narsaga ziyon keltirma.
proverbList.equivalent:
Qaytib kelar eshigingni qattiq yopma.
Suv ichadigan qudug‘ingga tupurma.
O‘zing suv ichadigan quduqqa tupurma.

proverbList.proverb: The camel never sees its own hump, but that of its brother is always before its eyes.
proverbList.explanation: Tuya o‘z o‘rkachini hech qachon ko‘rmaydi, lekin o‘z akasining o‘rkachi doimo uning ko‘zi oldida bo‘lgani uchun uni ko‘radi. Ya’ni inson o‘z kamchiligini emas o‘zgalarni kamchiligini yaxshiroq ko‘radi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Avval o‘zingga boq, So‘ngra nog‘ora qoq.
Avval o‘z aybingni bil, So‘ngra boshqadan kul.
O‘ziniki o‘ziga bilinmas.

proverbList.proverb: Learn weeping and you shall gain laughing.
proverbList.explanation: Yig‘lashni o‘rgansang kulishni ham bilib olasan, ya’ni qiyin kunlardan o‘tib olsang, yaxshi kunlarga yetasan, qiyinchilikda odam yoruq kunlarining qadriga yetadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Azob ko‘rmay, rohat yo‘q.
Yaxshini ko‘rib fikr qil, Yomonni ko‘rib shukur qil.

proverbList.proverb: Big fish eat little fish.
proverbList.explanation:
Katta baliq kichik baliqni
yeydi, ya’ni doim kuchlilar
oldida kuchsizlar bosh
egadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Kun – kuchliniki,
Qobirg‘a – tishliniki.

proverbList.proverb: Big fleas have little fleas upon their backs to bite them, and little fleas have lesser fleas, and so ad infinitum.
proverbList.explanation: Katta burgalarning orqasida ularni tishlaydigan kichik burgalari bo‘ladi, u kichik burgalarning ham yanada kichikroq burgalari bo‘ladi, va bu qator esa nihoyasiz davom etadi. Ya’ni hayotda kuchlilarga ham zarar yetkaza oladigan kuchsizlar bo‘ladi, ularga ham teng kela oladigan yanada kichiklar ham topiladi.

proverbList.proverb: Great boast, small roast.
proverbList.explanation: Maqtovi juda katta, lekin maqtalayotgan narsa yoki shaxs maqtovdagidek emas
proverbList.equivalent:
Vahimasi osmonda, qo‘lida misi ham yo‘q.
Baqiroq sigir sutsiz bo‘lar.

proverbList.proverb: Great cry and little wool.
proverbList.explanation: Ko‘p baqirib chaqirilgani bilan, aslida yung ko‘p emas. O‘rta asrlarda savdogarlar baqirib xaridorlarni chaqrishgan, lekin ularda har doim ham baqirganlariga yarasha serob mahsulot bo‘lmagan.
proverbList.equivalent:
Vahimasi osmonda, qo‘lida misi ham yo‘q.
Baqiroq sigir sutsiz bo‘lar.

proverbList.proverb: Great talkers are little doers.
proverbList.explanation: Ko‘p gapiradigan odamlar odatda ishni ko‘p bajarishmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Gap desang, qop-qop, Ish desang, Samarqanddan top.
Gap desang, qop-qop, Ish desang – betob.
Gapga – chechan, ishga – mechan.
Dangasaga ish buyursang, Otangdan ortiq nasihat qilar.

proverbList.proverb: Great oaks from little acorns grow.
proverbList.explanation: Katta emanlar kichik eman mevalaridan o‘sib chiqadi, ya’ni har qanday ulkan muvaffaqiyat avval kichik bo‘lib, sekin-asta kattalashadi.

proverbList.proverb: Great trees keep down the little ones.
proverbList.explanation: Ulkan daraxtlar kichik daraxtlarni ushlab turadi, pana qiladi, ya’ni kattalar kichiklarni asraydi, ularga katta bo‘lgunlaricha g‘amxo‘rlik qiladi.

proverbList.proverb: Great consolation may grow out of the smallest saying.
proverbList.explanation: Eng kichik maqol yoki gap ham odamga ulkan taskin berishi mumin.

proverbList.proverb: Knowledge humbleth the great man, astonisheth the common man, and puffeth up the little man.
proverbList.explanation: Ilmli buyuk insonlar kamtar bo‘ladi, oddiy insonlar ilm-u fandagi yangiliklardan hayratda qolishadi, kichik (past tabaqali) odamlar ilm egalashsa ham ularga hech kim e’tibor bermaydi.

proverbList.proverb: There is no great loss without small gain.
proverbList.explanation: Katta yo‘qotishlarda ham kichik muvaffaqiyatlar bo‘ladi, ya’ni biror nimani boy berdim deb xafa bo‘lishdan avval, shu boy berishda nimagadir erishilgani haqida ham o‘ylash kerak.
proverbList.equivalent: Har yomonning bir yaxshisi bor.

proverbList.proverb: There would be no great ones if there were no little ones.
proverbList.explanation: Kichik yoki oddiy narsalar bo‘lmaganida edi, ulkan yoki buyuk narsalar ham bo‘lmas edi.

proverbList.proverb: The great fish eat up the small.
proverbList.explanation: Katta baliq kichik baliqni yeydi, ya’ni doim kuchlilar oldida kuchsizlar bosh egadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Kun – kuchliniki, Qobirg‘a – tishliniki.

proverbList.proverb: The greatest talkers are the least doers.
proverbList.explanation: Eng ko‘p gapiradigan odamlar odatda eng kam ish bajarishadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Gap desang, qop-qop, Ish desang – betob.
Gapga – chechan, ishga – mechan.
Dangasaga ish buyursang, Otangdan ortiq nasihat qilar.

proverbList.proverb: The greater the kindred, the less the kindness.
proverbList.explanation: Qarindoshlar qancha ko‘p bo‘lsa, ular orasidagi mehr shuncha kam bo‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: Jack of all trades and master of none.
proverbList.explanation: Hamma kasbni qilaman degan odam aslida hech qaysi kasbini ustasi bo‘la olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki quyonni quvlagan birini ham tutolmas.
Ko‘pga yugurgan ozdan qolar.
Ko‘p deb ozdan qolma.
Mingni chala bilgandan, Birni to‘la bilgan yaxshi.
Mingtaning tusini bilguncha, Bittaning ismini bil.
Yuz hunarni chala bilgandan Bir hunarni to‘la bil.

proverbList.proverb: If you try to please all you will please none.
proverbList.explanation: Hammani birdek xursand qilishga urinsangiz, ularning hech birini ko‘nglini ololmaysiz.
proverbList.equivalent: Hammaga birdek yoqadigan odam onasidan hali tug‘ilmagan.

proverbList.proverb: It is equally an error to trust all men or no men.
proverbList.explanation: Hammaga birdek ishonish ham, hech kimga ishonmaslik ham bir xil xatodir.

proverbList.proverb: Everybody’s business is nobody’s business.
proverbList.explanation: 1. Hammaga tegishli yumushni hech kim o‘z yumushi deb hisoblamaydi. 2. Ko‘pchilikka tegishli bo‘lgan narsadan hech qachon bir kishi manfaatli bo‘la olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Sansolar-u mansolar, Otga yemni kim solar.
Sheriklik tovuqdan tuxum yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: He that serves everybody is paid by nobody.
proverbList.explanation: Hammaga birdek xizmat ko‘rsatgan odamga hech kim haq to‘lamaydi, ya’ni hammani birdek xursand qilishga urinsangiz, ularning hech birini ko‘nglini ololmaysiz.
proverbList.equivalent: Hammaga birdek yoqadigan odam onasidan hali tug‘ilmagan.

proverbList.proverb: To know everything is to know nothing.
proverbList.explanation: Hamma narsani bilaman degan odam aslida hech narsani yaxshi bilmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki quyonni quvlagan birini ham tutolmas.
Ko‘pga yugurgan ozdan qolar.
Ko‘p deb ozdan qolma.
Mingni chala bilgandan, Birni to‘la bilgan yaxshi.
Mingtaning tusini bilguncha, Bittaning ismini bil.
Yuz hunarni chala bilgandan Bir hunarni to‘la bil.

proverbList.proverb: When we sing, everybody hears us; when we sigh, nobody hear us.
proverbList.explanation: Qo‘shiq aytganimizda, hamma bizni tinglaydi, xo‘rsinganimizda hech kim bizni eshitmaydi. Ya’ni yaxshi kunimizda atrofimizda do‘stlar ko‘payadi, qiyin kunlarimizda esa ular yo‘qolib qoladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Omad kelsa, do‘st ko‘payar, Omad ketsa, dushmaning.

proverbList.proverb: Something is better than nothing.
proverbList.explanation: Hech narsadan ko'ra biror narsa yaxshi, hech nima yo‘q bo‘lgandan ko‘ra oz bo‘lsa ham biror narsa bo‘lgani yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb:
You don’t get something for nothing.
We don’t get something for nothing.
proverbList.explanation: 1. Hech nima qilmasangiz, hech narsaga erisha olmaysiz. Biz hech nima qilmasak, hech narsaga erisha olmaymiz. 2. Biror narsadan voz kechmasangiz, boshqa biriga erisha olmaysiz. Biror narsadan voz kechmasak, boshqa biriga erisha olmaysiz.
proverbList.equivalent:
1. Harakat, harakatda barakat.
Sendan harakat, mendan barakat.*
Jon kuydirmasang, jonona qayda, Toqqa chiqmasang, do‘lona qayda.
2. Chiqim bo‘lmasa, kirim ham bo‘lmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: One man, no man.
proverbList.explanation: Odam bir o‘zi hech kim emas, ya’ni odam odam bilan tirik, odamlar birlashib bir ishni oson amalga oshiradi, yolg‘iz odam qiynaladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yolg‘iz daraxt o‘rmon bo‘lmas.
Yolg‘iz yog‘och pana bo‘lmas.
Yolg‘iz itning hurgani bilinmas,
Yolg‘iz kishining yurgani bilinmas.
Yolg‘iz otning changi chiqmas, Changi chiqsa ham dong‘i chiqmas.
Yolg‘iz uyda qozon qaynamas.
Yolg‘iz qo‘yning terisi po‘stin bo‘lmas.
Yolg‘iz yurib yo‘l topguncha, Ko‘p bilan yurib adash.
Yolg‘izning yoyi yo‘qolsa, topilmas, Ko‘pning o‘qi yo‘qolsa, topilar.

proverbList.proverb: One of these days is none of these days.
proverbList.explanation: Bir kun o‘tgani kunlarning ichida bilinmaydi, ya’ni kunlar tez o‘tadi, vaqt o‘tganini sezmay ham qolish mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Vaqt – oqar suv.

proverbList.proverb: The voice of one man is the voice of no one.
proverbList.explanation: Bir kishining ovozi hech qachon bilinmaydi, yolg‘iz odam kuchsiz bo‘ladi, u boshqalar bilan birlashsa kuchli bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yolg‘iz daraxt o‘rmon bo‘lmas.
Yolg‘iz yog‘och pana bo‘lmas.
Yolg‘iz yog‘och uy bo‘lmas.
Yolg‘iz itning hurgani bilinmas, Yolg‘iz kishining yurgani bilinmas.
Yolg‘iz otning changi chiqmas, Changi chiqsa ham dong‘i chiqmas.
Yolg‘iz uyda qozon qaynamas.
Yolg‘iz qo‘yning terisi po‘stin bo‘lmas.
Yolg‘iz yurib yo‘l topguncha, Ko‘p bilan yurib adash.
Yolg‘izning yoyi yo‘qolsa, topilmas, Ko‘pning o‘qi yo‘qolsa, topilar.

proverbList.proverb: When a friend asks, there is no tomorrow.
proverbList.explanation: Do‘sting so‘ragan paytda, hech qachon ertaga dema, ya’ni do‘st yordamga muhtoj bo‘lsa, paysalga solmay yordam ber.
proverbList.equivalent: Do‘stning ko‘ngli qolguncha, Dushmanning bo‘yni uzilsin.

proverbList.proverb: What may be done at any time is done at none time.
proverbList.explanation: Istalgan paytda qilinadi deb hisoblangan ish, hech qachon qilinmaydi, doim qolib ketaveradi.
proverbList.equivalent: Qolgan ishga qor yog‘ar.

proverbList.proverb: A wise man changes his mind, a fool never will.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlli odam fikrini o‘zgartirishi mumkin, lekin ahmoq hech qachon o‘zgartirmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoqqa aytgan bilan gap uqmas, Xarsangga qoqqan bilan mix o‘tmas.
Ahmoq o‘zi bilmas, Bilganning so‘ziga kirmas.
Aqlliga bir so‘z bas, Aqlsizga ming so‘z oz.
Tentak to‘rini bermas, Telba – to‘nini.

proverbList.proverb: A wise man will learn something even from the words of a fool.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlli odam hatto aqlsiz odamning so‘zlaridan ham nimanidir o‘rganadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Aqlni beaqldan o‘rgan. Nodon so‘zlar, Dono ibrat olar.

proverbList.proverb: Advice is something the wise don’t need and the fool won't take.
proverbList.explanation: Maslahat shunday narsaki, aqlli unga muhtoj emas, ahmoq esa uni o‘ziga olmaydi va amal qilmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: Better a poor and wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished.
proverbList.explanation: Keksa va aqlsiz shohdan kambag‘al va aqlli bola yaxshiroq, chunki bunday shohning xatosi natijasida ko‘plab odamlar aziyat chekishadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Aqli kirmagan qaridan, Ziyrak tug‘ilgan bola yaxshi.
Aqlsiz keksadan aqlli yosh yaxshi.
Oltmish yashar ahmoqdan Olti yashar dono yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: Custom is the plague of wise men and the idol of fools.
proverbList.explanation: Turli urf-odat va rasm-rusmlar aqlli inson uchun ofat, ahmoqning esa jon-u dili.

proverbList.proverb: Fools and madmen speak the truth.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlsiz va telba kishilar ba’zan haqiqatni gapirishadi, ular aytgan haqiqatga ba’zida aqllilarning ham aqli yetmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: If the wise erred not, it would go hard with fools.
proverbList.explanation: Agar dono odam hech bir ishni bajarishda xato qilmaganida edi, nodonga juda qiyin bo‘lar edi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Beayb – parvardigor.
Har to‘kisda – bir ayb.

proverbList.proverb: It takes a wise man to be fool.
proverbList.explanation: Inson o‘zining nodonligini sezmaydi, buni sezish uchun u dono bo‘lishi lozim.
proverbList.equivalent:
Nodon o‘zini dono sanar, Dono o‘zini nodon sanar.
Dono aql so‘rab hormas, Nodon nozin qilib bormas.

proverbList.proverb: Wise men learn by other men’s harm, fools, by their own.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlli odam boshqalarning unga yetkazgan ziyonidan va o‘zining xatolaridan xulosa chiqaradi, ahmoq esa o‘zining xatolaridan.
proverbList.equivalent:
Aqlni beaqldan o‘rgan.
Dono aql so‘rab hormas, Nodon nozin qilib bormas.
Nodon so‘zlar, Dono ibrat olar.

proverbList.proverb: Wise men propose, and fools determine.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlli odam taklif beradi, ahmoq odam belgilaydi, ya’ni aqlli odam kerakli bo‘lgan fikrlarni yoki takliflarni beradi, aqlsiz odam tayyor fikr yoki taklifga egalik qilib, o‘zinikidek ko‘rsatadi.

proverbList.proverb: Wise men do not argue with idiots.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlli odam ahmoqlar bilan tortishmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Dono bilan nodon bir buloqdan suv ichmas.

proverbList.proverb: Zeal is fit only for wise men, but is found mostly in fools.
proverbList.explanation: G‘ayrat faqat aqlli odamga mos keluvchi, ularga kerak bo‘lgan xususiyat, lekin g‘ayrat ko‘pincha aqlsizlarda topiladi.

proverbList.proverb: Always a bridesmaid, never a bride.
proverbList.explanation: Har doim kelinning dugonasi bo‘lib yuradigan qizning o‘zi hech qachon kelin bo`lmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: If you always say 'No', you’ll never get married.
proverbList.explanation: Agar har diom 'Yo‘q' desangiz, hech qachon turmushga chiqa olmaysiz.
proverbList.equivalent: Tengi chiqsa tekin uzat.

proverbList.proverb: Evil often triumphs but never conquers.
proverbList.explanation: Yomonlik tez-tez g‘alaba qozonib turadi, lekin hech qachon to‘laligicha hukmronlik qila olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Haqiqat egiladi, bukiladi, lekin sinmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: A tree often transplanted, never bears much fruit.
proverbList.explanation: Hadeb bir joydan boshqa joyga ko‘chirilib o‘tkazildigan daraxt hech qachon mo‘l meva bermaydi. Ya’ni bir joydan boshqa joyga ko‘chib, yoki ish joyini tez-tez o‘zgartirib yuradigan insonlarning o‘sishi, rivojlanishi dargumondir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Daraxt bir joyda ko‘karadi.
Ikki quyonni quvlagan birini ham tutolmas.*

proverbList.proverb: Be swift to hear, slow to speak
proverbList.explanation: Tinglashga shoshil, lekin gapirishga shoshilma.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoq so‘zlar, aqlli tinglar.
Bir so‘zlab, tingla qirq ikki.
Og‘iz – bir, quloq – ikki, Bir so‘zlab, tingla qirq ikki.
Oz gapir – soz gapir.

proverbList.proverb: Too swift arrives as tardy as too slow.
proverbList.explanation: Juda tez harakat qilgan ham juda sekin harakat qilganodam kabi kech qolishi mumkin, ya’ni shoshgan odam ham juda hovliqishi to‘gri emas.
proverbList.equivalent: Chopib borgan yerga, Yurib borsa ham bo‘lar.

proverbList.proverb: All are good lasses, but whence come the bad wives.
proverbList.explanation: Hamma qizlar yaxshi bo‘ladi, lekin unda yomon xotinlar qayerdan paydo bo‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: Many good cows have bad calves. Many a good cow have a bad calf.
proverbList.explanation: Ko‘plab yaxshi sigirlarning yomon buzoqlari bor, ya’ni insonlarning ham ularning farzandlariga ota-onasiga qarab baho berish doim ham to‘g‘ri bo‘lavermaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoq otadan – aqlli farzand.
Ahmoqdan – chaqmoq, Donodan – ahmoq.
G‘ayratlining bolasi tanbal bo‘lar.

proverbList.proverb: Money is a good servant but a bad master.
proverbList.explanation: Pul yaxshi xizmatkordir, lekin yomon boshliq. Ya’ni hech qachon pulning quli bo‘lish kerak emas, pul sizni qulingiz bo‘lishi kerak.
proverbList.equivalent:
Pul – qo‘lning kiri.
Yerni suv buzar, Odamni – pul.

proverbList.proverb: A good heart conquers ill fortune.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshi yurak yomon qismatni yenga oladi, ya’ni yaxshi odamning peshonasiga yomon taqdir yozilgan bo‘lsa ham, u o‘z taqdirini yaxshi tarafga o‘zgartira oladi.

proverbList.proverb: Learning makes good men better, and ill men worse.
proverbList.explanation: O‘qib-o‘rganish yaxshi odamni yanada yaxshi qiladi, lekin yomon odamni yanada yomon qiladi.

proverbList.proverb: Praise makes good men better, and bad men worse.
proverbList.explanation: Maqtov yaxshi odamni yanada yaxshi qiladi, lekin yomon odamni yanada yomon qiladi.

proverbList.proverb: Slander cannot make a good man bad.
proverbList.explanation: Tuhmat yaxshi odamni yomon qilib qo‘ya olmaydi, uning yolg‘onligi baribir yuzaga chiqadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Tuhmatning umri – qisqa.
Haqiqat egiladi, bukiladi, lekin sinmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: The good intention excuses the bad action.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshi niyat yomon amalni oqlaydi, ya’ni yaxshi niyat bilan qilingan ish yomon tarafga aylanib ketsa-da, bu ish kechiriladi.

proverbList.proverb: Wives must be had, be they good or bad.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshimi yoki yomonmi, uyingda xotinning borligi yaxshi.
proverbList.equivalent: Xotinli ro‘zg‘or guldir, Xotinsiz ro‘zg‘or cho‘ldir.

proverbList.proverb:
No man knows best what good is than he who has endured evil.
He knows best what good is that has endured evil.
proverbList.explanation: Hech kim yomonga chidab sabr qilgan, boshidan o‘tkazgan insondek nima yaxshiligini bilmaydi. Yomonga chidab sabr qilgan, boshidan o‘tkazgan inson nima yaxshiligini juda yaxshi biladi, yaxshini yomondan farqlay oladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Jafo chekmagan safo qadrini bilmas.
Zimiston ko‘rmagan bulbul Guliston qadrini bilmas.

proverbList.proverb: Praise is a spur to the good, a thorn to the evil.
proverbList.explanation: Maqtov yaxshiga turtki, yomonga tikan bo‘ladi. Ya’ni maqtov yaxshi odamni yanada yaxshi qiladi, lekin yomon odamni yanada yomon qiladi.

proverbList.proverb: Hope for the best and prepare for the worst.
proverbList.explanation: Eng yaxshisini umid qil va eng yomoniga tayyor bo‘l.
proverbList.equivalent: Chiqmagan jondan umid.

proverbList.proverb: He that promises too much means nothing.
proverbList.explanation: Ko‘p va’da beradigan odamga ishonish kerak emas, u va’dasini bajarmaydi, uning gapi quruq va’daligicha qolib ketadi.

proverbList.proverb: Too much of a good thing is good for nothing.
proverbList.explanation: Biror yaxshi narsaning serob bo‘lishi, keragidan ham ortiq bo‘lishi hech narsaga foyda keltirmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Har narsaning ozi shirin.
Shakarning ozi shirin.
Asalning ham ozi shirin.

proverbList.proverb: Dogs that put up many hares kill none.
proverbList.explanation: Ko‘plab quyonlarni yig‘ib olgan kuchuklar, ularning hech qaysisini o‘ldirmaydi, yoki ko‘p qiyonni ortidan quvgan kuchuk birortasini ham tuta olmaydi. Ya’ni inson bir vaqtning o‘zida bir nechta emas bir ishning boshini mahkam tutishi lozim.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki quyonni quvlagan birini ham tutolmas.
Ko‘pga yugurgan ozdan qolar.
Ko‘p deb ozdan qolma.

proverbList.proverb: Many a fine dish has nothing on it.
proverbList.explanation: Dasturxonda ko‘plab a’lo sifatga ega idishlar bo‘lishi mumkin, lekin unda iste’mol qilishga arzigulik bir nima har doim ham topilavermaydi, ya’ni tashqi ko‘rinish har doim ham ishonchli bo‘lavermaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Tashqi ko‘rinish – aldamchi.
O‘zi bir tanga, To‘ni qirq tanga.

proverbList.proverb: Half a loaf is better than no bread.
proverbList.explanation: Umuman nonsiz bo‘lgandan ko‘ra yarim bo‘lak bo‘lsa ham noning borligi yaxshi.
proverbList.equivalent: Boriga shukur qil, Yo‘g‘iga – sabr.

proverbList.proverb: A hungry belly has no ears.
proverbList.explanation: Qorni och odam hech narsani eshitmaydi, ya’ni hech narsaga e’tibor bermaydi, u faqat qornini to‘ydirishni o‘ylaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Avval iqtisod, keyin siyosat.
Avval – non, keyin in’om.
Avval iqtisod, keyin siyosat.
Bo‘sh qop tik trmas.
Och otasini tanimas.

proverbList.proverb: A bad excuse is better than none at all
proverbList.explanation: Birorta qilingan nojo‘ya ishga umuman sabab ko‘rsatmagandan ko‘ra yomon bo‘lsa ham birorta vaj ko‘rsatgan yaxshiroq.

proverbList.proverb: A crust is better than no bread.
proverbList.explanation: Umuman nonsiz bo‘lgandan ko‘ra qattiq non (nonning chetki qattiq qismi) bo‘lsa ham noning borligi yaxshi.
proverbList.equivalent: Boriga shukur qil, Yo‘g‘iga – sabr.

proverbList.proverb: A little is better than none.
proverbList.explanation: Hech nima yo‘q bo‘lgandan ko‘ra oz bo‘la ham, nimadir bo‘lgani yaxshi.
proverbList.equivalent: Boriga shukur qil, Yo‘g‘iga – sabr.

proverbList.proverb: A quarrelsome man has no good neighbours.
proverbList.explanation: Janjalkashning yaxshi qo‘shnisi bo‘lmaydi, u hamma bilan janjallashaverganidan u yaxshi qo‘shnini ham yomon deb hisoblaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Hovli olma, qo‘shni ol.
Qo‘shning – tinch, Sen – tinch.

proverbList.proverb: A cat in gloves catches no mice.
proverbList.explanation: Qo‘lqop kiygan mushuk sichqonni tuta olmaydi, ya’ni juda ehtiyotkorlik yoki juda muloyimlik hech qanday natija bermaydi, biror narsaga erishish uchun inson o‘z maqsadida qattiq turishi va tirishqoqlik bilan harakat qilishi lozim.
proverbList.equivalent:
Tirishgan och qolmas.
Qimirlagan qir oshar, Tig‘izlagan tog‘ oshar.

proverbList.proverb: A clean hand wants no washing.
proverbList.explanation: Toza qo‘lni yuvish shart emas, ya’ni yaxshi insonni oqlash shart emas, uning yaxshiligi o‘z-o‘zidan ayon bo‘lib uradi.

proverbList.proverb:
A close mouth catches no flies.
A shut mouth catches noflies.
proverbList.explanation: Yopiq og‘izga hech qanday pashsha kirmaydi, ya’ni kam gapirgan yoki sukut saqlagan odamga odatda yomon baho berilmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Sukutda hikmat ko‘p, Bulutda – himmat.
Til – suyaksiz, tish – qal'a, Til yomoni – bir balo.
Uzun tilim – uzgun tilim, Qisqa tilim – tizgin tilim.
Arqonning uzuni, gapning qisqasi yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: A forced kindness deserves no thanks.
proverbList.explanation: Zo‘raki mehribonchilik rahmatga loyiq emas, ya’ni chin ko‘ngildan qilinmagan yaxshilik va mehribonchilik uchun rahmat aytishmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: A rolling stone gathers no moss.
proverbList.explanation: 1. Bir nechta ishni ketidan chopib birortasini ham toliq egallamagan inson muvaffaqiyatga erishmaydi. 2. Harakatda bo‘lgan inson qarimaydi va yomonliklardan yiroqda bo‘ladi, ish bilan band insonning nojo‘ya ishlarga vaqti bo‘lmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
1. Ikki quyonni quvlagan birini ham tutolmas.
Ko‘pga yugurgan ozdan qolar.
Ko‘p deb ozdan qolma.
Mingni chala bilgandan, Birni to‘la bilgan yaxshi.
Mingtaning tusini bilguncha, Bittaning ismini bil.
Yuz hunarni chala bilgandan Bir hunarni to‘la bil.
2. Harakat, harakatda barakat.
Bekorchilik – hamma illatlarning otasi.

proverbList.proverb: Soon hot, soon cold.
proverbList.explanation: Tez isigan tez soviydi, yoki tez yongan tez o‘chadi. Ya’ni tez qizishib, jahli chiqib ketadigan insonning jahli tez tushadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Lov yongan o‘t tez o‘char. Lov yonadi, lov o‘chadi.

proverbList.proverb: All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
proverbList.explanation: Faqat ishlab dam olmagan yoki o‘ynab-kulmagan inson ham ishidan zerikadi, ham o‘zi zerikarli odamga aylanadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Yaxshi dam – mehnatga hamdam.

proverbList.proverb: A Jack of all trades is master of none.
proverbList.explanation: Hamma kasbni qilaman degan odam aslida hech qaysi kasbini ustasi bo‘la olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki quyonni quvlagan birini ham tutolmas.
Ko‘pga yugurgan ozdan qolar.
Ko‘p deb ozdan qolma.
Mingni chala bilgandan, Birni to‘la bilgan yaxshi.
Mingtaning tusini bilguncha, Bittaning ismini bil.
Yuz hunarni chala bilgandan Bir hunarni to‘la bil.

proverbList.proverb: Hear all, see all, say nothing, take all, keep all, give nothing, and if you ever do anything for nothing do it for yourself.
proverbList.explanation: Hammasini ko‘r, hammasini eshit, hech narsa dema; hammasini ol, hammasini saqla, hech nima berma; agar biror narsani sababsiz bajarsang, uni o‘zing uchun bajar, shunda hayoting yaxshi o‘tadi.

proverbList.proverb: A friend to all is a friend to none.
proverbList.explanation: Hammaga birdek do‘st bo‘lishni istagan odam aslida hech kimga do‘st bo‘lmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ko‘pni sevgan birni sevmas.

proverbList.proverb: A friend to everybody is a friend to nobody.
proverbList.explanation: Hammaga birdek do‘st bo‘lishni istagan odam aslida hech kimga do‘st bo‘lmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ko’pni sevgan birni sevmas.

proverbList.proverb: There is no good accord, where every man would be a lord.
proverbList.explanation: Hamma o‘zini lord (boshliq) deb bilgan joyda yaxshi kelishuv bo‘lmaydi, chunki hamma o‘zini baland tutib sherigiga biroz bo‘lsa-da bo‘sh kelishni xohlamaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki qo‘chqor kallasi bir qozonda qaynamas.
Bir qozonda ikki qo‘chqorning kallasi qaynamaydi.
Xon bir bo‘lsa, el tuzalar, Ikki bo‘lsa, yurt buzilar.

proverbList.proverb: Better some of a pudding than none of a pie.
proverbList.explanation: Umuman pirogning yo‘q bo‘lganidan ko‘ra oz bolsa ham, biror shirinlik bo‘lani yaxshi.
proverbList.equivalent: Boriga shukur qil, Yo‘g‘iga – sabr.

proverbList.proverb: Little things are great to little man.
proverbList.explanation: Kichkina odamga kichik narsalar ham katta ko‘rinadi, ya’ni jamiyatda past mavqega ega odam uchun oddiy narsalar va voqealar ham katta ahamiyatga ega narsalardek tuyuladi yoki ta’sir qiladi, yuqori tabaqali odam esa bunday narsa va voqealarga e’tibor berimaydi, yoki ularga bu narsa va voqealar ta’sir qilmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: It is an ill wind that blows nobody good.
proverbList.explanation: Hech kimni yaxshilikka yetaklamagan shamol yomon shamoldir. Ya’ni hech kimni yaxshilikka undamagan odam ham yaxshi hisoblanmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Yaxshilik qila olmasang, Yomonlik ham qilma.

proverbList.proverb: No great loss without some small gain.
proverbList.explanation: Katta yo‘qotishlarda ham kichik muvaffaqiyatlar bo‘ladi, ya’ni biror nimani boy berdim deb xafa bo‘lishdan avval, shu boy berishda nimagadir erishilgani haqida ham o‘ylash kerak.
proverbList.equivalent: Har yomonning bir yaxshisi bor.

proverbList.proverb: The great would have none great, and the little all the little.
proverbList.explanation: Oddiy odamlar barcha oddiy odamlarni qo‘l ostida saqlaganida edi, buyuklarning qo‘l ostida  umuman buyuk odam bo‘lmas edi, chunki buyuklar ham oddiy odamlardan yetishib chiqadi.

proverbList.proverb: It is a good tongue that says no ill, and a better heart that thinks none.
proverbList.explanation: Yomon gapni gapirmaydigan til – yaxshi til, hech narsani (ya’ni yomonlikni) o‘ylamaydigan yurak undanda yaxshiroqdir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Tilingni to‘g‘ri tutolmasang, Dilingni to‘g‘ri tut.
Dili pokning ishi – pok.
Yomon til boshga balo keltirar, Yaxshi til davlat, dunyo
keltirar.

proverbList.proverb:
Nothing so bad, as not to be good for something.
Nothing so bad in which there is not something of good.
proverbList.explanation: Hech narsa o‘ta yomon bo‘lmaydi, uning ham  nimagadir nafi tegadi, birorbir yaxshi tarafi bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir yomonning yuz yaxshisi bor.
Har yomonning bir yaxshisi bor.
Har oqshomning bir tongi bor.

proverbList.proverb: Travel makes a wise man better, but a fool worse.
proverbList.explanation: Sayohat aqllini yanada aqlli qiladi, aqlsizni esa yanada aqlsiz qiladi.

proverbList.proverb: A wise enemy is better than a foolish friend.
proverbList.explanation: Ahmoq do‘stdan ko‘ra aqlli dushman yaxshiroqdir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoq do‘stdan aqlli dushman yaxshi.
Ahmoq do‘st yovdan yomon.
Do‘sti nodondan dushmani dono yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb:
A joke never gains an enemy but often loses a friend.
A joke never gains over an enemy, but often loses a friend.
proverbList.explanation: Hazil hech qachon dushman orttirmaydi, lekin hazil qilgan odam do‘stidan ayrilib qolishi mumkin. Chunki hazil bilan kishi o’z yaqinlarini xafa qilib qo‘yishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Hazilning tagi – zil.

proverbList.proverb: What the fool does in the end, the wise man does at the beginning.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlsiz oxirida qiladigan ishni aqlli boshida qiladi, ya’ni aqlsiz nima qilish kerakligini juda kech, oxirida tushinib yetadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Tentakning aqli tushdan keyin kirar.
Ahmoqning aqli tushdan keyin kirar.

proverbList.proverb: Small gifts make friends, great ones make enemies.
proverbList.explanation: Kichik sovg‘alar do‘stlikni mustahkamlaydi, katta sovg‘alar esa dushmanlikka olib keladi, ya’ni do‘stiga kichik emas balki katta sovg‘a qilgan odam undan ham katta sovg‘a kutadi, agar bunday sovg‘ani olmasa, uni yomon ko‘rib qoladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bor tovog‘im, kel tovog‘im, Kelishingda quruq bo‘lsang, O‘rta yerda sin, tovog‘im.
Bor tovog‘im, kel tovog‘im, Bormasang, kelmasang, O‘rtada sin tovog‘im.

proverbList.proverb: A good word for a bad one is worth much and costs little.
proverbList.explanation: Yomon so‘zga javoban aytilgan so‘z ko‘p maqtovga arziydi, lekin uni doim past baholashadi, ya’ni unga yetarlicha baho berishmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yaxshilikka yaxshilik – Har kishining ishidir.
Yomonlikka yaxshilik – Mard kishining ishidir.

proverbList.proverb: A good payer is master of another’s purse.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshi to‘laydigan odam boshqalarning hamyoniga egalik qiladi, ya’ni boshqalardan oson qo‘lga kiritilgan pul o‘ylab o‘tirilmay oson sarflanadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Oson kelgan pul oson ketadi.
Haromdan kelgan haromga ketar.

proverbList.proverb: God rejoices when one beggar scratches another.
proverbList.explanation: Bir tilanchi ikkinchi bir tilanchini qashlab qo‘ysa Xudo ham xursand bo‘larkan.
proverbList.equivalent: Yordam bergin, “Kimsan”, deb so‘rama.

proverbList.proverb: He carries fire in one hand and water in the other.
proverbList.explanation: Bir qo‘lida olov ushlagan odam ikkinchi qo‘lida suv olib yuradi, ya’ni sizga yaxshi gapirgan ba’zi odamlar orqangizdan yomonlik ham qilishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Tilida boshqa narsa, Dilida boshqa narsa.

proverbList.proverb: If one will not, another will.
proverbList.explanation: Biror ishni bir odam bajarmasa, boshqa biri bajaradi.

proverbList.proverb: It is one thing to flourish and another to fight.
proverbList.explanation: Ba’zi narsalar gullab-yashnash (yoki, yaxshilik) uchun xizmat qilsa, boshqalari esa jang qilish yoki vayron qilish uchun xizmat qiladi.

proverbList.proverb: Just give me one end of the line and I'll get to the other.
proverbList.explanation: Menga chiziqning bir uchini ber, uning narigi uchiga o‘zim yetib olaman. Ya’ni biror yangi ishni boshlaganda bu ishni yaxshi biladigan odam ishni boshlagan odamga yo‘l-yo‘riq ko‘rsatsa, u odam ishni o‘zi tugata oladi.

proverbList.proverb: One half of the world does not know how the other half lives.
proverbList.explanation: Dunyoning birinchi yarmi uning ikkinchi yarmi qanday hayot kechirayotganini bilmaydi, ya’ni odamlar boshqalarning qanday yashayotganini to‘liq bilishmaydi, masalan, boylar kambag‘allarning aslida qanday kun ko‘rishayotganini bilmasligi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Qorni to‘qning qorni och bilan ishi yo‘q.
Kasal dardini sog‘ bilmas, Och qadrini to‘q bilmas.
Tanasi boshqa dard bilmas, Uyi boshqa g‘am bilmas.
Tanasi boshqa dard bilmas.

proverbList.proverb: One barber shaves another gratis.
proverbList.explanation: Bir sartarosh ikkinchisining soqolini tekinga oladi, ya’ni bir-biriga ishi tushadigan odamlar bir-biridan to‘lov yoki boshqa narsa kutmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Qarg‘a qarg‘aning ko‘zini cho‘qimas.

proverbList.proverb: One fool praises another.
proverbList.explanation: Bir ahmoq boshqa bir ahmoqni maqtaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoq ahmoqqa yon bosar.
Ko‘r ko‘rni qorong‘uda topar.

proverbList.proverb: One hand washes the other.
proverbList.explanation: Bir qo‘l boshqasini yuvar. Ya’ni bir odam boshqasiga yordam bersa, osha odam yana kimgadir yordam beradi, odamlar bir-birining yordami bilan biror maqsadga erisha oladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Sizdan ugina, bizdan bugina.

proverbList.proverb: One man sows and another reaps.
proverbList.explanation: Bir odam ekadi, boshqasi hosilni yig‘ib oladi, ba’zan bir odam qattiq mehnat qilsa-da, uning huzurini boshqa odam ko‘radi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir odam daraxt eksa, Boshqasi uning soyasida o‘tirar.
Bir dehqon omoch bilan, Yettovlon cho‘mich bilan.
Birov – omoch bilan, Yettov – cho‘mich bilan.

proverbList.proverb: One man’s loss is another man's gain.
proverbList.explanation:
Bir odamning yo‘qotgani
boshqa bir odamning yutug‘i bo‘lishi mumkin, ya’ni bir odamning muvaffaqiyatsizlikka uchrashi boshqa odamning muvaffaqiyatiga olib keladi.

proverbList.proverb: One man’s meat is another man’s poison.
proverbList.explanation: Bir odam go‘sht yegani sababli boshqa bir odamning zahar ichishga majbur bo‘lishi mumkin, ya’ni ba’zan bir odamning muvaffaqiyatni qo‘lga kiritishi boshqa bir odamning muvaffaqiyatsizligiga olib keladi.

proverbList.proverb: One man’s yawning makes another yawn.
proverbList.explanation: Bir odam esnasa boshqalarga ham bu yuqib, esnashni boshlaydi. Ya’ni bir inson boshqalarda ko‘rgan narsasini olgisi yoki ular bajargan ishni qilgisi keladi.

proverbList.proverb: One man may steal a horse, while another may not look over a hedge.
proverbList.explanation: Bir odam ot o‘g‘irlay oladi, boshqa biri xattoki to‘siqning uyog‘iga ham qaray olmaydi, odamlar har xil bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Besh qo‘l barobar emas.
Besh barmoq barobar emas.
Kishi bilan kishi teng emas.

proverbList.proverb: One story is good till another is told.
proverbList.explanation: Bir hikoya ikkinchi bir hikoya aytilgunicha hammani e’tiborida turadi, ikkinchi hikoya aytilishi bilan hamma shu ikkinchi hikoyaga qiziqib, birinchisini unutadi.

proverbList.proverb: One wedding brings another.
proverbList.explanation: Bir to‘y ikkinchisini olib keladi, ya’ni bir xursandchilik ketidan boshqasi keladi.
proverbList.equivalent: To‘y ketidan to‘y kelar, A’za – ketidan a’za.

proverbList.proverb: One beats the bush, and another catches the bird.
proverbList.explanation: Bir odam butani qimirlatsa, boshqasi qushni tutadi, ya’ni ba’zan bir odam qattiq mehnat qilsa-da, uning huzurini boshqa odam ko‘radi.
proverbList.equivalent: Bir odam daraxt eksa, Boshqasi uning soyasida o‘tirar.

proverbList.proverb: One fire drives out another.
proverbList.explanation: Bir olov ikkinchisiga sabab bo‘ladi, ya’ni bir falokat ikkinchi falokatni chaqirishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: To‘y ketidan to‘y kelar, A’za – ketidan a’za.

proverbList.proverb: One potter envies another.
proverbList.explanation: Bir kulol boshqa kulolga xasad qiladi, ya’ni ba’zilar o‘zi kabi mehnat qilib yaxshiroq natijaga erishganlarga xasad ko‘zi bilan qaraydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Xashak o‘ti xonani kuydirar, Hasad o‘ti tanani kuydirar.

proverbList.proverb: One good turn deserves another.
