proverbList.explanation: Bir yaxshi o‘zgarish boshqa bir yaxshilikka munosibdir, yoki boshqa bir yaxshilikni chaqiradi.
proverbList.equivalent: To‘y ketidan to‘y kelar, A’za – ketidan a’za.

proverbList.proverb: One sheep follows another.
proverbList.explanation: Bir qo‘y boshqasiga ergashadi, ya’ni inson ham yonidagi inson qilgan ishni qaytaradi, bir-biridan o‘rganadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Olma olmadan rang olar.
Qovun qovundan rang olar.
Sharob uzumdan rang olar, Odam odamdan rang olar.

proverbList.proverb: One sword keeps another in the sheath.
proverbList.explanation: Bir qilich ikkinchi bir qilichni qinidan chiqmasligini ta’minlaydi, ya’ni bir boshliq boshqalarni boshliq bo‘lish xohishini sindirib turadi, bir joyda faqat bitta boshliq bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki qo‘chqor kallasi bir qozonda qaynamas.
Bir qozonda ikki qo‘chqorning kallasi qaynamaydi.

proverbList.proverb: One nail drives out another.
proverbList.explanation: Bir tirnoq ikkinchi bir tirnoqni ko‘chirib oladi, ba’zan bir onadan tug‘ilgan aka-uka va opa-singillar ham bir-biriga yomonlik qiladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
O‘rtada burun bo‘lmasa, Ko‘z ko‘zni o‘yar.
U ko‘z bu ko‘zga do‘st emas.

proverbList.proverb: One kindness is the price of another.
proverbList.explanation: Bir yaxshilik boshqa bir yaxshilikka sabab bo‘ladi, yaxshilikka yaxshilik bilan javob beriladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yaxshilik qil, daryoga tashla, Baliq bilar, Baliq bilmasa, xoliq bilar.
Daryoga yaxshilik qilsang, Ajrini biyobondan topasan.

proverbList.proverb: Saying one thing, and doing another.
proverbList.explanation: Bir narsani aytadi, boshqa narsa qiladi, ya’ni sizga yaxshi gapirgan ba’zi odamlar orqangizdan yomonlik ham qilishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Tilida boshqa narsa, Dilida boshqa narsa.

proverbList.proverb: Submitting to one wrong brings on another.
proverbList.explanation: Bitta xatoga yo‘l qo‘yib berish ikkinchisini keltirib chiqaradi.

proverbList.proverb: That’s a horse of another colour.
proverbList.explanation: Bu boshqa bir rangli ot, bu maqol odatda bu narsa umuman boshqa narsa, uni avvalgisi bilan adashtirmang degan ma’noda qo‘llaniladi.

proverbList.proverb: The folly of one man is the fortune of another.
proverbList.explanation: Bir odamning aqlsizligi boshqa bir odamga omad yoki baxt olib kelishi mumkin.

proverbList.proverb: When one door shuts, another opens.
proverbList.explanation: Bir eshik yopilsa, boshqasi ochiladi, ya’ni bir imkoniyat yo‘qqa chiqsa, boshqa bir imkoniyat paydo bo‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: Wine is one thing, drunkenness is another.
proverbList.explanation: Vino – boshqa narsa, mastlik – boshqa narsa, vinoni ko‘rib uni ichish yoki ichmaslik, me’yorini bilish odamni o‘ziga bog‘liq.
proverbList.equivalent:
Mening nafsim balodur, Yonar o‘tga soladur.
Nafsini tiygan — vali.
Nafsini tiygan kishi sulton bo‘lur, Nafsini tiymagan kishi ulton bo‘lur.

proverbList.proverb: A proverb is the wit of one and the wisdom of many.
proverbList.explanation: Maqol bir kishining so‘zga chechanligi, ko‘p kishining donoligidir; ya’ni 1) maqolni o‘z nutqida ishlatgan kishi aqlli va so‘zga chechan hisoblanadi, maqol esa ko‘plab kishilarning donoligi asosida vujudga keladi va qo‘llaniladi; 2) maqol bir shaxs tomonidan yaratiladigan va ko‘pchilik tomonidan tan olinib, foydalaniladigan aqlli gapdir.
proverbList.equivalent: So‘z ko‘rki – maqol.

proverbList.proverb: A rising tide lifts all boats.
proverbList.explanation: Ko‘tarilayotgan to‘lqin hamma qayiqni birdek ko‘taradi (yutadi), ya'ni ofat yoki kulfat hammaga birdek yopiriladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Kemaga tushganning joni bir.
O‘rmonga o‘t ketsa, Ho‘l-u quruq birdek yonar.

proverbList.proverb: A knowledge of a learned man is limited if he stays at home all the time.
proverbList.explanation: O‘qigan odam har doim uyida o‘tirsa, uning bilimi chegaralanib qoladi, u bilimini ko‘chadagi har xil holatlarda qo‘llab, tajriba orqali rivojlantiradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir sinalgan tajriba Yetti kitobdan afzal.
Ko‘rgan ko‘p bilar, O‘qigan – oz.

proverbList.proverb: Get a name to rise early, and you may lie all day.
proverbList.explanation: Erta uyg‘onadi degan nomga ega bo‘l, keyin kuni bo‘yi yotsang ham hech kim bunga e’tibor bermaydi.

proverbList.proverb:
If one sheep leaps o‘er the dyke, all the rest will follow.
If one sheep leaps over the ditch, all the rest will follow.
proverbList.explanation: Agar bir qo‘y to‘g‘ondan / ariqdan hatlab o‘tsa, qolgan hammasi unga ergashadi. Ya’ni inson ham yonidagi inson qilgan ishni qaytaradi, bir-biridan o‘rganadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Olma olmadan rang olar.
Qovun qovundan rang olar.
Sharob uzumdan rang olar, Odam odamdan rang olar.

proverbList.proverb: If you have known one, you have known them all.
proverbList.explanation: Agar bir guruhga oid narsa yoki shaxslarning birortasini bilsangiz, shunga qarab qolgan hammasini bilib olasiz.

proverbList.proverb: In a church, in an inn, and in a coffin, all men are equal.
proverbList.explanation: Cherkovda, mehmonxonada va tobutda hamma odam tengdir, ya’ni shunday joylar borki, u yerlarda insonlar turli tabaqalarga ajratilmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Shoh-u gado bir qabrda yotar.
O‘lim shoh-u gadoga barobar.

proverbList.proverb: One size does not fit all.
proverbList.explanation: Bir o‘lcham hammaga to‘g‘ri kelmaydi, hamma odam har xil.
proverbList.equivalent:
Dunyoni o‘z qariching bilan o‘lchama.
Besh barmoq barobar emas.
Kishi bilan kishi teng emas.

proverbList.proverb: Patience is a plaster for all sores.
proverbList.explanation: Sabr barcha xastaliklarga davodir, sabr hamma narsani davolaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Hamma narsaning davosi – sabr.

proverbList.proverb: Of one ill come many.
proverbList.explanation: Bir yomonlikdan boshqalari ham kelib chiqadi, bir xatolik boshqa ko‘plab xatoliklarga sabab bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Yomonlik yomonlikni chaqiradi.

proverbList.proverb: One funeral makes many.
proverbList.explanation: Bir a’za yana ko‘plab a’zalarni olib keladi, xafagarchilik kelsa, uning ortidan yana xafagarchilik ergashadi.
proverbList.equivalent: To‘y ketidan to‘y kelar, A’za – ketidan a’za.

proverbList.proverb: One lie makes many.
proverbList.explanation: Bir yolg‘on yana ko‘plab yolg‘onni vujudga keltiradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir yolg‘on ikki yolg‘onni tug‘ilishiga sabab bo‘ladi.
Bir illat ikkinchisini chaqiradi, Bir yolg‘on keyingisini.

proverbList.proverb: Pardon one offence and you encourage many.
proverbList.explanation: Bir jinoyatni kechirsangiz boshqa ko‘plab jinoyatlarni dunyoga kelishiga yo‘l qo‘yib bergan bo‘lasiz.

proverbList.proverb: One drop of poison infects the whole tun of wine.
proverbList.explanation: Bir tomchi zahar bir idish vinoning hammasini zaharlaydi; ya’ni bir yomon narsa yoki odam yaxshilar orasiga tushsa ularni ham yomon otliq qiladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir tirroqi buzoq butun podani bulg‘aydi.
Bir qorin moyni bir qumaloq buzar.

proverbList.proverb: One link broken, the whole chain is broken.
proverbList.explanation: Zanjirning bir halqasi sinsa, butun bir zanjir sinadi, ya’ni bir-biriga bog‘liq narsalardan birortasi buzilsa, bu holat qolganlarini ham buzadi, ular bir butun bo‘la olmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: One scabby sheep will mar a whole flock.
proverbList.explanation: Bir qo‘tir (kasallangan) qo‘y butun bir podani buzadi (kasallantiradi). Ya’ni bir yomon narsa yoki odam yaxshilar orasiga tushsa ularni ham yomon otliq qiladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir tirroqi buzoq butun podani bulg‘aydi.
Bir qorin moyni bir qumaloq buzar.

proverbList.proverb: A thing you don’t want is dear at any price.
proverbList.explanation: Sizga yoqmagan narsaning narxi qancha bo‘lsa ham, sizga doim qimmatdek tuyuladi.

proverbList.proverb: Every man for himself, and God for us all.
proverbList.explanation: Har bir odam o‘zi uchun harakat qiladi, o‘ylaydi, Xudo esa hamma haqida o‘ylaydi, g‘amxo‘rlik va nazorat qiladi.

proverbList.proverb: He that commits a fault thinks everyone speaks of it.
proverbList.explanation: Xato qilgan odam hamma u haqida gapiradi deb o‘ylaydi, hamma shubha bilan qaraydi.

proverbList.proverb: He that has a great nose thinks everybody is speaking of it.
proverbList.explanation: Burni katta odam hamma uning burni haqida gapirmoqda deb o‘ylaydi, ya’ni kamchiligi bor odam hamma shu kamchiligi haqida gapiradi deb biladi.

proverbList.proverb: There is a place for everything, and everything in its place.
proverbList.explanation: Hamma narsa uchun joy topiladi va hamma narsa o‘z o‘rnida bo‘lishi lozim, gapni ham o‘rni kelsa gapirish lozim, kerak bo‘lmagan gapni gapirmagan ma’qul.
proverbList.equivalent:
Har narsaning o‘z o‘rni bor.
O‘nta bo‘lsa o‘rni boshqa, Qirqta bo‘lsa – qilig‘i.
Yoz ketar, qish kelar, Shoshmay turing, ish kelar.

proverbList.proverb: There is a time for everything.
proverbList.explanation: Hamma narsaning o‘z vaqti bor. Ya’ni shoshgandan foyda yo‘q, har narsa o‘z mavridi va navbati bilan bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bahor bo‘lmay, yoz bo‘lmas, Kuz bo‘lmasdan, qish bo‘lmas.
Birovga besh kun oldin kelsa, Birovga besh kun keyin keladi.
Yoz ketar, qish kelar, Shoshmay turing, ish kelar.
Har narsaning o‘z vaqti bor.
Tegirmon navbati bilan.

proverbList.proverb: There is a time and place for everything.
proverbList.explanation: Hamma narsaning o‘z vaqti va o‘rni bor. Ya’ni har narsa uchun mos joy va vaqt topiladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bahor bo‘lmay, yoz bo‘lmas, Kuz bo‘lmasdan, qish bo‘lmas.
Birovga besh kun oldin kelsa, Birovga besh kun keyin keladi.
Yoz ketar, qish kelar, Shoshmay turing, ish kelar. 
Har narsaning o‘z vaqti va o‘rni bor.
Tegirmon navbati bilan.

proverbList.proverb: There is a black sheep in every flock.
proverbList.explanation: Har qanday podada bir qora qo‘y bor, ya’ni har qanday guruhning ichida yaxshisi bo‘lganidek, yomoni ham topiladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Birning kasofati yuzga, Yuzniki mingga.
Birning kasofati mingga tegar.
Birning kasofati mingga tegar, Mingniki – tumanga.
Birning kasri mingga, Mingning kasri tumanga tegar. 
Birniki mingga, Mingniki – tumanga. 
Guruch kurmaksiz bo‘lmas.

proverbList.proverb: It is a wise child that knows its own father.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlli bola o‘z otasini biladi, ya’ni otasini hurmatini joyiga qo‘yadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ota rozi – xudo rozi.
Ota oldidan o‘tma, Odob oldidan ketma.
Ota-onasini tanimagan tangrisini tanimas.
Payg‘ambar qizi bo‘lma, Otang qizi bo‘l.
O‘g‘irlik osh badanga yuqmas, Yomon bola ota-onaga boqmas.

proverbList.proverb: Praise the child, and you make love to the mother.
proverbList.explanation: Onasini yoqtirsang, unda o‘zingga nisbatan mehr uyg‘otmoqchi bo‘lsang, uning bolasini maqta.

proverbList.proverb: The child is the father of the man.
proverbList.explanation: Inson yoshligida qanday tarbiya olgan bo‘lsa va qanday xususiyatlarga ega bo‘lgan bo‘lsa, u katta bo‘lganida ham shunday xususiyatlarni ko‘rsatadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Daraxtdan meva olaman desang, Niholligidan parvarish qil.

proverbList.proverb: He that would the daughter win, must with the mother first begin.
proverbList.explanation: Qiziga uylanishni xohlagan kishi avval uning onasiga yoqishni eplashi lozim, onasiga yoqsa, uning qiziga ham yoqishi oson bo‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: Even the weariest river winds somewhere safe to sea.
proverbList.explanation: Hatto eng pishqirib (xavfli) oqadigan daryo ham qayerdadir sokin dengizga quyiladi, ya’ni qiyinchilik ortidan albatta yaxshi kunlar ham keladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Azob ko‘rmay, rohat yo‘q.
Bir kun ming kun emas.
Bir yomonning qarshisida yuz yaxshi bor.
Oyning o‘n beshi qorong‘u bo‘lsa, O‘n beshi – yorug‘.
O‘ttiz kun ro‘zaning bir kun hayiti bor.

proverbList.proverb: Follow the river and you'll get to the sea.
proverbList.explanation: Daryoga ergashsang, dengizga yetasan, ya’ni 1) oz-ozdan, bosqichma-bosqich biror narsaga intilsang, unga albatta erishasan; 2) oz-ozdan bilim olsang, bilimdon inson bo‘lasan.
proverbList.equivalent:
Birin-birin ming bo‘lar, Toma-toma ko‘l bo‘lar.
Toma-toma ko‘l bolur.
Oz-ozdan o‘rganib, dono bo‘lur, Qatra-qatra yig‘ilib, daryo bo‘lur.

proverbList.proverb: Drops that gather one by one finally become a sea.
proverbList.explanation: Tomchilar birma-bir yig‘ilib oxiri dengizga aylanadi, ya’ni 1) oz-ozdan yig‘ilib ko‘p miqdorga aylanadi; 2) oz-ozdan bilim olsang, bilimdon inson bo‘lasan.
proverbList.equivalent:
Birin-birin ming bo‘lar, Toma-toma ko‘l bo‘lar.
Toma-toma ko‘l bolur.
Oz-ozdan o‘rganib, dono bo‘lur, Qatra-qatra yig‘ilib, daryo bo‘lur.

proverbList.proverb: The frog in the well knows nothing of the sea.
proverbList.explanation: Quduqdagi baqa dengiz haqida hech narsa bilmaydi, ya’ni dunyoqarashi tor, qaysar inson o‘zini fikridan boshqasini o‘ylab ko‘rmaydi, o‘z fikrini to‘g‘ri deb turaveradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoqqa aytgan bilan gap uqmas, Xarsangga qoqqan bilan mix o‘tmas.
Ahmoq o‘zi bilmas, Bilganning so‘ziga kirmas.

proverbList.proverb: Half the truth is often a whole lie.
proverbList.explanation: Yarimta rost gap odatda butun yolg‘on bo‘ladi, ya’ni haqiqatni to‘liq emas, yarminigina olish uni yolg‘onga aylantiradi.

proverbList.proverb: The half is better than the whole.
proverbList.explanation: Ba’zida yarimta butundan ko‘ra yaxshiroq.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yarimta non – rohati jon.
Asalning ham ozi shirin.
Oz bo‘lsin, soz bo‘lsin.

proverbList.proverb: Half an egg is better than n empty shell.
proverbList.explanation: Bitta tuxumning bo‘sh po‘chog‘idan ko‘ra yarimta bo‘lsa ham tuxum bo‘lgani yaxshi, foydasiz narsaning butunidan ko‘ra, yarimta bo‘lsa ham foydali narsa bo‘lgani yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: Half a word is enough for a wise man.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlli odamga yarimta so‘z ham yetadi, chunki yarimta so‘zingizdan nima demoqchi ekanligingizni biladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Aqlliga bir so‘z bas, Aqlsizga ming so‘z oz.

proverbList.proverb:
Speech is silver, but silence is golden.
Speech is silver, silence is golden.
proverbList.explanation: Nutq – kumush, lekin sukut – oltin, ya’ni yaxshi gap yaxshi, lekin sukut undan ham yaxshi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Sukutda hikmat ko‘p, Bulutda – himmat.
Gapning ozi yaxshi, Qizning – nozi.
Ko‘p gapning ozi yaxshi, Oz gapning sozi yaxshi.
Gapirib pushaymon yegandan, Gapirmay dog‘da qol.
Uzun tilim – uzgun tilim, Qisqa tilim – tizgin tilim.
Arqonning uzuni, gapning qisqasi yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: Wisdom is better than silver or gold.
proverbList.explanation: Aql va donolik kumush yoki oltindan ham yaxshiroqdir. Chunki kumush yoki oltin tugaydi, aql esa har doim o‘z egasiga naf keltiradi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ko‘p moldan oz aql yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: Iron will not become fine gold, however it is often refined.
proverbList.explanation: Temirga qancha ishlov berilsa ham, u oltin bo‘la olmaydi; insonlar ham shunday, aslida yomon tarbiya olgan insonga qancha to‘g‘ri yo‘l ko‘rsangiz ham, u o‘z tarbiyasiga xos ishni qilaveradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bukrini go‘r tuzatadi.
Ilon po‘stini tashlasa ham – ilon.
It itligini etar, To‘n etagini yirtar.
Kuchuk birla xo‘tikni qancha qilma tarbiya, It bo‘lur, eshak bo‘lur, bo‘lmas aslo odamiy.
Echki yugurib kiyik bo‘lmas.

proverbList.proverb: He that would have eggs must endure the cackling of hens.
proverbList.explanation: Tuxum olishni istagan kishi tovuqni qichqirishiga chidashi kerak, ya’ni biror natijaga erishish uchun mashaqqatiga ham chidash kerak.
proverbList.equivalent:
Jon kuydirmasang, jonona qayda, Toqqa chiqmasang, do‘lona qayda.
Mehnat, mehnatning tagi – rohat.
Chidaganga chiqargan.

proverbList.proverb: One chick keeps a hen busy.
proverbList.explanation: Bitta jo‘ja bir tovuqni band qiladi, ya’ni 1) bir bola onaning hamma vaqtini o‘zi oladi; 2) bilimsiz va tajribasiz odam bilimli va tajribali odamning vaqtini oladi.

proverbList.proverb: Never send a boy to do a man’s job.
proverbList.explanation: Katta kishi bajaradigan ishni bolaga buyurmaslik kerak, chunki u bu yumushni bajara olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Bolaga ish buyur, Orqasidan o‘zing yugur.

proverbList.proverb: Naughty boys sometimes make good men.
proverbList.explanation: Ba’zan quloqsiz boladan yaxshi insonlar yetishib chiqadi.

proverbList.proverb: An Englishman’s house is his castle.
proverbList.explanation: Inglizning uyi uning uchun qasrdir, inglizlar o‘z uylarida o‘zlari boshqaruvchi bo‘lib, boshqalar ularning ichki ishlariga aralashmasligiga va xavfsiz bo‘lishiga katta ahamiyat qaratishadi.

proverbList.proverb: My house is my castle.
proverbList.explanation: Mening uyim – mening qasrim, uning ichki ishlariga hech kim aralashmaydi, inson o‘z uyida qanday xohlasa, shunday yashaydi, o‘zini erkin his qiladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Begonaning dang‘illama saroyidan O‘zingning kulbayi vayronang yaxshi.
Tomi qiyshiq bo’lsayam, o‘z uyim yaxshi.
O‘z uyim – o‘lan to‘shagim.

proverbList.proverb: If Saint Paul’s day be fair and clear, it will betide a happy year.
proverbList.explanation: Agar Avliyo Paul kuni (25-yanvar) ob-havo yog‘ingarchiliksiz (yoqimli) va ochiq bo‘lsa, butun bir yil shunday bo‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: God made the country, and man made the town.
proverbList.explanation: Xudo qishloqni yaratgan, inson esa shaharni, ya’ni qishloqda Xudo tomonidan yaratilgan tabiat o‘z tabiiyligini yo‘qotmaydi, shaharda esa tabiat insonlar tomonidan o‘zgartirilib, ko‘p narsalar inson tomonidan yaratiladi.

proverbList.proverb: It never rains but it pours.
proverbList.explanation: Bu yomg‘ir bo‘lib yog‘maydi, balki jala bo‘lib quyadi. Ya’ni yomonlik, baxtsizlik yoki omadsizlik bir kelsa, bittalab emas, qo‘sha-qo‘sha keladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Baxtsizlik kelsa, qo‘sha-qo‘sha keladi.

proverbList.proverb: They that sow the wind shall reap the whirlwind.
proverbList.explanation: Shamol ekkan o‘rama shamol (aylana harakatlanib baland o‘ra hosil qiladigan qattiq shamol) yig‘ib oladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Nima eksang, shuni o‘rasan.
Ne eksang, shu ko‘karar.
Arpa ekkan arpa olar, Bug‘doy ekkan – bug‘doy.

proverbList.proverb: Learn to creep before you leap.
proverbList.explanation: Sakrashdan oldin emaklashni o‘rganish lozim, ya’ni qiyin va murakkab ishni bajarishdan oldin oddiy ishni bajarishni bilib  olish lozim.
proverbList.equivalent: Yurishni bilmasang, sakrashga urinma.

proverbList.proverb: Claw me, and I will claw thee(17).
proverbList.explanation: Meni qashlab qo‘y, keyin men seni qashliman; ya’ni menga yordam bersang, men ham senga yordam beraman.
proverbList.equivalent:
Sizdan ugina, bizdan bugina.
Bugun – sizdan, Ertaga – bizdan.*
Bugun sizdan, Ertaga bizdan.
proverbList.footnote: 17 Old variant of “you” / “You” so‘zining tarixiy varianti.

proverbList.proverb: Neither here nor there.
proverbList.explanation: Bu yerda ham emas, u yerda ham emas, ya’ni gapirilayotgan narsa biror bir ahamiyatga ega emas, nazarda tutilayotgan ishning so‘zlovchi uchun umuman farqi yo‘q.

proverbList.proverb: A miserly father makes a prodigal son.
proverbList.explanation: Xasis otaning o‘g‘li pulni o‘ylamay sarflaydigan bo‘ladi. Chunki ota pulni o‘g‘li uchun yig‘adi, o‘g‘il esa pulni o‘zi ishlab topmagani sababli, o‘ylamay ishlataveradi.

proverbList.proverb: In a gambling house, there are no fathers and sons.
proverbList.explanation: Qimorxonada ota va o‘g‘il bir-birini tanimaydi.

proverbList.proverb: If the father is spotted, the son will be speckled.
proverbList.explanation: Agar otasida katta dog‘lar bo‘lsa, o‘glida mayda dog‘lar bo‘ladi, otasi yo‘lbars bo‘lsa, o‘gli it bo‘la olmaydi, ya’ni o‘g‘il har tomolama otasiga o‘xshaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Olmadan – olma, dovchadan – dovcha.
Olma tagiga olma tushadi.
Otasining bolasi.
Otadan – o‘g‘il, onadan – qiz.
Otasi qulon otolmaganning bolasi quyon otolmas.
Qiz bersang, otasiga qarab ber, Qiz olsang, onasiga qarab ol.
Qo‘zi qo‘chqordan nishon, O‘g‘il – otadan.

proverbList.proverb: If the father is a tiger, the son cannot be a dog.
proverbList.explanation: Otasi yo‘lbars bo‘lsa, o‘gli it bo‘la olmaydi; ya’ni o‘g‘il har tomolama otasiga oxshaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Olmadan – olma, dovchadan – dovcha.
Olma tagiga olma tushadi.
Otasining bolasi.
Otadan – o‘g‘il, onadan – qiz.
Otasi qulon otolmaganning bolasi quyon otolmas.
Qiz bersang, otasiga qarab ber, Qiz olsang, onasiga qarab ol.
Qo‘zi qo‘chqordan nishon, O‘g‘il – otadan.

proverbList.proverb: He is his father’s son.
proverbList.explanation: U otasining o‘g‘li, ya’ni otasiga o‘xshaydi; otasini bilsangiz o‘glini ham bilasiz.
proverbList.equivalent:
Olmadan – olma, dovchadan – dovcha.
Olma tagiga olma tushadi.
Otasining bolasi.
Otadan – o‘g‘il, onadan – qiz.
Otasi qulon otolmaganning bolasi quyon otolmas.
Qiz bersang, otasiga qarab ber, Qiz olsang, onasiga qarab ol.
Qo‘zi qo‘chqordan nishon, O‘g‘il – otadan.

proverbList.proverb: He is his mother’s son.
proverbList.explanation: U onasining o‘g‘li, ya’ni onasiga o‘xshaydi; onasini bilsangiz o‘g‘lini ham bilasiz.
proverbList.equivalent:
Olmadan – olma, dovchadan – dovcha.
Olma tagiga olma tushadi.

proverbList.proverb: Like father, like son.
proverbList.explanation: Otasi qanday bo‘lsa, o‘g‘li ham shunday; otasini bilsangiz o‘glini ham bilasiz.
proverbList.equivalent:
Olmadan – olma, dovchadan – dovcha.
Olma tagiga olma tushadi.
Otasining bolasi.
Otadan – o‘g‘il, onadan – qiz.
Otasi qulon otolmaganning bolasi quyon otolmas.
Qiz bersang, otasiga qarab ber, Qiz olsang, onasiga qarab ol.
Qo‘zi qo‘chqordan nishon, O‘g‘il – otadan.

proverbList.proverb: Like mother, like daughter
proverbList.explanation: Onasi qanday bo‘lsa, qizi ham shunday; onasini bilsangiz qizini ham bilasiz.
proverbList.equivalent:
Arqog‘ini ko‘rib bo‘zini ol, Onasini ko‘rib – qizini.
Eshigi yomonning uyiga borma, Onasi yomonning qizini olma.
Olmadan – olma, dovchadan – dovcha.
Olma tagiga olma tushadi.
Ona aqli – qiz aqli.
Otadan – o‘g‘il, onadan – qiz.
Terakka qarab, tol o‘sar.
Onaga qarab, qiz o‘sar.
Qiz bersang, otasiga qarab ber, Qiz olsang, onasiga qarab ol.

proverbList.proverb: Like parents, like children.
proverbList.explanation: Ota-ona qanday bo‘lsa, farzandlari ham shunday; farzandlar ota- onasiga o‘xshaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Olmadan – olma, dovchadan – dovcha.
Olma tagiga olma tushadi.
Daraxtiga ko‘ra – mevasi, Ota-onasiga ko‘ra – bolasi.

proverbList.proverb: She is her father’s daughter.
proverbList.explanation: U otasining qizi, ya’ni otasiga o‘xshaydi; otasini bilsangiz qizini ham bilasiz.
proverbList.equivalent:
Olmadan – olma, dovchadan – dovcha.
Olma tagiga olma tushadi.
Otasining bolasi.

proverbList.proverb: She is her mother’s daughter.
proverbList.explanation: U onasining qizi, ya’ni onasiga o‘xshaydi; onasini bilsangiz qizini ham bilasiz.
proverbList.equivalent:
Arqog‘ini ko‘rib bo‘zini ol, Onasini ko‘rib – qizini.
Eshigi yomonning uyiga borma, Onasi yomonning qizini olma.
Olmadan – olma, dovchadan – dovcha.
Olma tagiga olma tushadi.
Ona aqli – qiz aqli.
Otadan – o‘g‘il, onadan – qiz.
Terakka qarab, tol o‘sar.
Onaga qarab, qiz o‘sar.
Qiz bersang, otasiga qarab ber, Qiz olsang, onasiga qarab ol.

proverbList.proverb: Virtue and happiness are mother and daughter.
proverbList.explanation: Ezgulik va baxt ona va qizdir; ya’ni ezgulik qilsangiz buning natijasida baxtga erishasiz.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yaxshi uydan yaxshi butun chiqar.
Yaxshilik nur keltirar, Yomonlik – zulmat.
Yaxshilik eksa, esonlik o‘rar.
Yaxshilik to‘yga eltar, Yomonlik – go‘rga.

proverbList.proverb: Virtue is praised by all, but practised by few.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshilikni hamma maqtaydi, lekin kamchilik yaxshilik qiladi; ya’ni yaxshilik qilish hammani ham qo‘lidan kelavermaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Yaxshilik har kimning qo‘lidan kelavermaydi.

proverbList.proverb: All bread is not baked in one oven.
proverbList.explanation: Hamma non bitta pechda pishirilmaydi, ya’ni odamlar har xil bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Besh qo‘l barobar emas.
Besh barmoq barobar emas.
Bir ikki bo‘lmas, bit sirka bo‘lmas.
Kishi bilan kishi teng emas.

proverbList.proverb: All good things must come to an end.
proverbList.explanation: Hamma yaxshi narsalarning ham oxiri bo‘lishi kerak, hech nima abadiy emas.
proverbList.equivalent: Har narsaning nihoyasi bor.

proverbList.proverb: All lay loads on a willing horse.
proverbList.explanation: Hamma og‘ir yuk yaxshi ot ustida, ya’ni oqko‘ngil, samimiy, yaxshi odamlar hamma yukni o‘z bo‘yinlariga oladilar, boshqalarni qiynashni istamaydilar.

proverbList.proverb: He has not lost all who has one cast left.
proverbList.explanation: O‘yinda bitta bo‘lsa ham yurish gali bor bo‘lgan kishi hamma imkoniyatidan ayrilgan emas, uning bitta bo‘lsa ham imkoniyati mavjud.

proverbList.proverb: Human blood is all of a colour.
proverbList.explanation: Hamma insonning qoni bir xil rangda, ya’ni insonlarning kelib chiqishi va tarqalishi bitta odamga borib taqaladi, shuning uchun odamlar bir-birining xatolarini takrorlashlari yoki bir-biriga o‘xshashlari mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Hamma odam – bir odam, Hamma maxluq – bir maxluq.

proverbList.proverb: It takes all sorts to make a world.
proverbList.explanation: Dunyo turli-tumanliklardan iborat, unda yaxshi ham, yomon ham, chiroyli ham, xunuk ham, aqlli ham, aqlsiz ham, baland ham, past ham bor.
proverbList.equivalent:
Besh qo‘l barobar emas.
Besh barmoq barobar emas.
Kishi bilan kishi teng emas.
Olam rang-barangdir.

proverbList.proverb: Believe not all that you see nor half what you hear
proverbList.explanation: Ko‘rganlaringni hammasiga ham, eshitganlaringni yarmiga ham ishonma, ya’ni, boshqacha qilib aytilsa, ko‘rganlaringdan ko‘ra eshitganlaringga kamroq ishon.
proverbList.equivalent: Ikki quloqdan ko‘ra, Bir ko‘zga ko‘proq ishon.

proverbList.proverb: Don’t put all your eggs in one basket.
proverbList.explanation: Sizda bor bo‘lgan hamma tuxumni bir savatga solmang, bir qismini boshqa joyga qo‘ying; ya’ni kishi o‘zida mavjud bo‘lgan boylik, mablag‘ yoki kuchni faqat bir narsaga sarflash kerak emas, agar o‘sha narsa muvaffaqiyatsizlikka uchrasa, kishi hamma narsasidan birdan ayrilib qoladi.

proverbList.proverb: Friendship should not be all on one side.
proverbList.explanation: Do‘stlik faqat bir tarafdan bo‘lmaydi, u ikki taraflama bo‘ladi; ikkala odam ham bir-birini do‘st deb bilsagina orada do‘stlik paydo bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Qars ikki qo‘ldan chiqar.

proverbList.proverb: A jest is half a truth.
proverbList.explanation: Bitta hazil – yarimta haqiqat, ya’ni har qanday hazilning tagida oz bo‘lsa ham haqiqat bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Hazilning tagida haqiqat yotadi.

proverbList.proverb: A fault confessed is half redressed.
proverbList.explanation: Iqror bo‘lingan xatoga tan olinmagan xatodan ko‘ra kamroq jazo beriladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Xatosini tan olish – mardning ishi.

proverbList.proverb: A good beginning is half the battle.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshi boshlangan ishning yarmi qilingan hisoblanadi, ya’ni yaxshi boshlangan ish tez bitadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Avvali yaxshi bo‘lsa, oxiri shoyli bo‘lur.
Bismillohdan boshlangan ishning yakuni yaxshi bo‘lar.

proverbList.proverb: A good lather is half the shave.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshi ko‘pik soqol olishni osonlashtiradi va tezlashtiradi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ish quroling soz bo‘lsa, Mashaqqating oz bo‘lar.

proverbList.proverb:
A man without a wife half a man.
A man without a wife is but half a man.
proverbList.explanation: Xotinsiz erkak yarimta erkakdir, ya’ni oila qurgan erkak oila qurmagan erkakdan ko‘ra baxtliroq bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Xotinli ro‘zg‘or guldir, Xotinsiz ro‘zg‘or cho‘ldir.

proverbList.proverb: A city that parleys is half gotten.
proverbList.explanation: Muzokara va kelishuv qilishni xohlagan shahar deyarli qo‘lga kiritilgan hisoblanadi, chunki uning jang qilishga kuchi yetmagani yoki boshqa sabablar tufayli dushman tomonning shartlariga ko‘nadi.

proverbList.proverb: A danger foreseen is half avoided.
proverbList.explanation: Oldindan ko‘rilgan xavfni (yoki uning bir qismini) oldini olish mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Kasallikni davolashdan ko‘ra uning oldini olish oson.

proverbList.proverb: He that has an ill name is half hanged.
proverbList.explanation: “Yomon” degan nomga ega bo‘lgan kishi deyarli osilib o‘lgan bilan barobardir, ya’ni yomon nom olgan insonning ko‘ziga dunyo qorong‘u bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yomon otliq bo‘lding – o‘lding.
Uyat – o‘limdan qattiq.

proverbList.proverb: Every cloud has a silver lining.
proverbList.explanation: Har bir bulutning kumushrang cheti bo‘ladi, ya’ni har qanday qiyinchilikdan so‘ng yaxshi kunlar keladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir kun ming kun emas.
Bir yomonning yuz yaxshisi bor.
Bir yomonning qarshisida yuz yaxshi bor.
Botar kunning otar tonggi bor.
Har kechaning kunduzi, Har kunduzning kechasi bor.
Har oqshomning bir tongi bor.
Oyning o‘n beshi qorong‘u bo‘lsa, O‘n beshi – yorug‘.
O‘ttiz kun ro‘zaning bir kun hayiti bor.

proverbList.proverb: Every dog is a lion at home.
proverbList.explanation: Har bir it o‘zining uyida she’rga aylanadi, ya’ni har qanday qo‘rqoq kishi o‘z uyida mardga aylanadi va aytganini qildiradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
It ham o‘z ko‘chasida o‘zini sher bilar.
O‘z joyida laycha ham sher.

proverbList.proverb: Every man has a fool in his sleeve.
proverbList.explanation: Har bir odamning yengida aqlsizligi bo‘ladi, ya’ni hamma odam ham aqlsizlik qilib qo‘yishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Beayb – parvardigor.
Har to‘kisda – bir ayb.

proverbList.proverb: Every man is born a sinner.
proverbList.explanation: Har bir odam gunohkordir, ya’ni har qanday odamning xatosi va gunohi bor, hech kim begunoh farishta bo‘la olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Beayb – parvardigor.
Har to‘kisda – bir ayb.
Mendan bu gunoh, Sendan u gunoh.

proverbList.proverb: Every mother thinks her own gosling a swan.
proverbList.explanation: Har bir g‘oz o‘z bolasini oqqush deb biladi, ya’ni hammaning o‘z bolasi o‘ziga shirin va yaxshi tuyuladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Qo‘ng‘iz bolasini oppog‘im der, Kirpi bolasini yumshog‘im der.
Tipratikan bolasini yumshog‘im der ekan.
Har kimniki o‘ziga Oy ko‘rinar ko‘ziga.

proverbList.proverb: Every family has a skeleton in the cupboard.
proverbList.explanation: Har bir oilaning javonida skeleti bo‘ladi, ya’ni har qanday oilaning bir kemtik joyi – kamchiligi bo‘ladi, hech qanday oila mukammal emas.
proverbList.equivalent:
Beayb – parvardigor.
Har to‘kisda – bir ayb.

proverbList.proverb: Every law has a loophole.
proverbList.explanation: Har bir qonunda kichik bo‘lsa-da nojo‘ya harakatga yo‘l ochib beradigan imkon bo‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: Every may be has a may not be.
proverbList.explanation: Har mumkinda bir mumkinmas bo‘ladi, ya’ni har qanday qoidada istisno holati ham bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Har qoidada bir istisno bor.

proverbList.proverb: Everyone is a kin to the rich man.
proverbList.explanation: Boy odamga hamma qarindosh, ya’ni boyliging ko‘p bo‘lsa yaqinlaring ko‘payadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Boyligim borida ana do‘st, Boyligim yo‘g‘ida qani do‘st.
Boyning bojasi ko‘p, Qulning – xo‘jasi.

proverbList.proverb: Every why has a wherefore.
proverbList.explanation: Har “nima uchun” degan savolning “shuning uchunki” degan javobi bor, ya’ni har qanday savolning javobi, har qanday ishning sababi mavjud.
proverbList.equivalent:
Besabab oyoqqa tikan kirmas.
Sabab bilan savat aravaga chiqar.
Sababsiz oyoqqa tikan kirmas.

proverbList.proverb: He that fears every bush must never go a birding.
proverbList.explanation: Har bir butadan qo‘rqadigan odam qush oviga chiqmasligi kerak, chunki u baribir qush tuta olmaydi. Ya’ni biror narsadan qo‘rqadigan kishi o‘sha narsaga bog‘liq ishlarni bajara olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Chumchuqdan qo‘rqqan tariq ekmas.

proverbList.proverb: It is not every question that deserves an answer.
proverbList.explanation: Har bir savol javob berish loyiq bo‘lavermaydi, ba’zi savollarga javob bo‘lsa ham, uni bermagan ma’qul.

proverbList.proverb: A black hen lays a white egg.
proverbList.explanation: Qora tovuq oq tuxum qo‘yadi, ya’ni ba’zida farzand o‘z ota-onasiga o‘xshamaydi, fozil ota-onaning noqobil farzandi yoki noqobil ota-onaning aqlli farzandi bo‘lishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoq otadan – aqlli farzand.
Ahmoqdan – chaqmoq, Donodan – ahmoq.
G‘ayratlining bolasi tanbal bo‘lar.

proverbList.proverb: As a hen with one chick.
proverbList.explanation: Bir jo‘jali tovuqdek, ya’ni bitta jo‘jasi bor tovuq uni juda asrab-avayladi, hech qayerga ishonmaydi; insonlar ham shunday.
proverbList.equivalent: Onaning ko‘ngli bolada, Bolaning ko‘ngli dalada.

proverbList.proverb: The fine pullet shows its excellence from the egg.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshi polapon o‘zining yaxshiligini tuxumlik davridan boshlab ko‘rsatadi, bola ham juda kichikligidan o‘zini qandayligini bildiradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ayg‘ir qanday bo‘lsa, ot shunday.
Bo‘ladigan bola boshidan ma'lum.
Bo‘lar bola o‘n beshida Boshman, deydi.
Bo‘lmag‘uri o‘ttizida Yoshman, deydi.
Odam bo‘lar yigit odatidan ma'lum, Tulpor bo‘lar qulun – muchasidan.
Ot bo‘lari qulunligidan belgili, Er bo‘lari lo‘laligidan belgili.
To‘qqizida qanday – to‘qsonida shunday.

proverbList.proverb: The hen that lays the eggs knows the pain.
proverbList.explanation: Tuxum qo‘ygan tovuqqina uning og‘rig‘ini biladi, ya’ni qiyinchilikni boshidan o‘tkazgan odamgina shu qiyinchilik aslida qandayligini yaxshi biladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Dard tortmagan dard bilmas.
Kasal dardini sog‘ bilmas, Och qadrini to‘q bilmas.
Tanasi boshqa dard bilmas, Uyi boshqa g‘am bilmas.
Tanasi boshqa dard bilmas.

proverbList.proverb: Kill not the goose that lays the golden egg.
proverbList.explanation: Oltin tuxum qo‘yadigan g‘ozingni o‘ldirma, ya’ni senga foyda keltiradigan narsaga ziyon yetkazma.
proverbList.equivalent:
Qaytib kelar eshigingni  qattiq yopma.
Tuzini yeb, tuzlig‘iga tupurma.
Tovuqni yesang, bir yeysan, Tuxumini yesang, ming yeysan.

proverbList.proverb: Better a century of tyranny than one day of chaos.
proverbList.explanation: Tartibsizliklarga to‘la bir kundan zolimlik bilan boshqarib tartibga solingan bir asr yaxshiroq, ya’ni tartibsizlik eng yomon narsadir.

proverbList.proverb: When poverty comes in at the door, love flies out of the window.
proverbList.explanation: Kambag‘allik eshikdan kirib kelsa, sevgi uchib chiqib ketadi; ya’ni kambag‘allik sevgini kuchsizlantiradi.
proverbList.equivalent: Muhabbat qorin to‘ydirmas.

proverbList.proverb: The charitable give out at the door, and God puts in at the window.
proverbList.explanation: Kimki eshigidan xayr-ehson qilsa, Xudo uning derazasidan nasibasini kiritadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Sen birovga birni bersang, Xudo senga mingni beradi.

proverbList.proverb: The sea refuses no river.
proverbList.explanation: Dengiz hech qanday daryoni rad etmay, qabul qilaveradi; ya’ni o‘lim hammani qa’bul qiladi, hech kimni rad etmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ana go‘r, mana go‘r, Ishonmasang, borib ko‘r.
Bir boshga bir o‘lim.
Bir kun – tug‘ilmoq, Bir kun – o‘lmoq.
Bugun bo‘lsa ham shu o‘lim, Erta bo‘lsa ham shu o‘lim.
O‘lim shoh-u gadoga barobar.
O‘zakli jonda o‘lim bor.
O‘lim – haq, meros – halol.
O‘limdan qochib bo‘lmas.

proverbList.proverb: Don’t make a mountain out of a molehill.
proverbList.explanation: Tuproq uyumidan tog‘ yasama, ya’ni kichik narsani bo‘rttirib katta ko‘rsatma.
proverbList.equivalent:
Chumolidan fil yasama.
Pashshadan fil yasama.

proverbList.proverb: Where bees are, there is honey.
proverbList.explanation: Ari qayerda bo‘lsa, o‘sha yerda asal bo‘ladi. Yoki, biror joyda gavjum odamlar yig‘ilsa, demak o‘sha yerda biror-bir foydali yoki kerakli narsa bor.
proverbList.equivalent: Ari bor joyda asal bor.

proverbList.proverb: You scratch my back, I'll scratch yours.
proverbList.explanation: Mening orqamni qashlab qo‘y, keyin men senikini qashliman, ya’ni menga yordam bersang, men ham senga yordam beraman.
proverbList.equivalent:
Sizdan ugina, bizdan bugina.
Bugun – sizdan, Ertaga – bizdan.
Bugun sizdan, Ertaga bizdan.

proverbList.proverb: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlsizlar shunday joylarga borishga shoshilishadiki, hatto u yerlarga farishtalar ham qadam bosishga qo‘rqishadi, chunki aqlsizlar hech qaysi ishni aql bilan o‘ylab qilmaydilar.

proverbList.proverb: He who waits for another man’s platter has a cold meal.
proverbList.explanation: Boshqa odamning laganini kutgan odam sovuq ovqat yeydi, ya’ni boshqa odamning ovqat yeb bo‘lishini kutgan odamga sovuq ovqat nasib qiladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Hammaning o‘z nasibasi bor.

proverbList.proverb: Don’t measure another man’s foot by one’s own last.
proverbList.explanation: Boshqa odamning oyog‘ini o‘zingning qoliping bilan o‘lchama.
proverbList.equivalent: Dunyoni o‘z qariching bilan o‘lchama.

proverbList.proverb: At the end of the game, the king and pawn go into the same bag.
proverbList.explanation: O‘yin (shaxmat) oxirida, shoh ham, piyoda ham bir qutiga tushadi, ya’ni insonlar ham bu dunyoni tark etganida, hamma bir xil qabrga kiradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Shoh-u gado bir qabrda yotar.
O‘lim shoh-u gadoga barobar.

proverbList.proverb: Golden ladies and girls all must, as chimney-sweepers, come to dust.
proverbList.explanation: Oddiy mo‘ri tozolovchi ayollar kabi yuqori tabaqali xonimlar va qizlar ham bir kun tuproqqa kirishadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Shoh-u gado bir qabrda yotar.
O‘lim shoh-u gadoga barobar.

proverbList.proverb: A penny saved is a penny gained.
proverbList.explanation: Tiyinni asrasang, yana tiyin keladi, ya’ni pulni asrab ishlatsa, insonning qiyin kunlarida ham yonida puli bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Kumush kunga qo‘nsa, Oltin o‘z oyog‘i bilan kelar.
Pul pulni chaqiradi.
Pulni pul topar, Yo‘lni yo‘l topar.

proverbList.proverb: We must not look for a golden life in an iron age.
proverbList.explanation: Biz temir asrida oltin hayotni izlashimiz kerak emas, ya’ni hokimiyatning boshqaruvi va siyosati yomon bo‘lsa ham, unga mos kelmaydigan hayotni izlamasligimiz kerak.
proverbList.equivalent: Oqimga qarshi suzgan cho‘kib o‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: A friend to all is friend to everyone.
proverbList.explanation: Hammaga birdek do‘st bo‘lishni istagan odam har bir odamga do‘stona munosabatda bo‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: Every beggar is descended from some king, and every king is descended from some beggar.
proverbList.explanation: Har qanday gado birorta shohning avlodidan, har qanday shoh biror-bir gadoning avlodidan bo‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: In a calm sea, every man is a pilot.
proverbList.explanation: Sokin dengizda har qanday odam dengizchi, ya’ni qiyinchiligi yo‘q bo‘lgan ishni bajaruvchisi ko‘p bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Urush tugaganidan so‘ng botir ko‘payar.

proverbList.proverb: Some people will never learn anything because they understand everything too soon.
proverbList.explanation: Ba’zi odamla hamma narsani chuqur o‘ylab ko‘rmasdan tez tushunishadi va shuning uchun ular hech narsani o‘rganishmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Dono o‘ylar, Nodon o‘ynar.

proverbList.proverb: One for all, all for one.
proverbList.explanation: Bir kishi hamma uchun, hamma bir kishi uchun. Ya’ni insonlar bir-biriga yordam berishi kerak.
proverbList.equivalent: Bir kishi ming kishi uchun, Ming kishi bir kishi uchun.*

proverbList.proverb: One can’t help many, but many can help one.
proverbList.explanation: Bir odam ko‘p odamlarga yordam bera olmaydi, lekin ko‘p odamlar bir kishiga yordam bera oladi.

proverbList.proverb: Many drops make a shower.
proverbList.explanation: Ko‘p miqdordagi tomchilar jalani hosil qiladi, ya’ni mayda narsalar birgalashib katta narsaga aylanishi yoki ulkan narsalarni hosil qilishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Birin-birin ming bo‘lar, Toma-toma ko‘l bo‘lar.
Oz-ozdan o‘rganib, dono bo‘lur, Qatra-qatra yig‘ilib, daryo bo‘lur.

proverbList.proverb: If you would be happy for a week take a wife; if you would be happy for a month kill a pig; but if you would be happy all your life plant a garden.
proverbList.explanation: Bir hafta xursand bo‘lishni istasang xotin ol; bir oy xursand bo‘lishni istasang, cho‘chqa so‘y; bir umr xursand bo‘lishni istasang, bog‘ yarat.
proverbList.equivalent: Umringdan uch kun qolsa ot ol, Bir kun qolsa – xotin.

proverbList.proverb: My son is my son till he gets him a wife, but my daughter’s my daughter all the days of her life.
proverbList.explanation: O‘g‘lim uylangunicha mening o‘g‘limdir, lekin qizim umrining barcha kunlarida mening qizimdir, ya’ni o‘g‘il farzand uylanganidan keyin xotini va oilasi bilan bo‘lib ota-onasiga kam e’tibor qaratadi, qiz farzand esa ota-onasiga butun umr mehribonchilik qiladi.

proverbList.proverb: Better no doctor at all than three.
proverbList.explanation: Bir bemorni uchta shifokor davolaganidan ko‘ra umuman shifokorsiz davolangan yaxshiroq, chunki uchta shifokor uch xil davolaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Karvonboshi ko‘p bo‘lsa, karvon buzilar.

proverbList.proverb: A dwarf on a giant's shoulders sees the farther of the two.
proverbList.explanation: Bo‘yi darozning yelkasida o‘tirgan pakana ikki barobar uzoqni ko‘radi.

proverbList.proverb: Being an ass between two bundles of hay.
proverbList.explanation: Ikki hashak bog‘lam orasidagi eshak bo‘lish, ya’ni ikki yo‘lni orasida qolgan kishi qaysi birini tanlashga aqli yetmay qoladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ikki o‘t orasida qoldi.

proverbList.proverb: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
proverbList.explanation: Qo‘lingdagi bitta qush butadagi ikkita qushga teng, ya’ni uzoqdagi narsaning senga foydasi tegishi dargumon, shu sababli qo‘lingda borini ehtiyot qil.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yiroqdagi quyruqdan, Yaqindagi o‘pka yaxshi.
Yo‘ldagi ikki qushdan, Qo‘ldagi bir qush yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: A gift in hand is better than two promises.
proverbList.explanation: Ikkita quruq va’dadan ko‘ra qo‘lingdagi bitta sovg‘a yaxshiroq.
proverbList.equivalent:
Va'da – quruq, bajarilsa – ulug‘.
Yuzta siz-bizdan, Bitta jiz-biz yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: A good horse cannot wear two saddles.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshi ot ikkita egar kiya olmaydi, ya’ni yaxshi ot egasi sodiq bo‘ladi, begona egarni kiymaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: O‘ntaning yor-yori bo‘lguncha, Bittaning vafodori bo‘l.

proverbList.proverb: A penny soul never came to two pence.
proverbList.explanation: Bir tiyinlik qalb hech qachon ikki tiyinlik bo‘lib qolmaydi, qalbi bo‘sh inson hech qachon bebaho qalb egasi bo‘lib qolmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bukrini go‘r tuzatadi.
Ilon po‘stini tashlasa ham – ilon.
It itligini etar, To‘n etagini yirtar.
Kuchuk birla xo‘tikni qancha qilma tarbiya, It bo‘lur, eshak bo‘lur, bo‘lmas aslo odamiy.
Echki yugurib kiyik bo‘lmas.

proverbList.proverb: A word before is worth two behind.
proverbList.explanation: Orqadagi ikkita so‘zdan oldindagi bitta so‘z afzal, ya’ni insonni o‘zi yo‘qligida orqasidan gapirgandan ko‘ra uning noldida gapirish yaxshi.
proverbList.equivalent:
G‘iybatkashning qozoni qaynamas.
G‘iybat yaqinni yot qilar, Totuvni – araz.

proverbList.proverb: A wise man hears one word and understands two.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlli odam bir so‘zni eshitib uning ikkita ma’nosini tushunar, ya’ni aqlli so‘zning tagida yotgan yashirin ma’nosini ham tushunar.
proverbList.equivalent: Aqlliga bir so‘z bas, Aqlsizga ming so‘z oz.

proverbList.proverb: Better one house spoiled than two.
proverbList.explanation: Ikkita uy buzilganidan ko‘ra bitta uy buzilgani yaxshiroqdir, vayronagarchilikning ko‘pidan kami yaxshidir.

proverbList.proverb: Don't judge any(18) man until you have walked two moons in his moccasins.
proverbList.explanation: Biror kishiga uning oyoq kiyimida ikki oy yurib ko‘rmaguncha baho berma, ya’ni o‘zgalarga baho berishda shoshilish kerak emas, avval uning shartsharoitini yaxshi bilish lozim.
proverbList.equivalent: O‘zgalarga baho berishga shoshilma.
proverbList.footnote: 18 “Any” is used as the synonym of “one” in this proverb. / “Any” bu maqolda “bir” so‘ziga ma’nodosh sifatida qo‘llanilgan.

proverbList.proverb: One volunteer is worth two pressed men.
proverbList.explanation: Ikkita majburan kelgan odamdan bitta o‘zi istab kelgan odam yaxshiroqdir, chunki o‘zi istab kelgan odam unga berilgan vazifani ikkita majburan kelgan odamdan ko‘ra tez va yaxshi bajaradi.

proverbList.proverb: One pair of heels is often worth two pairs of hands.
proverbList.explanation: Bir juft tovon ba’zan ikki juft qo‘lga teng kelar, ya’ni ba’zida qolib tortishgandan yoki jang qilgandan ko‘ra qochib qolgan yaxshiroq.

proverbList.proverb: One man cannot serve two masters.
proverbList.explanation: Bir kishi bir vaqtda ikkita xo‘jayinga xizmat qila olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: O‘ntaning yor-yori bo‘lguncha, Bittaning vafodori bo‘l.

proverbList.proverb: One foot is better than two crutches.
proverbList.explanation: Ikkita qo‘ltiqtayoqdan bitta bo‘lsa ham o‘z oyog‘ingiz bo‘lgani yaxshi, ya’ni boriga shukur qilish kerak.
proverbList.equivalent: Boriga shukur qil, Yo‘g‘iga – sabr.

proverbList.proverb: Eat a clove of garlic and you smell of garlic; eat two cloves and you smell the same.
proverbList.explanation: Bir bo‘lak sarimsoq yesangiz ham, ikki bo‘lak sarimsoq yesangiz ham sizdan sarimsoqning hidi keladi, ya’ni biror xato ish qilsangiza, u xato kichik bo‘lsa ham, katta bo‘lsa ham, baribir xato hisoblanadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Bo‘rining og‘zi yesa ham qon, Yemasa ham – qon.

proverbList.proverb: Scatter with one hand, gather with two.
proverbList.explanation: Bir qo‘l bilan sochsang, ikki qo‘l bilan yig‘asan; ya’ni har narsani buzish oson, lekin uni tuzatish, o‘z holiga keltirish qiyin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Buzish – oson, tuzish – qiyin.
Buzishga o‘rganma, tuzishga o‘rgan.

proverbList.proverb: One Englishman can beat three Frenchmen.
proverbList.explanation: Bir ingliz uchta fransuzni mag‘lub qiladi. Bu maqol inglizlarning qanchalik mag‘rur xalq ekanligini o‘zida aks ettiradi va, albatta, o‘z mazmunida mubolag‘ani saqlaydi.

proverbList.proverb: A coach and four may be driven through any Act of Parliament.
proverbList.explanation: Parlament tomonidan chiqarilgan har qanday qonun bilan bir arava va uning to‘rtta oti yo‘lga chiqishi mumkin, ya’ni izlagan odam har ishga imkon yoki sabab topiladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Izlagan imkon topar.

proverbList.proverb: A horse stumbles that has four legs.
proverbList.explanation: To‘rtta oyog‘i bor ot ham qoqiladi, ya’ni eng yaxshi deb hisoblangan inson ham adashishi yoki xato qilishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Yaxshi ot ham qoqilar.

proverbList.proverb: One for sorrow, two for mirth; three for a wedding, four for a birth.
proverbList.explanation: Yolg‘izlik odamni g‘amga cho‘mdiradi, juft bo‘lishsa baxt topishadi, uchta odam ishtirokida to‘y ham o‘tadi, to‘rtta odam bilan yana bir inson dunyoga keladi; ya’ni inson yolg‘iz yashay olmaydi, uning baxti boshqalar bilan birgaligidadir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yolg‘iz otning changi chiqmas, Changi chiqsa ham dong‘i chiqmas.
Yolg‘iz uyda qozon qaynamas.
Yolg‘izlik faqat Allohga xos.

proverbList.proverb: One white foot – buy him; Two white feet – try him; Three white feet – look well about him; Four white feet, go without him.
proverbList.explanation: Otning bitta oyog‘i oq bo‘lsa, uni sotib ol; ikki oyog‘i oq bo‘lsa, sinab ko‘r; uchta oyog‘i oq bo‘lsa, uni sinchiklab tekshir; agar to‘rtta oyog‘i ham oq bo‘lsa, uni umuman sotib olma. Tarixda inglizlar otlarning qaysi oyog‘i oq bo‘lsa, o‘sha oyog‘i qorasidan ko‘ra nozik, sinuvchan bo‘ladi deb ishonishgan.

proverbList.proverb: One year’s seeding makes seven years’ weeding.
proverbList.explanation: Agar yovvoyi o‘tlarni bir yil urug‘ sochib ko‘payishiga yo‘l qo‘yib berilsa, ulardan yetti yilda ham qutulib bo‘lmaydi; ya’ni bir marta yomonlikni oldini olmaslik yana boshqa yomonliklarni dunyoga kelishiga sabab bo‘lishi mumkin.

proverbList.proverb: Saving one man’s life is better than building seven-storeyed temple.
proverbList.explanation: Bir odamni hayotini saqlab qolish yetti qavat ibodatxona qurgandan afzaldir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir ko‘ngil imorati – Ming Makka ziyorati.
Ming Makka ziyorati,
Bir ko‘ngil imorati yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: You should know a man seven years before you stir his fire.
proverbList.explanation: Biror odamni olovini yoqish uchun uni yetti yildan buyon tanishingiz lozim, ya’ni biror insonga shaxsiy savollar berish yoki uning ichki kechinmalarini so‘rash uchun uni avvaldan tanigan bo‘lish kerak.

proverbList.proverb: A stitch in time saves nine.
proverbList.explanation: O‘z vaqtida tikilgan bitta chok yonidagi to‘qqizta chokni qutqarib qoladi, ushlab qoladi; ya’ni o‘z vaqtida qilingan ehtiyotkorlik ko‘plab muammolarni oldini oladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ehtiyoting bo‘lsa, ehtiyojing bo‘lmas.

proverbList.proverb: A cat has nine lives.
proverbList.explanation: Mushukning to‘qqizta joni bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Mushukni joni qirqta.

proverbList.proverb: A wonder lasts but nine days.
proverbList.explanation: Hayrat to‘qqiz kun davom etadi, ya’ni hayrat uzoq davom etmaydi, insonlar bir marta hayratlangan narsasidan keyin hayratlanmay qo‘yishadi.

proverbList.proverb: A single arrow is easily broken, but not ten in bundle.
proverbList.explanation: Bitta o‘q (kamon o‘qi nazarda tutilmoqda) osongina sinadi, lekin bir bog‘ qilingan o‘nta o‘q osonlikcha sinmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Birlashgan kuch yengilmas.
Birlashgan – o‘zar, Birlashmagan – to‘zar.
Birlashgan daryo bo‘lar, Tarqalgan irmoq bo‘lar.
Birdan ikki yaxshi, Ikkidan uch yaxshi.
Kuch – birlikda.
Ko‘p ko‘padi, Oz cho‘kadi.
Ko‘pni demay kul bo‘ldim, G‘amg‘ussaga mo‘l bo‘ldim.
Ikki sulton bir sultonning sirtin yirtar.

proverbList.proverb: Give a lie twenty-four hours’ start, and you can never overtake it.
proverbList.explanation: Yolg‘onning yoyilishiga yigirma to‘rt soat yo‘l qo‘ysang, uni hech qachon qaytarib ola olmaysan, ya’ni yolg‘on juda tez tarqaladi.
proverbList.equivalent: El og‘ziga elak tutib bo‘lmas

proverbList.proverb: A fool at forty is a fool indeed.
proverbList.explanation: Ahmoq qirq yoshida ham ahmoqligicha qolaveradi, unga aql kirmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoqning katta-kichigi bo‘lmas.
To‘qqizida bo‘lmagan aql, To‘qsonida ham bo‘lmas.

proverbList.proverb: One reason is as good as fifty.
proverbList.explanation: Bitta sabab ham ellikta sababdek yaxshidir, ya’ni bitta bo‘lsa ham har narsaning sababi bo‘ladi va sababning nechtaligidan qat’iy nazar u asosli hisoblanadi.

proverbList.proverb: An angry man should count a hundred.
proverbList.explanation: Jahli chiqqan odam yuzgacha sanashi kerak, shunda u jahldan tushadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Jahling chiqsa burningni tishla.

proverbList.proverb: One father is more than a hundred schoolmasters.
proverbList.explanation: Bitta ota yuzta muallimdan ko‘proq narsani o‘rgatadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ota so‘zi – aql ko‘zi.
Otalar so‘zi – aqlning ko‘zi.

proverbList.proverb: What is told in the ear of a man is often heard a hundred miles away.
proverbList.explanation: Bitta odamning qulog‘iga aytilgan so‘z ko‘pincha yuz mil naridan eshitiladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
El og‘ziga elak tutib bo‘lmas.
Ikki kishi bilgan sir – sir emas.
Do‘sti ko‘p bilan siylash, Do‘sti oz bilan sirlash.
O‘n og‘iz so‘z ming og‘iz bo‘lar.

proverbList.proverb: A jug that has been mended lasts two hundred years
proverbList.explanation: Yamab qo‘yilgan ko‘za yana ikki yuz yil turadi, xizmat qiladi; ya’ni eski bo‘lsayam biror narsani tuzatib qo‘ysak, undan yana ancha foydalana olamiz.
proverbList.equivalent: Yamasang, yangi bo‘lar, Yangining tengi bo‘lar.

proverbList.proverb: One picture is worth ten thousand words.
proverbList.explanation: Bitta rasm o‘n mingta so‘zga teng, ya’ni ko‘p marotaba eshitgandan ko‘ra bir marta ko‘rgan yaxshi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir ko‘rgan yuz eshitgandan yaxshi.
Yuz bor eshitgandan, Bir bor ko‘rgan yaxshi.
Ming marta eshitgandan, Bir marta ko‘rgan yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: Two is company, but three is none.
proverbList.explanation: Ikki odam birlashsa, yaxshi juftlik bo‘ladi, lekin uchinchisi qo‘shilsa, juftlik buziladi.

proverbList.proverb: As plain as two and two make four.
proverbList.explanation: Ikkiga ikki to‘rt bo‘lganidek ravshan; ikkiga ikkini qo‘shsa to‘rt bo‘lishini hamma bilganidek, biror bir hodisa hammaga aniq va ravshan ko‘rinib turibdi.
proverbList.equivalent: Oydek ravshan.

proverbList.proverb: He that will thrive, must rise at five; he that has thriven, may lie till seven; but he that will never thrive, may lie till eleven.
proverbList.explanation: Muvaffaqiyatga erishib, ravnaq topishmoqchi bo‘lgan odam soat beshda uyg‘onishi kerak; ravnaq topgan odam soat yettigacha yotsa bo‘ladi; lekin umuman ravnaq topmoqchi bo‘lmagan odam soat o‘n birgacha uxlashi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Erta turgan ish bitirar, Kech turgan ko‘p turtinar.
Erta turgan ish bitirar, Kech qolgan armon qilar.
Erta turgan horimas.
Ertalabki vaqt – naqdgina baxt.
Erta turgan kishini, Xudo qo‘llar ishini.

proverbList.proverb: Fall down seven times, get up eight.
proverbList.explanation: Yetti marta yiqilsang, sakkiz marta o‘rningdan tur, ya’ni muvaffaqiytasizlikka uchradim deb tushkunlikka tushish kerak emas, yana o‘rindan turib harakat qilish kerak.
proverbList.equivalent: Yiqilgan turishni bilishi kerak.

proverbList.proverb:
Rain before seven, fine before eleven.
Rain at seven, fine at eleven.
proverbList.explanation: Soat yettidan oldin yomg‘ir yog‘adi, soat o‘n birgacha havo ochilib ketadi. Bu maqol Angliya havosining juda tez o‘zgarib turishini o‘zida aks ettiradi.

proverbList.proverb: Six feet of earth make all men equal.
proverbList.explanation: Yerning olti fut chuqurligida hamma odam tengdir; ya’ni boy ham, gado ham, shoh ham, dehqon ham bir xil qabrga kiradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Shoh-u gado bir qabrda yotar.
O‘lim shoh-u gadoga barobar.

proverbList.proverb: Once a __, always a __.
proverbList.explanation: Bir marta nimadir qilgan odam, shu ishni doim qiladi. Bu ingliz maqoli ko‘plab variantlarga ega bo‘lgani uchun lug‘atlarda “__” belgi bilan keladi va bu maqol salbiy holatni ham, ijobiy holatni ham ifodalay oladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
O‘rgangan ko‘ngil o‘rtansa qo‘ymas.
Tarki odat – amri mahol.
Bir bo‘lgan ikki bo‘lmay qolmas, Ikki bo‘lgan uch bo‘lmay qolmas, Uch bo‘lgan doim bo‘lmay qolmas.

proverbList.proverb: Once a priest, always a priest.
proverbList.explanation: Bir marta ruhoniylik qilgan odam, doim ruhoniydir, u cherkovdan chiqqanda ham ruhoniy bo‘lib qolaveradi.

proverbList.proverb: Once a knave, always a knave.
proverbList.explanation: Bir marta vijdonsizlik qilgan odam, doim vijdonsizlik qilaveradi, undan boshqa narsani kutish foydasiz.
proverbList.equivalent:
O‘rgangan ko‘ngil o‘rtansa qo‘ymas.
Tarki odat – amri mahol.
Bir bo‘lgan ikki bo‘lmay qolmas, Ikki bo‘lgan uch bo‘lmay qolmas, Uch bo‘lgan doim bo‘lmay qolmas.

proverbList.proverb: Once bitten, twice shy.
proverbList.explanation: Bir marta tishlangan, ikki marta uyaladi yoki qo‘rqib o‘zini oladi, ya’ni bir marta qoqilgan odam, keyingi gal ehtiyotini qiladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ilon chaqqan arg‘amchidan qo‘rqar.
Ko‘r hassasini bir marta yo‘qotadi.
Tuzoqdan bir marta qo‘rqqan qush, Qirq yilgacha ayri yog‘ochga qo‘nmas.
Og‘zi kuygan qatiqni ham puflab ichar.

proverbList.proverb: Once a use and ever custom.
proverbList.explanation: Bir marta qilib ko‘rgan ish doimiy odatga aylanadi, ya’ni odam bir ishni qilishga qo‘rqsa-da, uni bir marotaba qilib ko‘rganidan so‘ng, mazkur narsaga ko‘nikib ham qoladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Bir qilgan – madad, Ikki qilgan - odat.

proverbList.proverb: He that once deceives is ever suspected.
proverbList.explanation: Bir marta aldab ketgan odamdan doim shubhalanishadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yolg‘onchiga ishonch yo‘q.
Yolg‘onchi to‘rga bir o‘tar, Ikkinchi o‘tmas.*
Yolg‘onchining rost so‘zi ham yolg‘on.

proverbList.proverb: Better be first in a village than second at Rome.
proverbList.explanation: Rimda ikkinchi bo‘lgandan ko‘ra, qishlog‘da birinchi bo‘lganing yaxshi, ya’ni katta joylarda ikkinchi darajali odam bo‘lgandan ko‘ra, kichik joylarda birinchi darajali odam bo‘l.

proverbList.proverb: The first time, a novice; the second time, an adept.
proverbList.explanation: Birinchi martada yangi havaskor; ikkinchi martada mohir usta. Ya’ni bir ishni ilk bora qilganizda havaskor bo‘lib, uni yaxshi bajara olmasangiz, ikkinchi martada bu ishni mohirona qilasiz.
proverbList.equivalent: Oz-oz o‘rganib usta bo‘lur.

proverbList.proverb: The first day a guest, the second day a guest, the third day a calamity.
proverbList.explanation: Kelgan mehmon birinchi kun – mehmon, ikkinchi kun – mehmon, uchinchi kun – musibat.
proverbList.equivalent:
Birinchi kun mehmon – oltin mehmon, Ikkinchi kun – kumush, Uchinchi kun – mis, Uchdan o‘tsa – pes.
Mehmonning izzati uch kunda bitadi.
Qo‘noq bir kun qo‘nsa – kut, Ikki kun qo‘nsa – yut.

proverbList.proverb: First try, then trust.
proverbList.explanation: Avval sinab ko‘r, keyin ishon.
proverbList.equivalent:
Sinamagan do‘stingga sir aytma.
Sinalmagan do‘stga sir aytma.
Sinalmagan otning sirtidan o‘tma.

proverbList.proverb: First think, then speak.
proverbList.explanation: Birinchi o‘ylab olib, keyin gapirish kerak.
proverbList.equivalent:
Avval o‘yla, keyin so‘yla.
Ikkov oldida bilib ayt, Uchov oldida o‘ylab ayt.
Kecha yotib o‘yla, Erta turib so‘yla.

proverbList.proverb: First deserve and then desire.
proverbList.explanation: Qo‘lga kiritishni xohlagan narsaga inson avval loyiq bo‘lishi kerak.

proverbList.proverb: First catch your hare, then cook him.
proverbList.explanation: Avval quyonni ushlash kerak, keyin uni pishirasan. Ya’ni, hali qo‘lga kiritilmagan narsani biror narsa qilib bo‘lmaydi, avvalo uni qo‘lga kiritish lozim.
proverbList.equivalent: Tug‘ilmagan buzoqqa qoziq qoqma.

proverbList.proverb:
Between two stools one falls to the ground.
Between two stools one goes to the ground.
proverbList.explanation: Ikkita stolni orasida o‘tirgan odam yerga yiqiladi, ya’ni ikki narsani bir paytda qilaman degan odam, muvaffaqiyatsizlikka uchraydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki quyonni quvlagan birini ham tutolmas.
Ikki kemaning boshini tutgan g‘arq bo‘lar.
Bir kesak bilan ikki chumchuqni urib bo‘lmas.
Bir kesak bilan ikki qarg‘ani urib bo‘lmas.
Bir qo‘ltiqqa ikki tarvuz sig‘mas.

proverbList.proverb: Good riding at two anchors, men have told, for if one breaks the other may hold.
proverbList.explanation: Aytishlaricha, ikki qoziqqa suyanib ish qilish yaxshi, chunki biri sinsa, ikkinchisi ushlab qoladi; ya’ni bitta narsaga ishonib qolish yaramaydi, zaxira bo‘lishi kerak.

proverbList.proverb: If two ride on a horse, one must ride behind.
proverbList.explanation: Agar ikkita odam bir otni minsa, bittasi orqada o‘tirishi kerak, ya’ni har qanday ishda boshqaruvchi bitta bo‘lishi kerak.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki qo‘chqor kallasi bir qozonda qaynamas.
Bir qozonda ikki qo‘chqorning kallasi qaynamaydi.

proverbList.proverb: If two men ride on a horse, one must ride behind.
proverbList.explanation: Agar ikkita odam bir otni minsa, bittasi orqada o‘tirishi kerak, ya’ni har qanday ishda boshqaruvchi bitta bo‘lishi kerak.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki qo‘chqor kallasi bir qozonda qaynamas.
Bir qozonda ikki qo‘chqorning kallasi qaynamaydi.

proverbList.proverb: It takes two to make a bargain.
proverbList.explanation: Kelishuv yoki savdo ikki kishi o‘rtasida qilinadi, bitta odam o‘zi qila olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Qars ikki qo‘ldan chiqadi.

proverbList.proverb: It takes two to make a quarrel.
proverbList.explanation: Bahs yoki janjal ikki kishi o‘rtasida vujudga keladi, bir kishi uni o‘zi qila olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Qars ikki qo‘ldan chiqadi.

proverbList.proverb: Kill two birds with one stone.
proverbList.explanation: Bitta tosh bilan ikki quyonni o‘ldir. Bu maqol bir harakat bilan ikkita yumushni yoki maqsadni amalga oshirishni anglatadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Bir o‘q bilan ikki quyonni urdi.

proverbList.proverb: Two wrongs don’t make a right.
proverbList.explanation: Ikkita xato qo‘shilib bitta to‘g‘ri bo‘la olmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: Two of a trade never agree.
proverbList.explanation: Bir sohadagi kishilar doim o‘zini shu sohadagi boshqa kishilardan yaxshi deb biladi, shuning uchun boshqalar bilan fikri bir joydan chiqishi juda qiyin bo‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: Two halves become one.
proverbList.explanation: Ikki yarim bir (butun) bo‘ladi. Ikkita yarim narsani qo‘shsa, bitta butun narsa hosil bo‘ladi, yoki ikki ko‘ngli yarim insonlar birlashib (bir-birini sevib yoki qadrlab) bir butun bo‘lishadi, bir-biriga dalda beradi yoki baxtli qiladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki yarim – bir butun.
Ikki yorti – bir butun.

proverbList.proverb: Two heads are better than one.
proverbList.explanation: Ikkita bosh bitta boshdan yaxshiroq, chunki ikkita boshdan bitta boshni aqli yetmagan fiklar chiqishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir kalla – kalla, Ikki kalla – tilla.
Bir bosh – bir bosh, Ikki bosh – ikki bosh.
Bir bosh – balo bosh, Ikki bosh – mardona bosh.
Ikki odam – bir odamning tangrisi.

proverbList.proverb: Two blacks don’t make a white.
proverbList.explanation: Ikkita qora birikib, bitta oq bo‘la olmaydi, ya’ni ikkita yomon qo‘shilib bitta yaxshi bo‘la olmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: Two dogs over one bone seldom agree.
proverbList.explanation: Ikki kuchuk kamdan-kam bitta suyakni kelishib yeydi, ya’ni insonlar ham odatda bir narsani ustida kelishishi juda qiyin bo‘ladi, shu sababli ular o‘sha narsani talashishadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ikki yomon qo‘shilsa, keng dunyoga sig‘ishmas.

proverbList.proverb: Two things do prolong thy life: a quiet heart and a loving wife.
proverbList.explanation: Ikki narsa hayotni uzaytiradi: xotirjam yurak va sizni sevadigan xotin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Xotin yaxshi – er yaxshi.
Erni er qiladigan ham – xotin, Qaro yer qiladigan ham – xotin.
Qozonda jiz-biz, Ko‘rpada siz-biz.

proverbList.proverb: While two dogs are fighting for a bone, a third runs away with it.
proverbList.explanation: Ikki it bir suyakni talashib urushsa, uchinchisi shu suyakni olib qochib ketadi, odamlarda ham shunday holat yuz beradi.

proverbList.proverb: When two tigers fight, one is sure to be hurt.
proverbList.explanation: Ikki yo‘lbars jang qilsa, albatta bittasi jarohatlanadi. Ya’ni ikki kuchli jang qilsa, albatta bittasi jarohatlanadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ikki shunqor urishsa, Bir qarg‘aga yem tushar.
Urush qurbonsiz bo‘lmas.

proverbList.proverb: There are two sides to every(19) question.
proverbList.explanation: Har bir savolning ikki tomoni bo‘ladi, ya’ni ikkita ma’nosi: ko‘rinib turgan asl ma’nosi va uning yashirin tag ma’nosi yoki maqsadi bo‘ladi.
proverbList.footnote: 19 Here “every” means “one”. / Bu yerda “every” so‘zi “one” so‘ziga teng ma’noni ifodalaydi.

proverbList.proverb: It takes three generations to make a gentleman.
proverbList.explanation: Oliy tabaqali degan nomga ega bo‘lish uchun uch avlod oliy tabaqali bo‘lishi kerak, ya’ni bir kishining ota-bobosi oliy tabaqadan bo‘lmasa, uni oliy tabaqali deyishmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: Three removals are as bad as a fire.
proverbList.explanation: Uch marta ko‘chgan odam uyiga o‘t tushgan odamdek aziyat chekadi, uning narsalari yoki jihozlar ko‘chgani sari eskirib, ishdan chiqaveradi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir ko‘chgan – ikki talanar.
Bir ko‘chsang – bir talanasan, Ikki ko‘chsang – ikki.
Ikki ko‘chgan – bir talangan.
Kambag‘al bo‘lsang, ko‘chib ko‘r, Boy bo‘lsang – o‘lib.

proverbList.proverb: Three things are not to be trusted: a cow's horn, a dog‘s tooth, and a horse's hoof.
proverbList.explanation: Uchta narsaga ishonib bo‘lmaydi: sigirning shoxiga, itning tishiga, va otning tuyog‘iga; chunki sigirning suzishini, itning tishlashini va otning tepib yuborishini oldindan bilib bo‘lmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: Of three main roads, take the middle one.
proverbList.explanation: Uchta asosiy yo‘ldan bittasini tanlash kerak bo‘lsa, o‘rtadagini tanlash kerak, har narsaning o‘rtadagisi yaxshiroq yoki xavfsizroq bo‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: Nine tailors make a man.
proverbList.explanation: To‘qqiz tikuvchi bir bo‘lib bitta odamni kiyintirsa, uning tashqi ko‘rinishi a’lo darajada bo‘ladi, insonga odatda tashqi ko‘rinishga qarab baho berishadi, va bu tikuvchilarning ishiga bog‘liq.

proverbList.proverb:
The buyer has need of a hundred eyes, the seller of but one.
The buyer needs a hundred eyes, the seller but one.
proverbList.explanation: Xaridorning yuzta ko‘zi bo‘lishi kerak, chunki sotib olayotgan narsasini sinchiklab ko‘rib, boshqalari bilan solishtirib olishi kerak, sotuvchining ko‘zi bitta bo‘lishi kerak, chunki u ishida adashmay pulni to‘g‘ri hisoblab olishi kerak.

proverbList.proverb: A thousand cranes in the air are not worth one sparrow in the fist.
proverbList.explanation: Changaldagi bitta chumchuq osmondagi mingta turnadan yaxshidir, ya’ni qo‘lingda bor oddiy narsa uzoqdagi mingta yaxshi narsadan afzal, chunki qo‘lingdagi narsaning foydasi tegadi, uzoqdaginiki esa tegmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yiroqdagi quyruqdan, Yaqindagi o‘pka yaxshi.
Yo‘ldagi ikki qushdan, Qo‘ldagi bir qush yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb:
Four eyes see more than two.
Four eyes see better than two.
proverbList.explanation: To‘rtta ko‘z ikkita ko‘z ko‘rgan narsadan ko‘prog‘ini ko‘radi. To‘rtta ko‘z ikkita ko‘zdan yaxshiroq ko‘radi
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir kalla – kalla, Ikki kalla – tilla.
Bir bosh – balo bosh, Ikki bosh – mardona bosh.
Bir bosh – bir bosh, Ikki bosh – ikki bosh.
Ikki odam – bir odamning tangrisi.

proverbList.proverb: Hear twice before you speak once.
proverbList.explanation: Bir marta gapirishdan avval ikki marta eshit.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir so‘zlab, tingla qirq ikki.
Og‘iz – bir, quloq – ikki, Bir so‘zlab, tingla qirq ikki.

proverbList.proverb: Measure seven times, cut once.
proverbList.explanation: Yetti marta o‘lchab, keyin bir kes; ya’ni bir ishni qilishdan avval ko‘p marotaba o‘ylab ko‘r.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yetti o‘lchab bir kes.
Sakkiz o‘lchab bir kes.
Sanamay sakkiz dema, O‘ylamay – o‘ttiz.
O‘n qatim o‘yla, Bir qatim so‘yla.

proverbList.proverb:
Measure thrice and cut once.
Measure twice, cut once.
proverbList.explanation: Uch / ikki marta o‘lchab, keyin bir kes, ya’ni bir ishni qilishdan avval ko‘p marotaba o‘ylab ko‘r.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yetti o‘lchab bir kes.
Sakkiz o‘lchab bir kes.
Sanamay sakkiz dema, O‘ylamay – o‘ttiz.
O‘n qatim o‘yla, Bir qatim so‘yla.

proverbList.proverb: Score twice before you cut  once.
proverbList.explanation: Ikki marta o‘lchab, keyin bir kes; ya’ni bir ishni qilishdan avval ko‘p marotaba o‘ylab ko‘r.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yetti o‘lchab bir kes.
Sakkiz o‘lchab bir kes.
Sanamay sakkiz dema, O‘ylamay – o‘ttiz.
O‘n qatim o‘yla, Bir qatim so‘yla.

proverbList.proverb: Think twice, cut once.
proverbList.explanation: Ikki marta o‘ylab, keyin bir kes; ya’ni bir ishni qilishdan avval ko‘p marotaba o‘ylab ko‘r.
proverbList.equivalent:
Yetti o‘lchab bir kes.
Sakkiz o‘lchab bir kes.
Sanamay sakkiz dema, O‘ylamay – o‘ttiz.
O‘n qatim o‘yla, Bir qatim so‘yla.

proverbList.proverb: Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead.
proverbList.explanation: Uchta odam bitta sirni saqlay oladi, agarda ulardan ikkitasi o‘lgan bo‘lsa; ya’ni sirni bittadan ortiq odam bilsa, uni boshqalar ham biladi va uning sirligi qolmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Do‘sti ko‘p bilan siylash, Do‘sti oz bilan sirlash.
Ikki kishi bilgan sir – sir emas.
Uch kishi bilgan sirni Yuz kishi bilar.

proverbList.proverb: Keep a thing seven years and you’ll always find a use for it.
proverbList.explanation: Biror narsani yetti yil saqla, shu narsa biror ishga yarab qoladi; ya’ni asrab qo‘yilgan narsaning biror kun foydasi tegadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir kerak bo‘lgan narsa Ikki ham kerak bo‘lar.
Saqla somonni, kelar zamoni.

proverbList.proverb: Six hours’ sleep for a man, seven for a woman, and eight for a fool.
proverbList.explanation: Erkak olti soat uxlasa yetadi, ayol esa yetti soat uxlashi kerak, va ahmoq sakkiz soat uxlaydi; chunki erkak ishlab oila boqishi, ayol esa uy ro‘zg‘orini qilishi kerak, ahmoq esa hech narsani qilishga shoshmaydi va vaqtini uyqu bilan o‘tkazadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Uyqu o‘lim bilan teng.
Uyqu – g‘aflat, mehnat – rohat.

proverbList.proverb: A sluggard takes a hundred steps because he would not take one in due time.
proverbList.explanation: Erinchoq va dangasa odam o‘z vaqtida bir qadam tashlamagani sababli keyin yuz qadam yurishga majbur bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoq kalla oyoq og‘ritar.
Ahmoq o‘z oyog‘idan horiydi.
Yalqov – o‘ziga yov.

proverbList.proverb: Feast today and fast tomorrow.
proverbList.explanation: Bugun bayram qilib boringni yeb tugatsang, ertaga ro‘za tutasan, och qolasan.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bugun yupun, ertaga butun.
Bugun – yupun, ertaga – butun.
Bugun yedim – yetdim, Erta yedim – o‘tdim.
Hamma hayitga chiqqanda, Xumga kirib yotdim.
Qirib yesang, qirq kunga yetar, O‘yib yesang – o‘n kunga.

proverbList.proverb: Jam tomorrow and jam yesterday, but never jam today
proverbList.explanation: Ertaga murabbo bo‘ladi, kecha bor bo‘lgan, lekin hech qachon bugun bor bo‘lmaydi, ya’ni ba’zi narsalarga boshqa kuni deb va’da beriladi, lekin ular umuman amalga oshirilmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bermasning ertasi ko‘p.
Xudoning ertasi ko‘p

proverbList.proverb: He that falls today may rise tomorrow.
proverbList.explanation: Bugun yiqilgan yoki yutqazgan ertaga o‘rnidan turib, o‘nglanishi va g‘alaba qozonishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Bir gal yutsang, bir gal yutqazasan.

proverbList.proverb: If today will not, tomorrow may.
proverbList.explanation: Biror ish bugun amalga oshmasa, ertaga amalga oshishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Bugun bitmagan ertaga bitar.

proverbList.proverb: What Manchester says today, the rest of England says tomorrow.
proverbList.explanation: Manchester bir narsani bugun aytsa, Angliyaning qolgan qismi shuni ertaga aytadi; ya’ni sanoat ilk bora Angliyaning mazkur shahrida tez rivojlangan paytlarda barcha yangiliklar shu shaharda bo‘lar edi, Angliyaning boshqa qismi sanoatning barcha sohasida Manchesterdan keyinda turar edi.

proverbList.proverb:
Never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
Never put off till tomorrow what can be done today.
proverbList.explanation: Bugun qila oladigan ishingni ertangi kunga yoki keyinga qoldirma, o‘z vaqtida bajar.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bugungi ishni ertaga qo‘yma.
Qolgan ishga qor yog‘ar.

proverbList.proverb: Think today and speak tomorrow.
proverbList.explanation: Bugun o‘yla va ertaga gapir; ya’ni gapirishdan avval o‘ylash lozim.
proverbList.equivalent:
Avval o‘yla, keyin so‘yla.
Ikkov oldida bilib ayt, Uchov oldida o‘ylab ayt.
Kecha yotib o‘yla, Erta turib so‘yla.

proverbList.proverb: Stuff today and starve tomorrow.
proverbList.explanation: Bugun boringni to‘yib yeb tugatsang, ertaga ro‘za tutasan, och qolasan.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bugun yupun, ertaga butun.
Bugun yedim – yetdim, Erta yedim – o‘tdim.
Hamma hayitga chiqqanda, Xumga kirib yotdim.
Qirib yesang, qirq kunga yetar, O‘yib yesang – o‘n kunga.

proverbList.proverb: April showers bring forth May flowers.
proverbList.explanation: Aprel oyida quyib yog‘gan yomg‘irlar may oyida gullarning qiyg‘os ochilishiga sabab bo‘ladi. Bu maqol Angliyaning tabiati va iqlimini o‘zida aks ettiradi.

proverbList.proverb: So many mists in March, so many frosts in May.
proverbList.explanation: Mart oyida qancha ko‘p tuman bo‘lsa, may oyida shuncha qirov tushadi. Bu maqol Angliyaning tabiati va iqlimini o‘zida aks ettiradi.

proverbList.proverb: A swarm in May is worth a load of hay; a swarm in June is worth a silver spoon; but a swarm in July is not worth a fly.
proverbList.explanation: May oyidagi asalari galasi ancha-muncha asal (gul changi, nektar) yig‘adi, iyunda ular bir kumush qoshiqqa loyiq asal yig‘a oladi; lekin iyulda ular aytarli hech narsa yig‘a olmaydi, shuning uchun ular bitta pashshachalik bo‘lmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: East is east, and west is west.
proverbList.explanation: Sharq – bu sharq, g‘arb – bu ga’rb, ikki turga oid narsa yoki tushunchalarni bir-biri bilan adashtirish kerak emas va tamoman bir-biriga zid bo‘lgan narsalar bir-biriga mos kelmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Bu eshak – o‘sha eshak, To‘qimi boshqa eshak.

proverbList.proverb:
East, west, home’s best.
East or west, home is best.
proverbList.explanation: U sharqda bo‘ladimi, yoki g‘arbda bo‘ladimi, dunyoda yurtlar ko‘p, lekin har bir insonga o‘z uyi, tug‘ilib o‘sgan vatani azizdir.
proverbList.equivalent:
O‘z uyim – o‘lan to‘shagim.
Har qush o‘z uyasiga qarab uchar.
Ona yerning tuprog‘i – ona sutidan aziz.
Ona yurting – oltin beshiging.

proverbList.proverb: Cloudy mornings turn to clear afternoons.
proverbList.explanation: Tong bulutli bo‘lsa, tushdan so‘ng havo ochilib ketadi. Bu maqol Angliya havosining juda tez o‘zgarib turishini o‘zida aks ettiradi.

proverbList.proverb: Red sky at night, shepherd’s delight; red sky in the morning, shepherd’s warning.
proverbList.explanation: Tun kirishida osmon qizarsa, cho‘pon xursand bo‘ladi, chunki ertangi kun ochiq bo‘ladi; erta tongda osmon qizil bo‘lsa, bu cho‘ponni xavotirga soladi, chunki bu izg‘irinli shamol bo‘lishi va yomg‘ir yog‘ishidan darakdir.

proverbList.proverb: The morning sun never lasts a day.
proverbList.explanation: Ertalabki quyosh hech qachon kuni bo‘yi charaqlab turmaydi, chunki bir pastda havo aynib, yog‘ingarchilik bo‘lishi mumkin. Bu maqol Angliya havosining juda tez o‘zgarib turishini o‘zida aks ettiradi.

proverbList.proverb: A foul morn may turn to a fair day.
proverbList.explanation: Ertalabki izg‘irinli shamoldan keyin kunduzi havo ochiq va quyoshli bo‘lishi mumkin. Bu maqol Angliya havosining juda tez o‘zgarib turishini o‘zida aks ettiradi.

proverbList.proverb: They must hunger in winter that will not work in summer.
proverbList.explanation: Yozda mehnat qilmaydigan odamlar qishda och qoladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Aqlli odam qish g‘amini yoz yer, Kech bo‘lsa – xo‘ragini oz yer.
Qish g‘amini yozda ye.
Yoz bo‘yi yotar, Qish bo‘yi qotar.
Yozga yetsang, qish kuningni unutma.
Yozda ishlamagan Qishda kesak yer.
Yozda ishlamagan Qishda tishlamas.
Yozda uy-joy qurmasang, Qishda balchiq kecharsan.
Yozda boshi pishmaganning, Qishda oshi pishmas.
Yozda mehnat qilsang, Qishda yeysan kishmish.
Yozda mehnat qilmasang, Qishda yeysan tirkish.

proverbList.proverb: After dinner rest a while, after supper walk a mile.
proverbList.explanation: Tushlikdan so‘ng biroz dam ol, kechki ovqatdan so‘ng bir mil yayov yur.

proverbList.proverb: After dinner sleep a while, after supper walk a mile.
proverbList.explanation: Tushlikdan so‘ng biroz uxlab ol, kechki ovqatdan so‘ng bir mil yayov yur.

proverbList.proverb: After dinner sit a while, after supper walk a mile.
proverbList.explanation: Tushlikdan so‘ng biroz o‘tir, kechki ovqatdan so‘ng bir mil yayov yur.

proverbList.proverb: He that sings on Friday, will weep on Sunday.
proverbList.explanation: Juma kuni qo‘shiq kuylagan, shanba kuni yig‘laydi, ya’ni xursandchilik doim ham davomiy bo‘lavermaydi, uning ortidan dilxiralik ham kelishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ko‘p kulgan bir yig‘laydi.
Ko‘p yugurgan bir qoqilar, Ko‘p kulgan bir yig‘lar.

proverbList.proverb: A penny weight of love is worth a pound of law.
proverbList.explanation: Bir pennilik sevgi bir funtlik qonunga teng, ya’ni kuchsiz sevgi kuchsiz qonun kabidir, ularning ikkalasi ham oson o‘z kuchini yo‘qotadi.

proverbList.proverb: Better give a shilling than lend a half-crown.
proverbList.explanation: Yarim kraun pulni qarzga bergandan ko‘ra, bir shillingni berib yuborgan yaxshi; ya’ni kattaroq pulni qarzga berib, uni qaytarib berilishini kutgandan ko‘ra, kichik miqdordagi pulni berib yuborgan yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: In for a penny, in for a pound.
proverbList.explanation: 1) Bir pennini ishlab topa olgan, o‘sha pennidan to‘g‘ri foydalangan holda bir funtni ham topa oladi; 2) biror narsaga bir pennini sarflagan odam agar kerak bo‘lsa mazkur narsa uchun bir funtini ham sarflaydi, chunki u odam bu ish uchun pulini sarflab qo‘ygan, agar bu narsadan foyda olmasa, sarflagan puli kuyadi, shu sababli u oxirigacha kurashadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Bitta edi moyam, Ikkita bo‘ldi dastmoyam.

proverbList.proverb:
If you watch the pence, the pounds will take care of themselves.
Take care of the pence and the pounds will take care of themselves.
proverbList.explanation: Pennilarni bekorga sarflamay ularni yig‘sang, funtlar o‘zlari kelishadi, ya’ni mayda pullarni avaylab yig‘sang, bora-bora ular katta pullarga aylanadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Birin-birin ming bo‘lar, Toma-toma ko‘l bo‘lar.
Kumush kunga qo‘nsa, Oltin o‘z oyog‘I bilan kelar.
Tanga tiyindan o‘sar, Yilqi qulundan o‘sar.
Toma-toma ko‘l bolur.

proverbList.proverb:
An ounce of practice is worth a pound of precept.
An ounce of practice is worth a pound of theory.
proverbList.explanation: Bir aunts tajriba bir funt ta’limotga / nazariyaga teng keladi, ya’ni ozgina tajriba ham ko‘p miqdordagi ta’limot yoki nazariya bermagan natijani bera oladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir sinalgan tajriba Yetti kitobdan afzal.
Ko‘rgan ko‘p bilar, O‘qigan – oz.

proverbList.proverb: An ounce of discretion is worth a pound of learning.
proverbList.explanation: Bir aunts mulohaza bir funt o‘qib o‘rganishga teng keladi; ya’ni ozgina mulohaza yuritish ham ko‘p miqdordagi o‘qib o‘rganish bermagan natijani bera oladi.
proverbList.equivalent: O‘qish yaxshi, Uqish undan ham yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
proverbList.explanation: Bir aunts oldini olish bir funt davolashga tengdir, ya’ni kasallikni davolashdan ko‘ra uning oldini olish oson.
proverbList.equivalent: Kasallikni davolashdan ko‘ra uning oldini olish oson.

proverbList.proverb: An ounce of mother is worth a ton of priest.
proverbList.explanation: Bir aunts ona bir tonna ruhoniyga tengdir; ya’ni minglab ruhoniy bera olmagan maslahat va mehrni bitta ona bera oladi.

proverbList.proverb: Hang a thief when he’s young, and he’ll no‘ steal when he’s old.
proverbList.explanation: O‘g‘rini yoshligida os, shunda u qariganda o‘g‘irlik qila olmaydi; ya’ni o‘g‘rilik qilgan odam bu ishdan umrining oxirigacha voz kechmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bukrini go‘r tuzatadi.
O‘g‘ri qo‘li kesilmaguncha O‘g‘riligini qo‘ymas.
Yomon kun yaxshi bo‘lar, Yomon odam yaxshi bo‘lmas.

proverbList.proverb: Young men may die, but old men must die.
proverbList.explanation: Yosh odam ham o‘lishi mumkin, lekin keksa odam o‘lishi kerak, ya’ni yoshini yashab qo‘ygan odam vafot etsa, kuyunish kerak emas, lekin yosh o‘lsa, kuyunish kerak.
proverbList.equivalent:
Birinchi kelgan birinchi ketadi.
Erta kelgan erta ketar.
Yoshi ulug‘ning taziyasi – to‘ydek gap.

proverbList.proverb: Marriage halves our griefs, doubles our joys, and quadruples our expenses.
proverbList.explanation: Turmush qurish qayg‘uni yarimlatadi, xursandchilikni ikki barobarga va xarajatni to‘rt barobarga oshiradi.

proverbList.proverb: You cannot get a quart into a pint pot.
proverbList.explanation: Bir pint suyuqlik sig‘adigan qozonga bir kvart suyuqlik sig‘dira olmaysan, ya’ni kichik hajmli qozonga o‘z hajmidan oshiq narsa solib bo‘lmaydi.

proverbList.proverb: A pound of care will not pay an ounce of debt.
proverbList.explanation: Bir funt e’tibor yoki xavotir bir aunts qarzni to‘lay olmaydi, ya’ni qarzni qaytarish o‘rniga turli bahonalar bilan o‘zini xavotirda ko‘rsatish bilan qarz uzilmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Qarz, qarzni berish farz.

proverbList.proverb: Better be an old man’s darling, than a young man’s slave.
proverbList.explanation: Yosh odamning quli bo‘lgandan ko‘ra keksa odamning aziz kishisi bo‘lgan yaxshiroq.

proverbList.proverb: As the old cock crows, so does the young.
