proverbList.explanation: Qari xo‘roz qanday qichqirsa, Yoshi ham shunday qichqiradi; ya’ni oilaning kattalaridan kichiklari doim andoza oladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bola ko‘rganini qilar, Ota – bilganini.
Katta arava qaydan yursa, Kichik arava shundan yurar.
Qush uyasida ko‘rganini qilar.
Qo‘zi qo‘chqordan nishon, O‘g‘il – otadan.
Olmaning tagida olma yotar, Dovchaning tagida dovcha yotar.
Olmaning tagiga olma tushadi.

proverbList.proverb: You cannot put an old head on young shoulders.
proverbList.explanation: Yosh yelkaga keksa boshni o‘rnatib bo‘lmaydi; ya’ni yosh kishining aqli ham o‘z yoshiga mos bo‘ladi, keksa kishining aql-farosati o‘z yoshiga mos bo‘ladi, chunki u katta hayotiy tajribaga ega bo‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: A good drink makes the old young.
proverbList.explanation: Yaxshi ichimlik keksa odamni yoshartiradi; ya’ni yaxshi ichimlik ichgan yoshi katta kishi o‘zini yosh kishidek his etadi.

proverbList.proverb: Young folks think old folks to be fools, but old folks know young folks to be fools.
proverbList.explanation: Yosh qatlam keksa qatlamni aqlsiz deb o‘ylaydi, lekin keksa qatlam yosh qatlamni aqlsizligini biladi, ya’ni yoshlar o‘zini aqlli sanab, keksalarning fikrini ahmoqona deb hisoblashadi, keksa yoshdagilar esa yoshlarning aqlsizlik qilishlarini bilishadi, chunki ular ham shu yoshdan o‘tishgan.
proverbList.equivalent: Men ham edim sendek, Sen ham bo‘lasan mendek.

proverbList.proverb: Young saint, old devil.
proverbList.explanation: Yosh avliyo, qari shayton, ya’ni yoshligida o‘zini juda odobli va xushxulq tutgan odam katta bo‘lganida badfe’l odamga aylanishi mumkin, yoki teskari holat ham bo‘lishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: O‘g‘ri qarisa, so‘fi bo‘lar, G‘ar qarisa, otin bo‘lar.

proverbList.proverb: Feed a dog for three days and he will remember your kindness for three years; feed a cat for three years and she will forget your kindness in three days.
proverbList.explanation: Itni uch kun boqsang, u sening yaxshiligingni uch yil unutmay eslab yuradi, mushukni uch yil boqsang ham, u seni yaxshiligingni uch kun o‘tib esidan chiqaradi; ya’ni it mushukka nisbatan egasiga ko‘proq vafodor bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent: It – vafo, xotin – jafo.

proverbList.proverb: It changes in an hour, that happens not in seven years.
proverbList.explanation: Yetti yilda sodir bo‘lmagan narsa bir soatni ichida sodir bo‘lishi, biror holat butunlay o‘zgarib ketishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent: Ko‘za kunda emas, kunida sinar.

proverbList.proverb: Better to live one day as a tiger than a thousand years as a sheep.
proverbList.explanation: Ming yil qo‘y kabi yashagandan ko‘ra bir kun yo‘lbarsdek yashagan afzal, ya’ni ming yil bosh egib yashagandan ko‘ra bir kun boshni baland qilib yashagan yaxshiroqdir.
proverbList.equivalent:
Go‘ngqarg‘a bo‘lib ming yil yashagandan, Sher bo‘lib bir yil yashagan afzal.
Tiz cho‘kib yashaguncha, Tik turib o‘lgan yaxshi.
Yuz yil qul bo‘lib yashagandan, Bir kun hur bo‘lib yashagan yaxshi.

proverbList.proverb: Three helping one another, bear the burthen of six.
proverbList.explanation: Bir-biriga yordam berayotgan, qo‘llab-quvvatlayotgan uch kishi olti kishining og‘ir vazifasini bajara oladi, ya’ni har qanday murakkab ish birgalashib qilinsa, oson bitadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Birlashgan kuch yengilmas.
Birlashgan – o‘zar, Birlashmagan – to‘zar.
Birdan ikki yaxshi, Ikkidan uch yaxshi.*
Kuch – birlikda.
Ko‘p ko‘padi, Oz cho‘kadi.*
Ko‘p ko‘makka yaxshi, Oz – barakka.*
Ko‘pning ishi yitmas, Ozning ishi bitmas.*
Ko‘pni demay kul bo‘ldim, G‘amg‘ussaga mo‘l bo‘ldim.*
Ikki sulton bir sultonning sirtin yirtar.*
Ikkovga birov botolmas, Otliqqa yayov yetolmas.*

proverbList.proverb: Fool me once, shame on you; fool me twice, shame on me.
proverbList.explanation: Meni bir marta ahmoq qilsang, senga uyat; meni ikki marta ahmoq qilsang, menga uyat. Ya’ni bir kishi boshqa bir kishini bir marta chuv tushursa, chuv tushirgan odamdan xafa bo‘lishadi; agar bir kishi boshqa bir kishini ikki va undan ortiq marotaba chuv tushirsa, demak, chuv tushgan kishining o‘zi ahmoq ekan deyishadi.

proverbList.proverb: First creep, then walk.
proverbList.explanation: Yurishdan oldin emaklashni o‘rganib olish lozim, ya’ni qiyin va murakkab ishni bajarishdan oldin oddiy ishni bajarishni bilib olish lozim.
proverbList.equivalent: Yurishni bilmasang, sakrashga urinma.

proverbList.proverb: Six of one and half a dozen of the other.
proverbList.explanation: Bir narsaning oltitasi va boshqa bir narsaning o‘n ikkitasining yarmi, ular o‘zaro tengdir, ya’ni ikki xil usuldan foydalanilganda ham, bir xil natija berilsa, mazkur maqol qo‘llaniladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Ikki o‘n besh – bir o‘ttiz.

proverbList.proverb: A fool may throw a stone into a well which a hundred wise men cannot pull out.
proverbList.explanation: Bitta ahmoq quduqqa otgan toshini yuzta aqlli odam ham chiqarib ola olmaydi, ya’ni bitta ahmoq qilib qo‘ygan ishini yuzta aqlli ham to‘g‘irlay olmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoqning ahmoqligi ham bosh og‘ritadi, ham oyoq.
Bir shaltoqning ishini Yigirma epchil eplay olmas.

proverbList.proverb: Two boys are half a boy, and three boys are no boy at all.
proverbList.explanation: Ikkita bola yarimta bolaning ishini qiladi, uchta bola umuman ish qilmaydi, ya’ni ish bajaruvchilar qancha ko‘p bo‘lsa, ular bir-biriga tashlagani uchun, ish shuncha sekin bajariladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Sansolar-u mansolar, Otga yemni kim solar.

proverbList.proverb: One hour’s sleep before midnight is worth two after.
proverbList.explanation: Yarim tundan avvalgi bir soatlik uyqu yarim tundan keying ikki soatlik uyquga teng, ya’ni tunning birinchi yarmidagi uyqu foydaliroqdir.

proverbList.proverb: One good deed makes up for a thousand bad ones.
proverbList.explanation: Insonning bitta yaxshi amali uning mingta yomon amalini yopadi, ya’ni yaxshilik qilgan odamning avval qilgan yomonliklari odatda kechiriladi.

proverbList.proverb: It is easy to get a thousand prescriptions but hard to find a cure.
proverbList.explanation: Mingta tavsiya yoki maslahat berish oson, lekin kasallikni davolash yoki biror muammoni amalda hal qilish qiyin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Aytish oson, qilish qiyin.
Aytishga oson, uni amalga oshirish qiyin.
Gapirish oson, bajarish qiyin.

proverbList.proverb: Better the last smile than the first laugh.
proverbList.explanation: Birinchi kulgudan ko‘ra oxirgi tabassum yaxshiroqdir; ya’ni bir ishning oxirida haqiqiy g‘olib bo‘lgan taraf aniq bo‘ladi, ishning nihoyasiga yetmay turib xursand bo‘lgan odam xato qiladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Oxirida kulgan – g‘olib.

proverbList.proverb: A man may lose more in an hour then he can get in seven.
proverbList.explanation: Bir odam yetti soat, ya’ni uzoq vaqt davomida qo‘lga kiritgan narsasini bir soatni ichida qo‘ldan berishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Obro‘ misqollab kelar, Qadoqlab ketar.
Yillab yig‘ilgan boylik – bir oylik.
Yotib yeganga tog‘ ham chidamas.
Yotib yesa tog‘ ham tugaydi.
Yotib yesa tog‘ ham tamom bo‘ladi.

proverbList.proverb: An hour in the morning is worth two in the evening.
proverbList.explanation: Ertalabki bir soat kechki paytdagi ikki soatga teng, ya’ni ertalabki ish kechki paytda qilinadigan ishdan unumliroq bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ertalabki vaqt – naqdgina baxt.
Ertalabki ish, Ko‘ngilni qilar xush.

proverbList.proverb: One hour today is worth two tomorrow.
proverbList.explanation: Bugungi bir soat ertangi ikki soatga tatiydi, ya’ni bugun qilinadigan ishni ertaga qoldirsa, mazkur ish yanada cho‘zilib ketadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bugungi ishni ertaga qo‘yma.
Qolgan ishga qor yog‘ar.

proverbList.proverb:
One today is worth two tomorrow.
One today is worth two tomorrows.
proverbList.explanation: Bitta bugun ertangi kunning ikkitasiga tatiydi; ya’ni bugun qilinadigan ishni ertaga qoldirsa, mazkur ish yanada cho‘zilib ketadi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bugungi ishni ertaga qo‘yma.
Qolgan ishga qor yog‘ar.

proverbList.proverb: Better an egg today then a hen tomorrow.
proverbList.explanation: Ertangi tovuqdan bugungi tuxum yaxshidir; ya’ni ertaga keladigan kattaroq narsadan bugungi qo‘lda turgan kichik narsa yaxshidir, chunki kichik bo‘lsa-da, u naqd, ertangi narsa esa kelishi ham kelmasligi ham mumkin.

proverbList.proverb: Today you, tomorrow me.
proverbList.explanation: Bugun siz, ertaga men, ya’ni bugun siz menga yordam qo‘lini cho‘zsangiz, ertaga men sizga yordam beraman.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bugun – sizdan, Ertaga – bizdan.
Bugun sizdan, Ertaga bizdan.
Sizdan ugina, bizdan bugina.

proverbList.proverb: Hope is a good breakfast but a bad supper.
proverbList.explanation: Umid yaxshi nonushta, lekin yomon kechki ovqatdir, ya’ni faqat umid qilish bilan ish bitmaydi, harakat qilish lozim.
proverbList.equivalent:
Jumadan umiding bo‘lsa, Payshanbadan harakat qil.
Sendan harakat, mendan barakat.

proverbList.proverb: The rich man has his ice in the summer and the poor man gets his in the winter.
proverbList.explanation: Boyning yozda ham muzi bo‘ladi, kambag‘alning qo‘li muzga faqat qishda yetadi, ya’ni boyning qo‘li yetadigan narsalarga kambag‘alning qo‘li yetmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Borga yetti kun hayit, Yo‘qqa – bir kun.
Boyga – shifokor, Kambag‘alga – duo.
Kambag‘al – piyoda, Boy – tuyada.
Kambag‘al osh topsa, Qo‘ygani idish topmas.
Ulkan uydagi kulsa, Kichkina uydagi yig‘lar.

proverbList.proverb:
If you laugh before breakfast you will cry before supper.
Laugh before breakfast, you will cry before supper.
proverbList.explanation: Nonushtadan avval kulsang, kechki ovqatdan avval yig‘laysan, ya’ni xursandchilik doim ham davomiy bo‘lavermaydi, uning ortidan dilxiralik ham kelishi mumkin.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ko‘p kulgan bir yig‘laydi.
Ko‘p yugurgan bir qoqilar, Ko‘p kulgan bir yig‘lar.
Ming kulishning bir yig‘isi bor.

proverbList.proverb: Barnaby bright, Barnaby bright, the longest day and the shortest night.
proverbList.explanation: Avliyo Barnabas (Barnabi) kuni 11 iyun bo‘lib, bu sana ingliz xalqining eski kalendari bo‘yicha yilning eng uzun kuni va eng qisqa tuniga to‘g‘ri keladi.

proverbList.proverb: Every white has its black, and every sweet its sour.
proverbList.explanation: Har bir oqning qorasi ham bor, har bir shirinning achchig‘I ham bor; ya’ni har yaxshi narsaning yomon tarafi ham bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Har kechaning kunduzi, Har kunduzning kechasi bor.
Har oqshomning bir tongi bor.*

proverbList.proverb: Many a good father has but a bad son.
proverbList.explanation: Ko‘pgina yaxshi otalarning o‘g‘illari (farzandlari) yomon bo‘ladi, ya’ni yaxshi insonlarning farzandlari doim ham o‘zlariga o‘xshayvermaydi, ba’zan ularning farzandlari yomon bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Ahmoq otadan – aqlli farzand.
Ahmoqdan – chaqmoq, Donodan – ahmoq.
G‘ayratlining bolasi tanbal bo‘lar.

proverbList.proverb: Have but few friends, though many acquaintances.
proverbList.explanation: Tanish-bilishing ko‘p bo‘lsa ham, do‘sting, ya’ni sirlashadigan va qiyin kunlarda suyana oladigan yaqining kam bo‘ladi.
proverbList.equivalent: Har kimni do‘stim dema, Tandagi po‘stim dema.

proverbList.proverb: Make new friends but keep the old, for one is silver and the other is gold.
proverbList.explanation: Yangi do‘stlar orttirganda, eskilarini yo‘qotma, yangi do‘stlar kumush bo‘lsa, eskilari oltinga teng.
proverbList.equivalent:
Kiyimning yangisi – yaxshi, Do‘stning – eskisi.
Qadim do’stlik zanglamas.

proverbList.proverb: One law for the rich and another for the poor.
proverbList.explanation: Bir qonun boy uchun bo‘lsa, bir qonun kambag‘al uchun ish beradi; ya’ni ba’zi qonunlar boylarning manfaatiga xizmat qiladi, ba’zilari kambag‘alning foydasiga ish beradi.

proverbList.proverb: Do not grieve that rose-trees have thorns, rather rejoice that thorny bushes bear roses.
proverbList.explanation: Atirgulning tikanlari bor deb qayg‘urmang, chunki tikanlar atirgulga zarar yetkazmaydi; aksincha tikanli butalar atirgulni ushlab yoki asrab-avaylab turibdi deb xursand bo‘ling.
proverbList.equivalent: Gul tikansiz bo‘lmas, Dur – sadafsiz.

proverbList.proverb: Penny - wise and pound - foolish.
proverbList.explanation: Penni – aqlli, funt – ahmoq; ya’ni kam miqdordagi pulni odam o‘ylab, aql bilan ishlatadi, ko‘p miqdordagi pulni odam o‘ylamasdan qimmat narsalarga sarflaydi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Bir miri – hayon, Uch miri – ziyon.
Kam bo‘lsa yetar, Ko‘p bo‘lsa ketar.
Oz bo‘lsa yetar, Ko‘p bo‘lsa ketar.

proverbList.proverb:
Give him an inch and he will take an ell.
Give him an inch and he will take a yard.
Give him an inch and he will take a mile.
proverbList.explanation: Inchlab bersang, ellab / yardlab / millab oladi, ya’ni shunaqa odamlar bo‘ladiki, ularga oz miqdorda yordam qo‘lini cho‘zsang, ko‘prog‘ini olishga harakat qiladi va ba’zan bunga erisha oladi.
proverbList.equivalent:
Qo‘lingni uchini uzatsang, yelkangdan tortadi.
Xotinni yelkangga chiqazsang, O‘zi boshingga chiqib oladi.

proverbList.proverb: Mischief comes by the pound and goes away by the ounce.
proverbList.explanation: To‘polon funtlab keladi va auntslab ketadi; ya’ni kelishmovchilik yoki kasallik katta miqdorda kelsa-da, juda sekin tark etadi.
proverbList.equivalent: Dard botmonlab kelar, Misqollab chiqar.

proverbList.proverb: A hundred pounds of sorrow pays not one ounce of debt.
proverbList.explanation: Yuz funt g‘am chekish bir aunts qarzni to‘lay olmaydi, ya’ni qarzni qaytarish o‘rniga turli bahonalar bilan o‘zini g‘am-anduhda ko‘rsatish bilan qarz uzilmaydi.
proverbList.equivalent: Qarz, qarzni berish farz.

proverbList.proverb: A fool may ask more questions in an hour than a wise man can answer in seven years.
proverbList.explanation: Aqlsiz odam bir soatda aqlli odam yetti yilda javobini topa oladigan savollaridan ham ko‘proq savol bera oladi; ya’ni bitta ahmoq o‘ylamay bergan savollariga aqlli odam ham javob topishi qiyin.
proverbList.equivalent: Ahmoqning ahmoqligi ham bosh og‘ritadi, ham oyoq.
